rell_1_scene_10_text: I - I didn’t do anything wrong. I swear!
rell_1_scene_20_text: Seriously! I was just kidding around!
rell_1_scene_30_text: Ah, so you’re a bully AND a liar?
rell_1_scene_40_text: I saw you picking on that group of first-years. C’mon, you can do better. Why not try fighting somebody with years of hardened physical training and an undeniable thirst for justice?
rell_1_scene_50_text: I ONLY PICK ON YOUNGER STUDENTS BECAUSE I’M INCREDIBLY INSECUREEEEE!
rell_1_scene_60_text: I heard screaming! What’s going on?
rell_1_scene_70_text: Hey K — about time you showed up.
rell_1_scene_80_text: I was just showing this kid the consequences of being a grade-A dirtbag.
rell_1_scene_90_text: GAHHHH! KAI’SA! HELP! SHE’S GOT ME IN A SUPER-MEGA CHOKEHOLD! JUST LIKE THE ONE THE KING USED ON THOSE SOLDIERS IN “DERELICT EMPEROR #275”!
rell_1_scene_90_responseA: Rell, let him go right now!
rell_1_scene_90_responseB: There’s a crowd gathering. Drop him before you get us in trouble.
rell_1_scene_90_responseC: Hand him over. I wanna take a swing.
rell_1_scene_100_text: Just doing what we’re supposed to do, K. Defending the innocent!
rell_1_scene_120_text: I’m gonna let you go, kid. But you better apologize to those first-years, and your apology better be super-mega sincere!
rell_1_scene_130_text: I PROMISE! I’ll NEVER HURT ANOTHER SOUL! AHHHHHH!!!
rell_1_scene_150_text: Another win for the good guys.
rell_1_scene_160_text: Rell, you shouldn’t waste your time on bullies like him. We’re Star Guardians. We have bigger threats to face.
rell_1_scene_170_text: Star Guardians are supposed to protect people.
rell_1_scene_180_text: If I didn’t stop that kid, who would?
rell_1_scene_190_text: I - I don’t know. The teachers?
rell_1_scene_200_text: You don’t really believe that. One of our teachers is straight-up evil. And you know I don’t mean in the assigns-too-much-homework kinda way.
rell_1_scene_210_text: C’mon - deep down I bet you wanted to take a swing at him too.
rell_1_scene_220_text: As captain, I have to lead by example. And my example is -
rell_1_scene_230_text: Wait, were you gonna quote from the Star Guardian Daily Planner? Q’s always repeating the one about “the true power of friendship” or whatever! That reminds me…!
rell_1_scene_240_text: Rell! Come back! You dropped your book!
rell_1_scene_270_text: Lux… so you’re the one Q thinks has ALL the answers.
rell_1_scene_290_text: Oh hey, K. Just talking to this statue here. Q says the two of you do it all the time.
rell_1_scene_300_text: What? She told you that? I don’t talk to statues! … Fine, you caught me. But normally I do my talking when I’m NOT wearing my Star Guardian uniform.
rell_1_scene_310_text: Oh! Oops! I was just showing her the new versions of the uniforms. And she was totally agreeing that they are much cooler than the old ones. Silently, of course.
rell_1_scene_320_text: Back to normal - see? Don’t worry! There’s no way anybody saw me transform!
rell_1_scene_330_text: W-was that a Star Guardian transformation just now?
rell_1_scene_340_text: I think it was! Right over by the Lux statue!
rell_1_scene_360_text: Rell! Hey - ! … I never returned her book…
rell_1_scene_370_text: Cool place, T! I mean… I like the food, but all the costumes and storylines are a bit confusing…
rell_1_scene_380_text: Um, could you call me Tali? Or Taliyah?
rell_1_scene_390_text: Sorry, let me try that again.
rell_1_scene_410_text: A-ah, much better… Oh, my order number’s up! I should go get it!
rell_1_scene_420_text: Rell… why are you pretending like you don’t get this place? I bet you’d love it if you gave it a chance. The storyline isn’t any more complicated than this manga you’ve been reading…
rell_1_scene_430_text: Hey… why do you have my copy of “Derelict Emperor”! I mean - uh - what is that? I’ve never seen that before! I have to go! Never speak of this!
rell_1_scene_440_text: Oh, shoot. Looks like I’m next on the VALORANT cabinet. Catch ya later!
rell_1_scene_450_text: Wow, I can’t believe Ekko lets you play VALORANT with him. Everytime I try to join, he says the red gun is broken and he calls dibs on the blue gun.
rell_1_scene_460_text: Yeah - Ekko’s alright. Honestly, your whole team is pretty cool, K. Uh… I-I’m gonna go on patrol.
rell_1_scene_470_text: K, does that deer look suspicious to you? Like it’s going to attack that small child?
rell_1_scene_490_text: OH NO! It just made that baby drop their ice-cream cone! And now they’re crying! UNACCEPTABLE. Hey, Sebastien!
rell_1_scene_510_text: Time to teach that buck a lesson!
rell_1_scene_540_text: I’ve never even heard of someone being kicked out of the park…
rell_1_scene_550_text: I’m really sorry about that. You know how I get around injustice.
rell_1_scene_560_text: On the bright side…Sebastien totally won that fight! That deer will think twice before trying to get a lick of Freljordian FreeZ ever again!
rell_1_scene_570_text: Rell, I hate injustice as much as you do… but you have to learn that your actions have consequences.
rell_1_scene_580_text: This isn’t just about the deer, is it? Because that thing was a menace.
rell_1_scene_590_text: No, it’s not just about the deer.
rell_1_scene_600_text: It’s just hard for me not to help when I see someone in trouble.
rell_1_scene_600_responseA: You’ll alienate everyone around you, and it’ll hurt the team.
rell_1_scene_600_responseB: I can’t fix everything you mess up.
rell_1_scene_600_responseC: When that deer charged me, I saw my entire life flash before my eyes.
rell_1_scene_620_text: I’m just better off alone. Just me - and also Quinn - and Valor and Sebastien sometimes - against the world.
rell_1_scene_630_text: That doesn’t sound very alone to me. You sure you don’t want to talk -
rell_1_scene_640_text: Why does EVERYTHING I do end up hurting people? I can’t keep letting people down! First my parents—and now…
rell_1_scene_670_text: It’s nothing personal, K. I can’t let anybody get close, not again.
rell_1_scene_680_text: I have to go. I… need some space.
rell_1_scene_610a_10_text: I would never purposefully put your friends in danger.
rell_1_scene_610a_30_text: I told Q I’d be no good on a team.
rell_1_scene_610b_10_text: It’s just… I’m just used to being with Quinn. And she kind of lets me do my own thing.
rell_1_scene_610b_20_text: Working together isn’t always going to be… well… a walk in the park, Rell. But we have to give it a try!
rell_1_scene_610b_30_text: I don’t know if I can… or if I want to.
rell_1_scene_610c_10_text: An evil space deer? I wouldn’t put it past her. I bet she’s got squirrells listening in on our conversation right now!
rell_1_scene_610c_20_text: Maybe we should speak in code?
rell_1_scene_610c_30_text: I appreciate you trying to make me feel better, K. But I got you kicked out of your favorite park. Looks like I’M the menace, not the deer.
kaisa_1_scene_10_text: You sure you’re okay with doing this, Kai?
kaisa_1_scene_20_text: It’s not like we have any other choice.
kaisa_1_scene_30_text: I mean… you could come with us?
kaisa_1_scene_40_text: You know I can’t. Someone has to look after Valoran City.
kaisa_1_scene_50_text: Someone has to look after… them.
kaisa_1_scene_60_text: I promise we won’t be a bother, Miss Kai’Sa.
kaisa_1_scene_70_text: I’m not worried about you, Chiizu. But some of your friends…
kaisa_1_scene_90_text: Umi didn’t appreciate what you were implying.
kaisa_1_scene_110_text: But don’t worry, Akali. I didn’t really want to go on the field trip anyway…
kaisa_1_scene_150_text: I went to the capital once when I was younger. Not much to see. Lots of buildings.
kaisa_1_scene_160_text: Yeah, I bet. Staying home and looking after a bunch of weird pets sounds way cooler than seeing history come alive at the world’s only matcha museum.
kaisa_1_scene_160_responseA: That wasn’t on the class itinerary!
kaisa_1_scene_160_responseB: MATCHA MUSEUM?! Please tell me you’re joking.
kaisa_1_scene_160_responseC: You can’t make me jealous. I have plenty of exciting activities planned!
kaisa_1_scene_180_text: Well, one of us has to be responsible…
kaisa_1_scene_190_text: Spare me the self-sacrificing monologue, Kai. Sorry, Captain Kai, of the Star Guardians. Bwahaha!
kaisa_1_scene_200_text: See you in a week! Later, skater.
kaisa_1_scene_210_text: Oh, and Umi… don’t go too hard on her. Heh.
kaisa_1_scene_250_text: No, no! You need to stay behind, with me!
kaisa_1_scene_270_text: That’s right, Ina. We’re gonna have a lot of fun.
kaisa_1_scene_290_text: Yeah, yeah, you’re used to doing fun things with Akali.
kaisa_1_scene_300_text: But maybe my definition of fun is just different! Did you ever consider that?
kaisa_1_scene_320_text: Well, I’m not really taking suggestions for activities, and—
kaisa_1_scene_340_text: That’s not in our budget, Waku! Dad has me on a very strict allowance!
kaisa_1_scene_350_text: Please, everyone! Give Miss Kai’Sa some space.
kaisa_1_scene_360_text: Thanks, Chiizu. You know, you’re the only one that—
kaisa_1_scene_370_text: Though, now that I have a moment… I was wondering if perhaps we’d have some free time to go to a concert. There’s a great singer in town, and I thought we might float by.
kaisa_1_scene_400_text: OH, NO! I spoke out of turn, didn’t I? I’M SO SORRY!
kaisa_1_scene_430_text: I know our friends are off having fun, exploring a cool city, enjoying delicious food…
kaisa_1_scene_450_text: Umi! Jeez, for a manta ray you sure act like an evil empress. Okay, I’ll get to the point—
kaisa_1_scene_470_text: Miss Kai’Sa, I don’t really know anything about high-school physics. I’m a soulful being with the heart of a poet.
kaisa_1_scene_490_text: I’m talking about being the best Star Guardians we can be!
kaisa_1_scene_500_text: Oh—well, we aren’t really guardians, per se…
kaisa_1_scene_520_text: Yes! That’s right, Waku. We are simply adorable companions meant to distract and delight.
kaisa_1_scene_530_text: We aren’t meant to see… combat.
kaisa_1_scene_550_text: Okay, some of us aren’t meant to see combat. Unless we’re transforming weapons, sentient guns-slash-knives, or we explode when thrown.
kaisa_1_scene_570_text: When the rest of the guardians come back, we’ll show them that practice makes—
kaisa_1_scene_590_text: No… perfect, not paninis. But I appreciate the enthusiasm.
kaisa_1_scene_620_text: You’re gonna have to be my right-hand… rabbit this week.
kaisa_1_scene_650_text: I can’t offer you a salary.
kaisa_1_scene_690_text: Ina, wait! I didn’t tell you what I need help with… Stars alive, why are there so many of you?
kaisa_1_scene_710_text: Hmm. Okay… we can spar on Sunday, run some drills after school on Monday…
kaisa_1_scene_730_text: Then, Tuesday, I have journalism club…
kaisa_1_scene_750_text: What, Chiizu?! What is so important?!
kaisa_1_scene_760_responseA: Aru headbutted you again, and you want to write them a sternly worded letter?
kaisa_1_scene_760_responseB: Waku won’t stop beatboxing even after you asked nicely?
kaisa_1_scene_760_responseC: Ina is bragging about the new—well-deserved—responsibilities I gave them?
kaisa_1_scene_170a_10_text: Who said anything about following the class itinerary?
kaisa_1_scene_170b_10_text: Wish I was. I love to joke.
kaisa_1_scene_170b_20_text: But I’ve never been more serious.
kaisa_1_scene_170b_30_text: You’ll take lots of photos, right?
kaisa_1_scene_170b_40_text: Of course! But I don’t think they let us take ‘em during the tasting tour.
kaisa_1_scene_170c_20_text: Uh… I was gonna hang out with some friends from school.
kaisa_1_scene_170c_30_text: We’re your friends from school. Try again.
kaisa_1_scene_170c_40_text: …Go to the hot springs and have a spa day?
kaisa_1_scene_170c_60_text: [Sigh] …I was going to catch up on homework.
taliyah_1_scene_20_text: Taliyah? Did anyone see where Taliyah went?
taliyah_1_scene_30_text: Taliyah? Hey, are you around here?
taliyah_1_scene_60_text: Tali! There you are! I’ve been looking all over for you.
taliyah_1_scene_70_text: Oh! Captain! I apologize. I didn’t mean to cause you any distress.
taliyah_1_scene_80_text: What can I help you with? Hopefully nothing too troubling.
taliyah_1_scene_100_text: You, uh… left your familiar in class…
taliyah_1_scene_120_text: Aru! You silly little thing. Captain, I apologize profusely for Aru’s behavior. Sometimes, they… wander off. I can assure you this won’t happen again.
taliyah_1_scene_140_text: I know nobody can see them, but… if you’d like me to run extra training drills as punishment, I fully support your decision!
taliyah_1_scene_170_text: Yes? Is there anything else, Captain?
taliyah_1_scene_180_text: Nothing, I just… You’re so… different when we’re training… almost like an entirely other person.
taliyah_1_scene_190_text: Ah, yes, well...! It’s, ah… That is true…
taliyah_1_scene_200_text: I… er… Well… it’s just that… um…
taliyah_1_scene_210_text: I-I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to embarrass you! I, uh… Oh, gosh, how do I fix this?
taliyah_1_scene_220_text: N-no worries! I just think I’d rather tell you… away from school. School is kind of… a related problem.
taliyah_1_scene_230_responseA: How about Arcade World? I’m a crack shot on the VALORANT machine.
taliyah_1_scene_230_responseB: The park? It’s really beautiful right now, and super quiet.
taliyah_1_scene_230_responseC: You don’t like… Café Cuties… do you?
taliyah_1_scene_250_text: Don’t worry, it’s not that awkward. You just have to… lean into the fantasy.
taliyah_1_scene_260_text: You go on ahead, Captain! I need to get changed before I meet you.
taliyah_1_scene_280_text: Wait. What do you mean, “get changed”...?
taliyah_1_scene_290_text: What is this menu? “Cutie Puffs with an Extra Special Smooch, Just For You?” “Cutie Coffee with a Dollop of Clouds?”
taliyah_1_scene_300_text: Oh, no! All the items have little characters. “Café Cuties Vladimir offers you a cup of his finest tea, but watch out for his evil nephew…”
taliyah_1_scene_310_text: The cute little tea guy has an evil nephew? Is… is there an expanded Café Cuties universe? There’s, like, fifteen characters! What is happening?!
taliyah_1_scene_320_text: Maybe I died on the walk over. Maybe I’m trapped here. I sinned in life, and Café Cuties is my purgatory.
taliyah_1_scene_330_text: Hey, be nice! I really like this place!
taliyah_1_scene_340_text: Tali! I’m so glad you’re here! This pla… ce…
taliyah_1_scene_370_text: …Hmm? Is there something on my face?
taliyah_1_scene_380_text: Hang on… Okay, did I wipe it off? Captain? Did I get it?
taliyah_1_scene_240a_10_text: Ah… I don’t know if I should go to Arcade World…
taliyah_1_scene_240a_20_text: Too loud? Sorry, I didn’t mean to…
taliyah_1_scene_240a_30_text: Oh, it’s not that. I can get a little… uh… competitive. One time, I told this kid I’d bury his family. It’s… not a great look.
taliyah_1_scene_240a_40_text: What about Café Cuties? They have really cute drinks, and everyone there is super nice!
taliyah_1_scene_240b_10_text: Ah… Targon Park? I know the wishing tree is in bloom, but, uh…
taliyah_1_scene_240b_20_text: Not a fan of wishes? Or trees?
taliyah_1_scene_240b_30_text: No! I mean, yes! I mean… Um, maybe not somewhere outside… At least, not right this minute…
taliyah_1_scene_240b_40_text: What about Café Cuties? They have really cute drinks, and everyone there is super nice!
taliyah_1_scene_240c_10_text: Ahhh, Café Cuties… I’m one stamp away from winning a special meep teacup. It has little eyes! It looks at me!
taliyah_1_scene_240c_20_text: Meep… teacup? I’m not familiar… Café Cuties isn’t exactly my kind of…
taliyah_1_scene_240c_30_text: It’s decided! Café Cuties it is!
taliyah_1_scene_240c_40_text: Oh, man… a maid café? This is gonna be so awkward…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_10_text: Tell me, what would you do?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_20_text: You saved the world, right? I saw you do it. Come on, tell me something!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_30_text: Lux… Please… What should I do?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_40_text: Ugh… I’m talking to a statue. And to myself.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_60_text: It felt like we were finally safe, like you made everything… safe. That’s why I wanted to be like you. But…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_70_text: Hello, class. I come bearing some truly tragic news.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_80_text: Your former instructor… Mr. Puboe? He’s met with a very unfortunate accident during the shocking incident downtown. I’m afraid he won’t be returning.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_90_text: Thankfully, I was willing to step in to help shape your young minds. Though I’m new to the profession, I’m sure we’ll all learn to see eye to eye.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_100_text: Some of us… more than others, I suspect. Hmhmhm.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_110_text: Despite the circumstances… I think we’re going to have a wonderful year together.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_120_text: We can’t transform at school. We can’t reveal our identities…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_130_text: We can’t do anything! How do you fight a monster that’s hiding in plain sight?! I just want to protect everyone!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_140_text: This city looks up to you. They remember the old guardians. I want to… No, I have to be a Star Guardian the way you were. A leader.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_150_text: Lux… Tell me… What do I do?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_160_text: Talking to the statue again, huh?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_170_responseC: Excuse me, I’m with my therapist.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_190_text: Hm? That’s weird… My phone’s going off.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_200_text: Why’s that weird? Ekko is always texting about machine stuff. Or maybe Taliyah “found another rock”.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_210_text: Or… oof, I hope it’s not a giant wall of text from Sona. I love her, but… please… my one brain cell…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_220_text: [“Nice work handling those creatures. Now that we know you can handle yourselves, we should discuss a… mutual problem. Meet us outside the city, alone.”]
chapter_2_act_1_scene_230_text: [“And don’t keep us waiting! You know how I get when I’m BORED!”]
chapter_2_act_1_scene_240_text: [Hm… Must be that monster again… Fiddlesticks. I won’t let it hurt Akali, or the team.]
chapter_2_act_1_scene_260_text: It’s a Sona text, isn’t it? How long? Two paragraphs?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_280_text: I’m so sorry, but I have to go. This is…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_310_text: Hmph. Think you can avoid me? Best-friend-following ninja-jutsu, activate!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_330_text: Don’t judge me, Lux statue. I’m leaning into it.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_350_text: …Guh… Alright… huff… This is the spot.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_360_text: …At least, I think it is. Exact coordinates would have been nice.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_370_text: …Huff… ugh… Flying is… so much easier…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_380_text: I concur. It’s one of our more useful powers.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_400_text: Show yourself, monster! I’m not in the mood for games!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_410_text: Tee-hee! She thinks WE’RE the monster! That’s a fun game. I wanna play THAT one!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_420_text: This isn’t another chance for you to destroy the city. You know what we’re here for.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_430_text: Oh, BOO! I just want to have FUN!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_460_text: Don’t act so surprised. This is not the first time we’ve met.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_470_text: Oh, boy! A widdle baby STAR GUARDIAN! Can I peel off her skin? CAN I?!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_480_text: OooooOOOooooo, wait! She recognizes me! Was it something I did? Was it someone I KILLED?!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_490_text: Silence. You’ve spoken enough, Twilight Star. Empty threats accomplish nothing… and we don’t have much time.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_500_text: Wh… what are you two doing together?! Syndra, you’re a Star Guardian! And that’s...!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_520_text: Or at least, she was one. Though that was many lifetimes ago.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_530_text: Now, I have lots of fun DISINTEGRATING my friends! That’s YOU, widdle guardian!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_540_text: No… I saw Rakan destroy you! The guardians beat you!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_550_text: The entire city watched you die!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_560_text: Awww, are your expectations crushed? Do you need a hug and some sparkles to get over it? Well, TOO BAD!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_570_text: You can’t kill chaos, silly! But that Rakan boy really did put the hurt on me, YEOWCH!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_580_text: It took me AGES to find this world again! And by then, all the guardians I wanted to kill were loooong gone!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_600_responseA: Wait, so why are you both here?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_600_responseB: Syndra, how could you betray the Star Guardians like this?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_600_responseC: Zoe, I’ll never forgive you for what you’ve done!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_630_text: …The checkerboard monster with the awful voice? That’s who you want?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_640_text: It was CHESS! SHE LOVED CHESS!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_680_text: Fiddlesticks is more powerful than any foe I have ever faced. It has existed since the days of the very first Star Guardians… and has hunted us all from the shadows.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_700_text: Zoe, myself, and our companions. The original Star Guardians chosen by the First Star. Back before the costs of our oaths were made clear.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_710_text: We’re gonna SMASH that monster for what it did! I’M GONNA RIP OFF ITS STUPID HEAD!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_720_text: It has grown far too powerful with victims and time. While we are strong, we cannot stop it alone.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_730_text: Prepare yourself and your team. If we strike together, maybe we stand a chance.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_770_text: But what happens after this? What about… her?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_790_text: We’ll cross that bridge if we survive. Until then…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_800_text: …Take care, guardian. The battle ahead may be our last.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180a_10_text: You know… I’m around if you want to talk.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180a_20_text: I… I don’t want you to hear this stuff. These thoughts stay with me.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180a_30_text: We weren’t always Star Guardians, Kai… We were friends first.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180b_10_text: It’s alright, Kai. I’m not going to make fun of you or anything.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180b_20_text: You know, you don't have to talk to a statue. I’m always here if you need me.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180b_30_text: …Thanks, Kali. You know I don’t like asking for help. If I focus on leading the group…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180b_40_text: Well, don’t forget I’m here, okay? I’m not a statue, but you know.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180c_10_text: Oho, look at you! So fancy with your big-city therapist!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180c_20_text: You also live in the city!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180c_30_text: True, but if I needed to talk about my problems on a budget, maybe I’d go to… I dunno… my best friend?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180c_40_text: Akali, we’ve talked about this. Leading the guardians is…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610a_10_text: As I mentioned, we have a mutual problem.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610a_30_text: Morgana? Interesting… So, she’s already here…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610a_40_text: Ooooh, one of your stupid new playmates, Syndra?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610a_50_text: In a certain light. Though I’ve never been very fond of her. Deal with Morgana as you will, young guardian. She is not why we’ve contacted you.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610b_10_text: Ohohoho! Syndra, how COULD you!? The guardians! The First Star! Friendship and love and cookies!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610b_30_text: You are pursuing an ideal you don’t fully understand, girl. Do you think Lux was the first to take the oath? Or Ahri? Or Xayah?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610b_40_text: The First Star’s power comes at a terrible cost. In the end, it takes the only thing that matters… and that is why we’re here.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610b_50_text: Looks like we’re gonna be PALS, widdle baby guardian!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_10_text: That’s right… You witnessed the invasion.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_20_text: The Battle of the Twilight Star… So many people… my friends…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_30_text: Uh-oh! Do we have some UNEXAMINED TRAUMA on our hands?! Oooh, I LOVE trauma!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_40_text: Did they SCREAM when they died… or were they lucky enough to get BOPPED on the head by a falling star?!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_50_text: …YOU won’t forgive ME?! You don’t know ANYTHING! You humans live for a hundred years, and then, you’re GONE! You can’t imagine...! You can’t!
quinn_1_scene_20_text: The story I heard was full of interesting moments. Let this be a lesson, class: Everyone’s life is engaging and unique in its own ways.
quinn_1_scene_30_text: Wait, Green Thumb Leith has an interesting life? Leith, Prince of the Greenhouse?
quinn_1_scene_40_text: Kali! Those are group text nicknames! What if he hears you?!
quinn_1_scene_50_text: So what? He talked about potted plants for like fifteen minutes. If I must suffer, then he must suffer.
quinn_1_scene_70_text: Who knew there were so many types of bean plants? And when he got into root systems and cross pollination…
quinn_1_scene_80_text: I guess not everyone can have a life as exciting as ours.
quinn_1_scene_90_text: That’s all for today, class. Next week, we’ll be starting with… hm… looks like we have Akali—
quinn_1_scene_120_text: Jokes on you. I finished my presentation two weeks ago. Guaranteed A. Though I could always touch it up a little…
quinn_1_scene_130_text: And… Quinn! Alright, everyone. See you bright and early next week.
quinn_1_scene_140_text: Quinn… Why do I know that name?
quinn_1_scene_150_text: Are you serious? She just joined our… you know… “study group.”
quinn_1_scene_160_text: Wait… one of the new kids?
quinn_1_scene_170_text: Yeah, the falconer. Reserved, sort of old fashioned… uh…
quinn_1_scene_200_text: …I’ve been busy helping the rest of you! Stop enjoying this!
quinn_1_scene_230_text: Could we present as a group? I’d really prefer—
quinn_1_scene_240_text: No, I’m sorry Quinn. Only you can tell your story. I don’t want to go over this again.
quinn_1_scene_250_text: Feel free to work with your friends. Didn’t I see you making some new ones the other day?
quinn_1_scene_270_text: Of course, professor. Sorry to bother you.
quinn_1_scene_280_text: So… what are you two gonna talk about?
quinn_1_scene_290_text: Hmm. We can’t exactly mention our… extracurricular activities… at the school.
quinn_1_scene_300_text: Oh, like that’s ever stopped you before.
quinn_1_scene_310_text: HEY EVERYONE, KAI’SA AND I ARE—
quinn_1_scene_330_text: Oh, c’mon. I wasn’t gonna say it.
quinn_1_scene_340_text: Obviously, I can’t talk about family.
quinn_1_scene_350_text: …So I’m planning on sticking to life before the oath.
quinn_1_scene_360_text: Hi, Kai’Sa! Hi, Akali! Are you talking about Star Guardian stuff?
quinn_1_scene_380_text: Uh… we try not to talk about it at school too much.
quinn_1_scene_390_text: Don’t want to give away our secret identities. It’s a whole thing.
quinn_1_scene_400_text: Doesn’t your squad have masks? I haven’t seen any so far, but I dunno. Maybe fake sunglasses? A super long scarf?
quinn_1_scene_420_text: Then what secret identity are you protecting?
quinn_1_scene_440_text: I love this conversation. I love it more than I have ever loved anything.
quinn_1_scene_450_text: …A-ahem! So, Quinn… was there something you wanted to talk about? Other than Star Guardian stuff, I mean.
quinn_1_scene_460_text: Do I talk about Star Guardian stuff too much?
quinn_1_scene_470_text: No, not at all! Though we haven’t hung out much without Rell being there too.
quinn_1_scene_480_text: Well, she’s my best friend. Back home, it was just the two of us fighting for the First Star. You two... you get it, right?
quinn_1_scene_510_text: But we both realized… We don't really know much about you.
quinn_1_scene_520_text: We know you like birds! So that’s one thing.
quinn_1_scene_530_text: I don’t like all birds. Just this one.
quinn_1_scene_550_text: About that… How did you get permission to bring a raptor to school?
quinn_1_scene_560_text: I don’t think the administration minds. He scares all the pests away, so nobody brings it up.
quinn_1_scene_570_text: Ah, that’s where Chiizu went. Hmm...
quinn_1_scene_580_text: [...I should ask Quinn more about herself.]
quinn_1_scene_580_responseB: What do you think of history class?
quinn_1_scene_580_responseC: Can your bird do any tricks?
quinn_1_scene_610_text: Would you want to work on our presentations together? Maybe meet up at the cafe tomorrow?
quinn_1_scene_630_text: I thought we were gonna work together, Kai. You know, as a unit.
quinn_1_scene_640_text: We can all work together. Think of it as… a team bonding exercise.
quinn_1_scene_660_text: Would it be okay if I invite Rell?
quinn_1_scene_690_text: Look at that. We’ve got our own study group!
quinn_1_scene_720_text: W-we don’t have to go! Rell and I know everything there is to know about our hometown!
quinn_1_scene_730_text: …Ugh. I’m sorry. Sorry if things have been weird since we got here, Kai’Sa.
quinn_1_scene_740_text: You mean between Akali and I? No, we were having problems before you two got here—
quinn_1_scene_750_text: We just don’t want to be an intrusion. You have your team, and you already all know each other so well… I don’t want to cause any problems.
quinn_1_scene_760_text: That’s not gonna happen. You’re not a burden, you’re our friend… If anything, Akali is mad at me. She probably thinks you’re incredible because you burned me on the mask thing.
quinn_1_scene_770_text: A-alright, thanks. Things are just so different here in the city… A new squad, a new life… new social landmines. I feel like it’s all moving so fast.
quinn_1_scene_770_responseA: Maybe I can give you a tour!
quinn_1_scene_770_responseB: They’re not so different once you get used to ’em!
quinn_1_scene_770_responseC: Because we lack funding for falconry classes?
quinn_1_scene_790_text: I’m just… not so sure I fit in here.
quinn_1_scene_800_text: Just give it time, Quinn. VC is a lot, but I’m sure you’ll get used to it!
quinn_1_scene_810_text: If you say so. I’ll… I’ll see you at the cafe.
quinn_1_scene_830_text: Akali aside, Quinn was mentioning her old town more than I thought she would.
quinn_1_scene_590a_10_text: It’s a small town. You’ve probably never heard of it.
quinn_1_scene_590a_20_text: I dunno, Kai is pretty good with geography. Right, Kai?
quinn_1_scene_590a_30_text: All I know is that it’s pretty far down the rail line. And that Rell will only talk about how much of a dump it was.
quinn_1_scene_590a_40_text: But… I’d love to know what you think about your town!
quinn_1_scene_590b_10_text: It’s fine, I guess. I definitely didn’t think I’d have to talk about my own history.
quinn_1_scene_590b_20_text: I’m… not really much of a public speaker. Never really had to back home, you know?
quinn_1_scene_590b_30_text: Come on! I’m sure you’ll do great!
quinn_1_scene_590c_10_text: Valor is… not really a show bird. Or even really a bird. He just looks like a bird.
quinn_1_scene_590c_20_text: He doesn’t like games, either. More of the serious type. We used to scout the neighborhood in my old town.
quinn_1_scene_590c_30_text: He’s super serious! Like you, Kai!
epilogue_act_3_scene_50_text: Oh? Apologies, I didn’t mean to…
epilogue_act_3_scene_70_text: In a way, yes. I’m a member of the Outer Guardians.
epilogue_act_3_scene_90_text: Our jurisdiction extends beyond the galactic ring. We protect the universe from threats to reality.
epilogue_act_3_scene_100_text: That said, I don’t get a lot of visitors here. Care to explain yourself?
epilogue_act_3_scene_120_text: Ah, do you number among us as well? I wasn’t aware of any others beyond myself and my old squadmate…
epilogue_act_3_scene_130_text: Which team were you? What, um…
epilogue_act_3_scene_150_text: It’s alright. You are safe here.
epilogue_act_3_scene_160_text: I am Nilah, of the Seventh Layer. Six generations of guardians came before, and many have come after.
epilogue_act_3_scene_180_text: How long was I gone...? How long since…
epilogue_act_3_scene_240_text: Are you alright?! I can help you. Just tell me what…
epilogue_act_3_scene_260_text: You… What’s beneath that patch over your eye...?
epilogue_act_3_scene_270_text: The power radiating from it… I’ve never felt anything like it...!
epilogue_act_3_scene_280_text: Such incandescent emptiness! A power beyond good or evil… What have you brought to this place?!
epilogue_act_3_scene_290_text: I’m warning you, don’t come any closer. I don’t want to hurt you.
epilogue_act_3_scene_300_text: Do you believe you can? The taint of your magic suggests that I should destroy you here and now… Do you agree?
epilogue_act_3_scene_310_text: Yes… a true challenge, a new legendary foe to overcome...!
epilogue_act_3_scene_320_text: It would bring me great joy to face you! Servant of entropy! Slave to the great maw of nothingness!
epilogue_act_3_scene_330_text: Heh. So you don’t really know what’s happening. I hoped you’d give me some answers if I played along.
epilogue_act_3_scene_340_text: Oho, a feint? Well played! Enlighten me to your intentions, worthy adversary.
epilogue_act_3_scene_350_text: No. The time isn’t right… Not yet.
epilogue_act_3_scene_360_text: I don’t even know what I’m capable of… I haven’t had a chance to fight since…
epilogue_act_3_scene_370_text: Zoe… I wonder where she is now...?
epilogue_act_3_scene_380_text: Focus on the face of your enemy! Conquer or be conquered in turn!
epilogue_act_3_scene_390_text: Alright, Nilah. We’ll do it your way.
epilogue_act_3_scene_400_text: I’ve seen the damage the oath can do. The First Star has extracted its price from me. From my friends. When my companion betrayed us, I had to run to survive.
epilogue_act_3_scene_410_text: But I don’t have to run anymore. I found something… something that will break the cycle. If I’m right… no Star Guardian will ever have to run again.
epilogue_act_3_scene_420_text: You can call me Syndra. And I’ve got big plans for this universe… I just need to get past you first.
epilogue_act_3_scene_430_text: And then… all I need is time.
epilogue_act_3_scene_440_text: Ah… to face such a powerful and worthy foe…
epilogue_act_3_scene_450_text: To let our battles rage across the universe for all to witness...!
epilogue_act_3_scene_460_text: I wouldn’t have it any other way.
epilogue_act_3_scene_470_text: I’m glad. Just let me do one last thing… and take off this little eyepatch…
epilogue_act_3_scene_490_text: I… am the end of everything.
epilogue_act_1_scene_40_text: No! No! NO! NO NO NO NO NO!
epilogue_act_1_scene_80_text: CHANGE BACK! I HAVE TO KILL THE STAR GUARDIANS! CHANGE...!
epilogue_act_1_scene_110_text: You’re still weak from the battle, Zoe.
epilogue_act_1_scene_130_text: More than a dozen guardians combined their magic to destroy you… One even sacrificed himself using the power of love.
epilogue_act_1_scene_140_text: Ew! Disgusting! You take that back!
epilogue_act_1_scene_150_text: Ha. I wouldn’t have believed it if I hadn’t seen it myself. They truly, truly hated you.
epilogue_act_1_scene_170_text: They’ll all see...! Soon, they’ll start falling all over again, and…
epilogue_act_1_scene_190_text: Hmph. The Twilight Star herself, brought low by the power of light… Weak, pathetic… vulnerable.
epilogue_act_1_scene_200_text: I wonder what Gwen would think. Or Akshan. Or…
epilogue_act_1_scene_210_text: Don’t you dare say her name.
epilogue_act_1_scene_230_text: I suppose murdering Star Guardians is of no consequence to you at this point. Even murdering our old friends. But bring up Harp…
epilogue_act_1_scene_240_text: I’ll kill you, Syndra! I WILL KILL YOU!!!
epilogue_act_1_scene_250_text: Ow… my arms… I can barely move…
epilogue_act_1_scene_260_text: I could end this here, you know. Right now.
epilogue_act_1_scene_280_text: But you already knew that, didn’t you? In the park, on the night of the battle… before the others arrived. You realized what I’d become. You know what I’m capable of.
epilogue_act_1_scene_290_text: I still think you should have taken the eye patch off.
epilogue_act_1_scene_300_text: One day, Zoe. But not yet.
epilogue_act_1_scene_310_text: So why not do it? Why not just kill me and get it over with?
epilogue_act_1_scene_320_text: Get revenge after all these long centuries. Go ahead. End it right now!
epilogue_act_1_scene_350_text: Hmph. Still no fun at all.
epilogue_act_1_scene_360_text: I watched you kill our friends right before my eyes… and I hated you for it. For thousands of years, I waited for this very moment…
epilogue_act_1_scene_370_text: But we both know this isn’t your fault. Before you became… this… I counted you among my dearest companions.
epilogue_act_1_scene_380_text: Only one is to blame for everything that’s happened to us. The one who started it all…
epilogue_act_1_scene_400_text: Myehehe! And I suppose you want to do something about it? Maybe a team-up, get the ancient survivors back together again?
epilogue_act_1_scene_410_text: Tempting as that may be, no. You might have lost your mind, but our ultimate goals couldn’t be more different.
epilogue_act_1_scene_420_text: I just thought… before everything ends… we should put her to rest.
epilogue_act_1_scene_430_text: One last mission. You and I. Not for the fate of the universe… but for Harp.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_40_text: I had so much fun! All those people, gone forever! And you were right in the middle of it!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_50_text: What’s wrong? You don’t want to remember!? Well, too bad!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_60_text: You couldn’t do anything to save the city then! And you can’t do anything now!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_70_text: I see you, Kai’Sa! You can never hide from me!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_90_text: Kai’Sa? Kai’Sa! Stop daydreaming, we’re trying to train!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_100_text: Oh… sorry, I forgot where I was for a second.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_110_text: Forgot!? You made us come out here, Kai! This isn’t exactly where I want to be on the last day of spring vacation!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_120_text: I thought I would spend every day at the arcade…! So cruel.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_120_responseA: You’ll be glad we trained if monsters attack.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_120_responseB: Video games won’t help you in a life-or-death situation, Akali.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_120_responseC: You haven’t named a single one of your special attacks! This team is shameful.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_130_text: Pff, whatever. Nothing’s attacked this city since we took the oath.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_140_text: Which is fine by me, thanks for asking. I’d rather not relive last year!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_150_text: It’s better to be prepared, ‘Kali. Plus I can test out my powers on old stop signs.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_160_text: More testing, huh? Is that what you do when you skip training?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_170_text: Hm. I’m sure I have no idea what you’re talking about… captain.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_190_text: Sona says you can do it, Ekko! Believe in yourself!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_210_text: Ahhh! I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to editorialize!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_220_text: Heh. This team’s lively as ever.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_230_text: She’s gone mad with rage! Every mouse for themselves!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_240_text: Sona! You’re not supposed to hit your familiar like that! You have to go for their center of mass!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_260_text: One day, that mouse is really gonna get it.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_270_text: Captain! I’m pumped from training and can’t wait to sock a big monster right in its monster face!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_280_text: Good to hear, Taliyah. By the way… you act really differently when you wear that uniform. It’s refreshing.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_290_text: Thanks! I feel more like myself in the outfit.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_310_text: Hey, Tali. Sona’s about to fight her own mouse.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_320_text: What?! The battle of the titans is happening?! Two enter, one leaves?! Oh, I can’t miss this!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_340_text: …You’re sure you’re okay, Kai? You looked kinda pale for a minute. Need to talk?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_340_responseA: It’s nothing. Don’t worry about it.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_340_responseB: I was thinking about last year…
chapter_1_act_1_scene_340_responseC: Who would win in a fight, me or a big robot made of smaller robots?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_360_text: Actually, Kai… I did want to ask you something…
chapter_1_act_1_scene_370_text: Now that people know about the guardians… or, the old ones—not us, obviously, since we haven’t done anything yet…
chapter_1_act_1_scene_380_text: How long before this all ends? All of us, out here, having fun together?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_390_text: What if Zoe comes back? Or something even worse? What happened to the other guardians won’t happen to us… will it?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_400_text: Uh-oh, the sun’s starting to go down! Get back up there, sun!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_410_text: Team? The sun isn’t listening to me. Should we call it?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_420_text: Seems like the right move. I have to get back to my… uh… Well, I gotta get back.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_430_text: Hey, Sona. And Sona’s mouse… thing. What do you think? Training over?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_450_text: She says she’ll race you down the hill! And that you know what my name is!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_470_text: …What? OH, NO! IS THAT NOT WHAT YOU SAID?!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_480_text: MISS SONA, PLEASE! I’M A FACET OF YOUR SUBCONSCIOUS! MISS SONA! AAAAHHHHH!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_490_text: Hey, no fair! That’s a huge head start!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_520_text: Aren’t you all the same age?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_530_text: It’s a mindset, ‘Kali. That’s why I’m the genius inventor, and they’re all a bunch of goofy kids. As out of touch second years, I don’t expect you to understand.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_540_text: Yesterday, you spent a hundred dollars entering a fighting game tournament and got last place.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_550_text: Wow! Wow! I do not recall that experience!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_560_text: I’m so offended that I need to leave this discussion immediately. Bye!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_580_text: Pff, the second I showed him up...
chapter_1_act_1_scene_590_text: At least they’re punctual about something. Come on. We should head out too. I don’t want to run into those middle-aged joggers again.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_600_text: Ugh, good call. Their wraparound sunglasses are… not attractive.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_610_text: Anyway, Kai… I didn’t get to finish my thought.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_620_text: …Do you really think monsters will attack the city again? We haven’t seen any in… well, since the Battle of the Twilight Star.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_630_responseB: No use thinking about it now.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_630_responseC: What about a small robot made of bigger robots? Could I beat that?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_650_text: Sigh… I wish the old guardians would come back. They would know what to do.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_670_text: Hey, it’s alright! Whatever happens, we have each other! Star Guardians stick together. That’s our whole thing.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_680_text: Yeah, I know. I know! Guardians forever, best friends for life.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_700_text: And nothing will ever change that. Not monsters, not being Star Guardians, nothing. No matter what.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350a_20_text: Well, no use worrying about it then!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350a_30_text: If you wanna talk about it later, though… All you have to do is ask. I’m always here for you.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350b_20_text: It’s tough. We’re all still… processing. Kind of crazy how fast they rebuilt the damaged parts of the city, though.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350b_30_text: Sometimes, I remember all those people, and… Ugh, well, you know. You were there, too.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350c_10_text: How big is the robot? If it’s a really big robot, the robot wins. If it’s a slightly smaller robot… 50/50.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350c_20_text: Or… Hmm… In that mecha show, the big train robot beat up a dinosaur. Can you beat up a dinosaur? I’m not so sure.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640a_10_text: I wish I had a better answer.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640a_20_text: If they do… we just have to be ready.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640b_10_text: Just assume we’ll have to fight at some point, Kali.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640b_20_text: If we’re lucky, it’ll be against some small fry.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640c_20_text: Hey, come on. Stop joking around.
tutorial_scene_10_text: W-what is that?! That girl… Is she some kind of monster?!
tutorial_scene_20_text: That’s… That’s the Twilight Star! She’s going to destroy the entire city! W-what do we do?!
tutorial_scene_50_text: Are they… trying to save us…? They’re… incredible!
tutorial_scene_70_text: That vision again… Why is it happening so often, lately?
tutorial_scene_80_text: …Ah, no sense dwelling on it now.
tutorial_scene_110_text: […Oh, you’re awake! Perfect! Remember, there are only a few weeks left before the school year starts.]
tutorial_scene_130_text: [I will absolutely remind you, bunny! We still have to finish your Star Guardian training!]
tutorial_scene_140_text: [Only a few lessons left to go before you're ready to protect the universe! Yay!]
tutorial_scene_150_text: So loud… So early… Ina, please…
tutorial_scene_160_text: [“Ina, please start my training right now?” Sure thing, bunny! Let’s begin with some trivia.]
tutorial_scene_170_text: Fine. I… guess some morning training couldn’t hurt.
tutorial_scene_180_text: [Perfect! Choose the response you think fits best, and I’ll respond in kind. Don’t worry, there are no wrong answers! Be yourself!]
tutorial_scene_190_text: [What is the job of a Star Guardian?]
tutorial_scene_190_responseA: To protect the world from darkness!
tutorial_scene_210_text: Right, I think I’ve got it.
tutorial_scene_220_text: What’s next? Can we move to combat training?
tutorial_scene_230_text: [You sure do like fighting! But first, let's talk about navigation. Being a strong fighter is useless if you can’t get to the battle in time!]
tutorial_scene_240_text: [Your star phone has a special interface, updated by yours truly. Let's take a look now.]
tutorial_scene_200a_20_text: [Although… it's been a while since anything bad happened.]
tutorial_scene_200a_30_text: [But that’s no reason to start slacking off!]
tutorial_scene_200b_20_text: [Your friends are your greatest strength! Well, besides the First Star.]
tutorial_scene_200b_30_text: [So treat them all well, and keep them safe!]
tutorial_scene_200c_30_text: [Y-you can’t do that! It’s against the rules! Hey, wake up! Hey! HEY!!!]
tutorial_scene_200c_40_text: I’m kidding, Ina. Jeez, stop yelling.
ekko_2_scene_10_text: Inventor’s Log: After a few setbacks, I’m prepared to proceed with ChronoDisplacer Test 91.
ekko_2_scene_20_text: Recalibrated the internal zeptometer for more accurate retrieval to the millisecond.
ekko_2_scene_30_text: [It’s been a few weeks since I followed Ekko home…]
ekko_2_scene_40_text: [He was mad at first when he found out. But then he seemed to forget about it…]
ekko_2_scene_50_text: [And now, out of the blue, he invites me over. What’s he playing at?]
ekko_2_scene_70_text: Just in time for what exactly?
ekko_2_scene_80_text: To witness the first successful test of my ChronoDisplacer!
ekko_2_scene_110_text: The title is a work in progress.
ekko_2_scene_120_text: So, this is the “project” you’ve been working on?
ekko_2_scene_130_text: The one that’s been keeping you from coming to training?
ekko_2_scene_140_text: And the reason you missed Mandatory Mochi Monday?
ekko_2_scene_150_text: Yeah, sorry I’ve been slacking on my Star Guardian duties… though uh, nobody likes the mandatory Mondays. Just an FYI.
ekko_2_scene_160_text: But once I get this working, I’ll be back full time. I promise.
ekko_2_scene_170_text: Ugh… fine. So what exactly does this thing do?
ekko_2_scene_180_text: Oh… uh, yeah, I should explain.
ekko_2_scene_190_text: When I became a Star Guardian, the First Light gave me the power to go back in time...
ekko_2_scene_200_text: I remember, Ekko. I was there.
ekko_2_scene_210_text: Oh yeah! I’ll, uh… skip ahead.
ekko_2_scene_220_text: I’ve been experimenting... looking for a way to amplify my abilities.
ekko_2_scene_230_text: I want to increase the distance I can travel backward. The longer the better.
ekko_2_scene_240_text: Where are you trying to go?
ekko_2_scene_270_text: Normally, I can only travel back as far as three minutes.
ekko_2_scene_280_text: But with the help of this machine, I should be able to travel as far back as three years!
ekko_2_scene_290_responseB: That’s not exactly the word I would use to describe it.
ekko_2_scene_290_responseC: What would happen if an insect got into the machine when it’s powered on?
ekko_2_scene_320_text: I thought you said you couldn’t change the past. And why would you even…?
ekko_2_scene_330_text: I just wasn’t thinking hard enough.
ekko_2_scene_340_text: …Wait. Didn’t this neighborhood get hit during the invasion…? The night Zoe attacked…
ekko_2_scene_350_text: I know I can do it. I know I can go back. I just need to figure out a few more things…
ekko_2_scene_370_text: Just have to get there one minute sooner… Even a moment…
ekko_2_scene_410_text: You can talk to me, okay? That’s why you asked me to come here, right? To open up, and get this off your chest?
ekko_2_scene_430_text: Whatever singalongs you’re doing with the rest of the team, that ain’t me. Nice try, though.
ekko_2_scene_440_text: I just need someone to help me operate the machine.
ekko_2_scene_440_responseA: What would I have to do? Push a few buttons?
ekko_2_scene_440_responseC: I don’t even have my driver’s license. Should I be operating heavy machinery?
ekko_2_scene_460_text: …I suppose I do owe you an explanation.
ekko_2_scene_470_text: I was out at the arcade with my friend…
ekko_2_scene_490_text: …! What’s happening?! Is that… some sort of monster?
ekko_2_scene_510_text: I thought he was warning me. But when I turned around, I saw him under the rubble.
ekko_2_scene_520_text: He came out of his coma, but… the doctors still aren’t sure if he’ll walk again.
ekko_2_scene_530_text: So… you think you can save him if you go back to that night.
ekko_2_scene_540_text: If I can get there before. If I can warn him…
ekko_2_scene_560_text: I’m doing this, Captain. Either you can help me, or you can leave.
ekko_2_scene_570_text: I don’t care about when or where we’re “allowed” to use our powers, or how they’re supposed to be used, or whatever dumb rules you come up with. This is my choice.
ekko_2_scene_580_text: Ekko, I’m only… Okay. I’ll do it. Let’s change the past.
ekko_2_scene_590_text: How do we get this thing going?
ekko_2_scene_450a_10_text: Uh… it’s a little bit more complicated than that.
ekko_2_scene_450a_20_text: What do you know about relativity?
ekko_2_scene_450a_40_text: We haven’t had a lecture on relativity this year.
ekko_2_scene_450a_60_text: Just like I know nothing about what you have planned.
ekko_2_scene_450b_10_text: You don’t want me doing something dangerous alone, do you?
ekko_2_scene_450b_40_text: Oh, come on… This is emotional manipulation!
ekko_2_scene_450c_10_text: I won’t tell if you won’t.
ekko_2_scene_450c_30_text: We won’t. If it works, no one is going to get hurt.
ekko_2_scene_450c_40_text: …Hm. Alright, what do you have planned?
kaisa_2_scene_30_text: I don’t think Umi is around here, Ina.
kaisa_2_scene_40_text: Oh, dear. OH, DEAR! We’re going to be in so much trouble.
kaisa_2_scene_50_text: We’ll find Umi. They can’t have gone far.
kaisa_2_scene_70_text: They wouldn’t have gone into the sewer, Waku.
kaisa_2_scene_90_text: Yeah, no, obviously! I’ll go in the sewer! In the sewer with all the sewage! Let me check right now!
kaisa_2_scene_130_text: Don’t say that. Umi is out there somewhere.
kaisa_2_scene_140_text: …We’ll search all of Valoran City if we have to.
kaisa_2_scene_150_text: Great idea, Miss Kai’Sa! I know just where to start!
kaisa_2_scene_160_text: …The school? Your great idea is… the school?
kaisa_2_scene_170_text: Why, Chiizu? Why would Umi come here?
kaisa_2_scene_190_text: The entire school is on a field trip.
kaisa_2_scene_200_text: NOOOO! I’ve led the team astray!
kaisa_2_scene_210_text: I’m a terrible Star Guardian!!! Or adorable Star Guardian familiar! I don’t remember where we landed on that.
kaisa_2_scene_230_text: What do you mean Chiizu just needs some time to cool off? Cool off from what? He looks like a cartoon mouse!
kaisa_2_scene_250_text: Oh, mother of… Yeah, alright, Waku. I’ll give him some space.
kaisa_2_scene_270_text: Huh… Well, there’s probably a better chance Umi would go there than school…
kaisa_2_scene_280_text: YOU’RE RIGHT! IT WAS AN AWFUL IDEA! I’M SO, SO SORRY!
kaisa_2_scene_310_text: I’m not going back up there to get you a “Special Cutie Surprise Special Menu Doughnut with Bonus Smooch.” That’s… I can’t even begin to describe how embarrassing that is.
kaisa_2_scene_330_text: Wait a minute… Can you even eat food?
kaisa_2_scene_350_text: That’s what I thought! You just want the Bonus Smooch! Which is probably just a sticker or something!
kaisa_2_scene_370_text: Now isn’t the time for games, Aru.
kaisa_2_scene_390_text: Oh! You think Umi’s at Arcade World?
kaisa_2_scene_410_text: That makes sense! Akali loves that place, too…
kaisa_2_scene_420_text: She’s always going on about how school is a prison and the arcade is where she does all her real learning.
kaisa_2_scene_430_text: …Which would explain why she’s getting straight Cs.
kaisa_2_scene_450_text: Sure, now I’m boring. Well, lead the way!
kaisa_2_scene_460_text: Umi’s not by the VALORANT machine…
kaisa_2_scene_490_text: Well then. They definitely aren’t here.
kaisa_2_scene_510_text: Maybe we should just call it for today. Look again tomorrow?
kaisa_2_scene_530_text: Hey! That’s my line. I’m the one who says, “We should never give up.” Unless we should give up… you know, for tactical reasons.
kaisa_2_scene_550_text: Noodle Bill’s! It’s so obvious! How did I not think of that?
kaisa_2_scene_570_text: Of course I’m attentive to my team’s needs! It’s just, sometimes, I get so focused on Star Guardian work that I—
kaisa_2_scene_600_text: …W-we should get going! We’re coming for you, Umi!
kaisa_2_scene_620_text: Well, well, Miss Kai’Sa! I think I know why you’re here…
kaisa_2_scene_630_text: Really? You’ve seen a floating… uh… manta ray… thing?
kaisa_2_scene_650_text: I thought you were here to eat ramen…
kaisa_2_scene_650_responseB: Ramen! Yes, of course! That’s why I’m here!
kaisa_2_scene_650_responseC: Floating manta ray!? That would be crazy. Not something I know about…
kaisa_2_scene_660_text: Ha! The look on your face!
kaisa_2_scene_680_text: …And I see you’ve brought more of them. A lot more. An entire little zoo.
kaisa_2_scene_690_text: These things? Uh… yes. They’re my pets!
kaisa_2_scene_720_text: And very talkative, too… This one in particular.
kaisa_2_scene_730_text: Umi! There you are! I’ve looked so many places for you! Places so far apart from one another! On foot!
kaisa_2_scene_740_text: Sorry to bother you, Bill. We’ll get going now.
kaisa_2_scene_750_text: Why not stay a while, Kai’Sa? I think you could use a break.
kaisa_2_scene_750_responseA: Break? Why would I need a break?
kaisa_2_scene_750_responseC: No time, Bill. My many weird pets and I have combat drills to do.
kaisa_2_scene_770_text: Ah… that aroma… The Targon Park bicentennial special tonkotsu… but they only make it once a year...!
kaisa_2_scene_780_text: I wrote that recipe, so really, it’s whenever I decide to make it. Gotta break the rules sometimes if you wanna live long! Wahaha!
kaisa_2_scene_760a_10_text: I’m sure you’ve been running around all day looking for your lost… pet.
kaisa_2_scene_760a_30_text: You know what they say… “Before you take care of others, you must take care of yourself.” I came up with that, by the way. Trade secret.
kaisa_2_scene_760b_20_text: You wouldn’t believe the day I had…
kaisa_2_scene_760b_30_text: I’m sure you’re exhausted. You always put so much on your plate!
kaisa_2_scene_760b_40_text: The only thing on one’s plate that matters… is good food.
kaisa_2_scene_760c_10_text: Training? For what? Normal stuff, I’m sure, but hey, let’s talk about it.
kaisa_2_scene_760c_30_text: Hrm, a competition. You make your pets work as hard as you do!
kaisa_2_scene_760c_40_text: Relax, Kai’Sa. If not for yourself… for them.
taliyah_2_scene_10_text: You think you can take me down?! Not today, First Year!
taliyah_2_scene_20_text: I’m the captain for a reason, Tali! And you just let your guard down!
taliyah_2_scene_30_text: A rookie mistake, one I’ll make you pay for! Rain of Starlight!
taliyah_2_scene_60_text: I let my guard down, huh?! More like you’re the captain of sucking, ha!
taliyah_2_scene_80_text: I think it is! You just used all your energy for your special attack, while I’ve been dodging everything you throw at me!
taliyah_2_scene_90_responseA: You may defeat me here, but I’ll be back! And next time, I’ll be stronger than ever!
taliyah_2_scene_90_responseB: Enjoy your momentary victory, Star Guardian! Though I fall here, my allies will follow!
taliyah_2_scene_90_responseC: If you destroy me with the power of friendship, I will sock your freaking nose.
taliyah_2_scene_100_text: Nice speech, Captain. Now, get ready to ride the pain train!
taliyah_2_scene_130_text: Ow, ow… Can someone help me drink my Macha-Kun Lovely Latte? Or give me my Special Smooch Just For Me? I’m in quite a lot of pain…
taliyah_2_scene_140_text: I-I’m so sorry, Captain! I truly didn’t mean to hit you so hard!
taliyah_2_scene_150_text: Ouch… ugh… It’s totally fine… Good to see you’re… ow, ow, ow… taking to the training…
taliyah_2_scene_160_text: Whew, you weren’t kidding about the pain train. That really smarts.
taliyah_2_scene_170_text: Also… I think the special smooch is just a sticker.
taliyah_2_scene_180_text: Ugh… Foiled again… Just like Viego trying to get to his uncle Vladimir’s exotic teas…
taliyah_2_scene_200_text: Soooo, I guess you like this place now, huh?
taliyah_2_scene_220_text: Also, they did Café Cuties Viego dirty! Sealing him in a prison of crystal tea?! All he wanted was to use the power of the hibiscus fragments to free his wife from the clutches of Earl Grey!
taliyah_2_scene_230_text: Ahem. I’m not fangirling. I’m just… passionate about tea. Let’s change the subject.
taliyah_2_scene_240_text: What happens to you out in the field, Tali? At school, you avoid almost everyone, and you’re super polite… Here, you’re, well… It looks like you work on a crabbing ship.
taliyah_2_scene_250_text: Haha… Yeah, I guess it’s a little confusing.
taliyah_2_scene_260_text: Truth be told… It's the school uniforms.
taliyah_2_scene_270_text: Wait… the ones we have to wear? Like, with the skirts and the blazers? The one I’m wearing right now?
taliyah_2_scene_290_text: They’re not really… hm… my style, I guess. So I don’t really like being seen in them. Anywhere.
taliyah_2_scene_300_text: Of course! That’s why you get changed before we hang out!
taliyah_2_scene_310_text: Right, exactly! I dunno. I don’t like the way those uniforms look on me. They aren’t very… pretty. O-on me! You look fine!
taliyah_2_scene_320_text: Now that I’m in high school, I’ve been trying to figure out my own sense of style… but…
taliyah_2_scene_340_text: Yeah… Sorry, Captain. I know how much you like training… and being a Star Guardian…
taliyah_2_scene_350_text: I like it, too! But… hmm… after the invasion, I spent a lot of time helping my family rebuild. We live by the shops, and a lot of the buildings were badly damaged in the attack.
taliyah_2_scene_360_text: I was going through a lot back then… N-not that everyone else wasn’t! But I felt like I had to put my problems on hold.
taliyah_2_scene_370_text: Then I met you and Akali, I took the oath, and we all started training… Then school started up again… It all happened so fast…
taliyah_2_scene_380_text: Until I can figure out the way I want to dress, I’d rather wear this big hoodie. Then I can make my, you know, fashion debut… without anyone telling me how I should dress.
taliyah_2_scene_400_text: Huh… a fashion problem. You’re so confident as a Star Guardian… I never would have guessed.
taliyah_2_scene_410_text: Like I said, the Star Guardian outfit makes me feel like the person I want to be! If I can find some clothes like that… Well, maybe without the magical space powers…
taliyah_2_scene_420_text: I’m sure I could throw this ratty old hoodie away for good!
taliyah_2_scene_430_text: Uh… and maybe be more confident… at school. A-and other places. Here. The park. Etcetera.
taliyah_2_scene_450_text: Well, as your captain, I’d love to help! Only if you’ll let me, of course.
taliyah_2_scene_460_text: You’re more than my captain, Cap… uh, Kai’Sa. We’re friends! I-I think!
taliyah_2_scene_470_text: Though, uh… you’re not exactly the most… um…
taliyah_2_scene_490_responseA: I do wear this uniform a lot…
taliyah_2_scene_490_responseB: There’s nothing wrong with student-body-president/fit-girlboss casual, Tali.
taliyah_2_scene_490_responseC: I have just become fully evil. I am now your archnemesis.
taliyah_2_scene_510_text: Hmm. You know who’s really on top of fashion trends? Akali.
taliyah_2_scene_530_text: Oh… but are you two alright? You both seem… strained?
taliyah_2_scene_540_text: Ugh... I don’t know. I think we’re okay? It’s… complicated.
taliyah_2_scene_550_text: Regardless! She really likes you, so she’ll totally help update your look!
taliyah_2_scene_560_text: Really?! Oh, Captain, that’s amazing! Thank you!
taliyah_2_scene_580_text: Ow, ow, ow, my back. My sides. My legs. My head. Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow…
taliyah_2_scene_590_text: Argh! I’m really, really sorry! I never should have made you ride the pain train!
taliyah_2_scene_600_text: Café Cuties Bard… take me away…
taliyah_2_scene_500a_10_text: A-and there’s nothing wrong with that, Captain!
taliyah_2_scene_500a_20_text: But, you know, it’s not for me.
taliyah_2_scene_500b_10_text: I’ve been reading a lot of fashion magazines… and I don’t think that’s a thing.
taliyah_2_scene_500c_20_text: I’m going to build a giant, evil castle. With spikes. It’ll be awesome, and you can’t hang out in it.
nilah_3_scene_20_text: How are we supposed to beat this thing?! We’re not strong enough...!
nilah_3_scene_30_text: Show me whatcha got, coward! I’ve been ready to die since the day I was born!
nilah_3_scene_50_text: Wow, we didn’t stand a chance.
nilah_3_scene_60_text: Omega Gromp suffers no fools, Kai’Sa. That’s why he’s Omega, and you are not.
nilah_3_scene_70_text: Stupid VR machine! You made me lag! I got stream sniped! My headset disconnected!
nilah_3_scene_80_text: It doesn’t lag, we’re not streaming, and the headset is literally tied to your head.
nilah_3_scene_90_text: I just can’t believe I got melted by his stupid acid spit! It’s the slowest projectile in the game! It’s slower than the concept of slow! I’m so… freaking…
nilah_3_scene_110_text: How is every member of this squad a toxic gamer? Literally all of you. I feel like we should talk about this.
nilah_3_scene_120_text: You’re very skilled, Rell! If you trusted your comrades a bit more, you’d be nearly unstoppable.
nilah_3_scene_130_text: Ugh, I just hate losing! And in front of Nilah?! I just met her and she’s already my role model!!
nilah_3_scene_140_text: I like her! She is learning to open her heart.
nilah_3_scene_160_text: But what exactly are we supposed to be learning? How to die over and over in a video game?
nilah_3_scene_170_text: Ekko told me this is the most advanced combat simulator on the market. If you can’t figure out how to beat virtual giant monsters as a team…
nilah_3_scene_180_text: …then I could always attract a real monster into the downtown core. A really nasty one. And believe me, I really, really want to fight a giant monster.
nilah_3_scene_180_responseA: What do you mean by “really nasty?”
nilah_3_scene_180_responseB: As captain, I forbid you from endangering this city.
nilah_3_scene_180_responseC: You're Rell's role model? I've been trying to be her role model for WEEKS!
nilah_3_scene_210_text: Why are you smiling if it’s horrifying?
nilah_3_scene_220_text: I don’t know! I’m really intimidated right now! Why did you sound so happy when you said those terrible, terrible things?
nilah_3_scene_230_text: I’m glad you asked! Hundreds of years ago, a joy monster erased my other emotions.
nilah_3_scene_240_text: Great! Awesome! Ekko, how are we doing so far?! Please feel free to jump in as quickly as possible...!
nilah_3_scene_250_text: I’ve reprogrammed Omega Gromp to be extremely aggressive and twice as strong. Been kinda breezy, if I’m being honest.
nilah_3_scene_260_text: I don’t think the average Arcade World employee cares too much about what I’m doing. Or… about anything else.
nilah_3_scene_270_text: Good. Nilah is getting that look in her eye when she senses a good fight, and she’s, uh… saying some very dark stuff? So we should probably start soon.
nilah_3_scene_280_text: One extra difficult VR boss encounter, coming up.
nilah_3_scene_290_text: Alright, team! This time we walk away with the win! Put your headsets on, and pair up.
nilah_3_scene_300_text: I can’t wait to get in there. Let’s see what you’ve all learned.
nilah_3_scene_320_text: Promise me you’ll teach them, Nilah. Until our fight is over… promise me you won’t let them fall.
nilah_3_scene_330_text: You know I can’t do that. It’s not within my power.
nilah_3_scene_340_text: Please, won’t you try? You’re so strong… and their light… it’s in terrible danger…
nilah_3_scene_350_text: If you could go back and save your friends… wouldn’t you...?
nilah_3_scene_370_text: Alright, Luxanna Crownguard. I’ll teach them. I promise.
nilah_3_scene_390_text: Relax, Kai’Sa. I spoke with Ekko beforehand. You’re supposed to be seeing this.
nilah_3_scene_410_text: Are fighting a level-900 Omega Gromp. It’s probably not going well, but you never know.
nilah_3_scene_420_responseB: Is that a little baby planet? It’s so cute!
nilah_3_scene_420_responseC: I’m sorry about the “you being my dad” stuff. Please don’t kill me.
nilah_3_scene_470_text: The truth is, I’m not a teacher. I’m not someone who can tell you how to be a better Star Guardian or how the organization works…
nilah_3_scene_480_text: …But I can teach you how to endure.
nilah_3_scene_490_text: “Star Guardians burn bright, but are destined to fall.” Isn’t that the saying?
nilah_3_scene_500_text: You will give everything, Kai’Sa. This is only the beginning. There will be more threats, and more tragedies, and losses you cannot even begin to imagine.
nilah_3_scene_510_text: This is all I have left. A chunk of rock in a distant, lifeless galaxy… a handful of books… and no one.
nilah_3_scene_520_text: Almost everyone I’ve ever loved is long gone. Nilah isn’t even my real name. The stories of me conquering legendary villains? They’ve replaced the person I once was.
nilah_3_scene_530_text: My days as a young girl… the smile on my mother’s face… I see them in half-formed dreams, yet feel only the weight of this accursed joy.
nilah_3_scene_550_text: Don’t weep for me, Kai’Sa. Despite the loss, the danger, and the constant recitations, I face my future with a smile!
nilah_3_scene_560_text: There is much more to do and see! More lives to change, more foes to face! Friends to fight side by side with, against overwhelming odds!
nilah_3_scene_570_text: We cannot divert from the path we have taken, and we cannot regain what was lost… but we can enjoy what we have, when we have it, and hold it close.
nilah_3_scene_580_text: Hold your friends close, Kai’Sa. Hold them close, and know that darkness will always find you, no matter what form it may take… and try to wrest them away.
nilah_3_scene_590_text: Yet, despite all this… do not be afraid to find your joy, and endure.
nilah_3_scene_610_text: I think I do, Nilah. Thank you.
nilah_3_scene_620_text: Good! Then this little excursion wasn’t a waste.
nilah_3_scene_630_text: It wasn’t, Nilah. You’re extremely terrifying sometimes, but thanks… for looking out for us. I mean it.
nilah_3_scene_640_text: It is no trouble at all, Kai’Sa.
nilah_3_scene_650_text: You and your friends… Stick together, and I think you’ll be alright.
nilah_3_scene_660_text: You’re one of us too, y’know! We’re all stuck with each other now, no matter what you say.
nilah_3_scene_670_text: Ha! I know. I was just waiting for you to admit it.
nilah_3_scene_680_text: Consider your promise kept, Luxanna Crownguard.
nilah_3_scene_690_text: Buuuut… maybe I’ll stick around a while longer. You know… just to see what happens next.
nilah_3_scene_190a_10_text: Imagine a creature so twisted by darkness that looking at it is like throwing your unprotected mind into the core of the sun.
nilah_3_scene_190a_20_text: Its shadow swallows the entire sky. Each footstep is a cataclysm on par with a globe-spanning extinction event, wiping out millions of innocents without so much as a thought.
nilah_3_scene_190a_30_text: I fight monsters like these all the time. And I can find another one for us to take on, if you like.
nilah_3_scene_190b_10_text: Heh. You wish to force me into submission?
nilah_3_scene_190b_30_text: If I recall correctly, you didn’t fare so well last time… and I was holding back. Care to try again at my full strength? I’d love the practice.
nilah_3_scene_190c_10_text: Perhaps you tried too hard, Kai'Sa. Being a role model comes with experience.
nilah_3_scene_190c_20_text: And I've experienced... centuries. I've seen hundreds, no, thousands of Star Guardians just like you rise against the dark, only to be snuffed out like candles in a hurricane.
nilah_3_scene_190c_30_text: I’ve survived, and whether you like it or not, I’ve been charged with making sure you don’t vanish into the screaming abyss like all those who came before.
nilah_3_scene_430a_10_text: This is my little pocket of the universe. That right there? That’s my home.
nilah_3_scene_430a_30_text: It’s all that I need. A place to sit, a few good books, a cup of tea, and silence.
nilah_3_scene_430b_10_text: I’m glad you think so. It’s a place I come to in order to rest and refocus.
nilah_3_scene_430b_20_text: I didn’t expect it to look like this…
nilah_3_scene_430b_30_text: A true warrior doesn’t need much. Just a few essentials, and a little quiet.
nilah_3_scene_430c_10_text: Ha! It was a little strange, but then again… we’re all a bit off, aren’t we?
nilah_3_scene_430c_30_text: That’s the spirit. Embrace your differences, and you won’t need anything else in the world.
taliyah_3_scene_10_text: Uh… I dunno about this one…
taliyah_3_scene_30_text: You’re not looking with a critical eye. You want to accentuate the hips and waistline while drawing the eye across the midsection.
taliyah_3_scene_40_text: I don’t know what that means.
taliyah_3_scene_50_text: Kai, I love you. You know I do. Now get out of this dressing room right now before I stab you.
taliyah_3_scene_100_text: Well, that’s your fault. Just because you can pull off a bucket hat, doesn’t mean everyone can!
taliyah_3_scene_120_text: And what’s so bad about jeggings?! They’re for work and for play!
taliyah_3_scene_140_text: Whatever. Stupid alpaca. Telling me what to do. You don’t even have hands.
taliyah_3_scene_160_text: Sorry, everyone! I don’t mean to be a bother!
taliyah_3_scene_180_text: Thank you, Aru! That’s a very good point!
taliyah_3_scene_190_text: We may not know what works, but we did find out what doesn’t work. That means we’re getting close.
taliyah_3_scene_220_text: Kai, I wouldn’t expect you to know this because your personal fashion is whatever the rules say is mandatory…
taliyah_3_scene_240_text: But Taliyah requires a deft, and fashionable, hand. Process of elimination is still a process. I’m pretty sure you told me that in a very boring speech about something.
taliyah_3_scene_240_responseA: The mathematics of magical artillery is not boring!
taliyah_3_scene_240_responseB: Let’s see how you like it when the enemy switches to mixed-infantry tactics.
taliyah_3_scene_240_responseC: Better hope we never fight alternate versions of ourselves sent by an evil corporation.
taliyah_3_scene_260_text: And I only say that because I love you.
taliyah_3_scene_270_text: Ugh, fine. I’ll give you a pass.
taliyah_3_scene_300_text: Hmm… I have some ideas. Stick here with Kai while I grab some stuff from different stores.
taliyah_3_scene_310_text: You’re not gonna shoplift, are you?!
taliyah_3_scene_320_text: Oh, what’s that? I need Aru’s help for an undisclosed reason? Come on, little buddy. Let’s make some magic happen.
taliyah_3_scene_350_text: Ugh… My dad’s gonna kill me…
taliyah_3_scene_360_text: Heh heh. You two are funny.
taliyah_3_scene_380_text: I hope this works… I would love to find something I can wear that isn’t, you know, gonna blow our cover and reveal our secret identities to the world.
taliyah_3_scene_400_text: Don’t worry about that right now. Akali has… unconventional methods… but I bet she’ll know what to do.
taliyah_3_scene_410_text: I just wanna figure out my own look. It feels so frustrating… This should have been really easy!
taliyah_3_scene_420_text: Every other girl in school did it! I see you all walking around on the weekends… You all look amazing, while I’m balled up in this big, dumb hoodie.
taliyah_3_scene_430_text: Dumb? Why’s the hoodie dumb? I thought it was part of the mystique of figuring out your, you know… big fashion debut.
taliyah_3_scene_450_text: It’s also one of the only things we saved from our old house.
taliyah_3_scene_470_text: N-no, no! It’s not that bad! Everybody came together in our neighborhood and built it all back a hundred times better!
taliyah_3_scene_480_text: It just feels like… this hoodie is holding me back in that time...
taliyah_3_scene_490_text: Like… I can’t move on. I know, it sounds really dumb. But that’s the way I feel.
taliyah_3_scene_500_text: Have you ever felt like you can’t move on, Captain?
taliyah_3_scene_500_responseB: The night of the invasion. I keep seeing it in my dreams.
taliyah_3_scene_500_responseC: How could they do that to Viego?! Of all the Café Cuties, why him?!
taliyah_3_scene_520_text: S-seems like we both have some ghosts.
taliyah_3_scene_540_text: But we’ll figure it out together.
taliyah_3_scene_570_text: Hello! We need to go right now! I may have gone overboard!
taliyah_3_scene_580_text: Hey! Someone stop that girl and her weird, tall dog!
taliyah_3_scene_590_text: We can talk about this later! Book it!
taliyah_3_scene_610_text: Well? What do you bad dudes think?
taliyah_3_scene_620_text: I think I look hot. But approachable. Also, I could kick a monster off the top of a skyscraper. Star kick! Chu chu!
taliyah_3_scene_630_text: There she is. That’s the Taliyah I know.
taliyah_3_scene_640_text: Glad you found your look, Tali. Wanna wear it out? Maybe kick a villain off a skyscraper?
taliyah_3_scene_650_text: Soon, all will be revealed! But not yet. I wanna save it for the exact right moment.
taliyah_3_scene_660_text: Alright, hoodie, looks like you and I are gonna do one last big score before retirement. Yee-haw!
taliyah_3_scene_670_text: Oh, wow. The tag says these leggings are… oh, wow.
taliyah_3_scene_680_text: Kali, how much did these clothes cost?
taliyah_3_scene_700_text: Those are crazy-expensive designer brands. What did you do?!
taliyah_3_scene_710_text: I did what had to be done, O Great and Mighty Captain.
taliyah_3_scene_720_text: Also, I may be banned from the bottom floor of the mall until their security team retires. No big deal.
taliyah_3_scene_740_text: Aaaaand I’m back. What were you two talking about? Doing crimes?
taliyah_3_scene_750_text: Tali! You’re in your academy outfit?!
taliyah_3_scene_760_text: I thought you hated that thing?!
taliyah_3_scene_770_text: Yeah, I did. But after seeing myself in my awesome new outfit…
taliyah_3_scene_780_text: ...I realized maybe it’s not the clothes holding me back. It’s just me. But now… I feel really good.
taliyah_3_scene_790_text: I know I can look cute and kick butt. I wasn’t so sure before… but even having one look set aside really makes a difference.
taliyah_3_scene_800_text: Thanks, to both of you. I really mean it.
taliyah_3_scene_810_text: I still hate these stupid outfits, though. When we graduate, let's burn them.
taliyah_3_scene_820_text: New best friend. Kai’Sa, you’re demoted.
taliyah_3_scene_830_text: Taliyah… Here's your gun and badge. Respect the code of the best friend, and please promise not to commit any more mall crimes.
taliyah_3_scene_840_text: I will literally only do mall crimes.
taliyah_3_scene_510a_10_text: My mom passing was pretty tough. I still think about it sometimes.
taliyah_3_scene_510a_30_text: It’s alright. It happened a long time ago. I was really young.
taliyah_3_scene_510a_40_text: Part of it… never goes away. You learn to cope.
taliyah_3_scene_510b_10_text: Seems like that night hit everybody pretty hard.
taliyah_3_scene_510b_20_text: I was there, Tali. At the epicenter… right in the middle of the battle.
taliyah_3_scene_510b_40_text: It feels like I’m still there sometimes. I hope, one day, that changes.
taliyah_3_scene_510c_10_text: It’s not fair! He just wants to be with his wife!
taliyah_3_scene_510c_20_text: M-maybe you’ve been getting too into the Café Cuties canon…
taliyah_3_scene_510c_30_text: It doesn’t make any sense! If Bard has the cosmic power of brewing the perfect cup of tea, why can’t Vladimir just give Viego the magical hibiscus fragments?!
taliyah_3_scene_510c_40_text: Taliyah, you have made me this way, and that is why we are enemies. I cherish your friendship. We are enemies.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_10_text: So… should we be talking about the shooting star?
chapter_3_act_1_scene_20_text: We’ve talked about the shooting star. At length.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_30_text: Okay, but counterpoint: I want to talk about it more.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_40_text: I agree with Tal. That thing looked a lot like a Star Guardian entering orbit.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_50_text: [“I’ve never seen colors like that. Is it someone new?”]
chapter_3_act_1_scene_60_text: Sona’s asking if it’s a new guardian.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_80_text: Hey, don’t compare me to that talking rat!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_90_text: Honestly… I’m not sure what it was. Normally, Ina would be able to pinpoint the impact site, but with everything going on lately…
chapter_3_act_1_scene_100_text: …Hmph. If we could just find a way to break past Morgana’s aura… As it stands, I can barely sense where any of you are.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_120_text: She’s everywhere, ’Kai. With Fiddlesticks gone, it’s like her power is enveloping the whole city. Seems like everyone’s on edge…
chapter_3_act_1_scene_130_text: Yeah. And now we’re on meet-and-greet duty for the transfer students when we should be finding a way to stop her.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_140_text: I know it’s not ideal, but we beat one monster. We can beat another… We just have to work together.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_160_responseA: She’s doing okay. Just recovering from the battle.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_160_responseB: We’re not doing great. Things have been… tense.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_160_responseC: Probably eating her body weight in noodles somewhere.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_180_text: Strange… I know things have been tough, but with the hallucinations gone, I figured she’d snap out of her spiral.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_210_text: Rell, maybe don’t pick any fights on our first day…
chapter_3_act_1_scene_220_text: C’mon, Q. They were messin’ with us first!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_230_text: We don’t want to draw more attention to ourselves.
