chapter_3_act_1_scene_240_text: Look I’m not gonna let them target my best friend and get away with it. I don’t care who sees.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_250_text: Ugh, this is Kiiso Middle School all over again…
chapter_3_act_1_scene_260_text: Hello, Kiiso High transfers! My name is Kai’Sa, and…
chapter_3_act_1_scene_270_text: Are you gonna bully us too?
chapter_3_act_1_scene_280_text: Don’t be like that, Rell… We should hear what they have to say.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_290_text: Alright, but I’ll keep my eyes peeled for a sneak attack.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_300_text: I have a good feeling about these two. Promise.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_320_text: Hello, everyone. I’m Quinn, and this is Rell. We’re the Kiiso High transfer students.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_330_text: You must be the Valoran City Star Guardians.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_350_text: O-oh, that’s not true! We’d never be… those guys...!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_370_text: I’ve been at it for about a year now, specializing in scouting and reconnaissance. Rell is new.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_380_text: I’m armored cavalry… so put me right in the middle of the action!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_400_text: Quinn, Rell, welcome to Valoran City… and welcome to the squad, I guess!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_410_text: This is Taliyah, Sona, and Ekko. I’m Kai’Sa… and I guess you’ll have to meet Akali later.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_420_text: Once we get better acquainted, you should know what’s going on here.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_430_text: …We’ve been having a bit of a monster problem.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_440_text: …I don’t understand. Why haven’t my visions stopped?
chapter_3_act_1_scene_450_text: Everyone else is fine now… so why not me? I was there! I helped kill that stupid thing!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_460_text: It’s not fair! None of this makes any sense!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_470_text: Why is this happening to me? Why did I ever agree to be a Star Guardian?!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_490_text: Now you’re asking the right questions.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_510_text: You won’t catch me off guard this time, witch.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_520_text: In the middle of the day, no less! Little guardian, I am so very impressed with you. You’ve come a long, long way since that awful beast was stalking you.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_530_text: Not long enough. I’m betting that if I kill you, my nightmares will finally stop.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_540_text: Ah, if only that were the case… but alas, I’m not responsible for those.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_550_text: I’m not here to fight you, child. I’m here to offer… some guidance.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_560_text: Guidance? From you? Yeah, I don’t think so.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_570_text: …A shame about poor Harp, wasn’t it? What a shocking twist! The monster Fiddlesticks was a Star Guardian the entire time.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_580_text: I wonder… What pushed her over the edge? Was it loss? Anger? Hatred?
chapter_3_act_1_scene_600_text: …Or did it come to her in dreams?
chapter_3_act_1_scene_600_responseA: Say another word and you’re a dead woman. If that’s what you even are.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_600_responseB: That sounded like a threat. I don’t like threats.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_600_responseC: I’m not afraid of you. You’re on a teacher’s salary.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_630_text: There it is… that old, familiar darkness...!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_640_text: Ungh! Wh… what is this?! I’m… I’m...!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_650_text: You’re very special, Akali. And very lucky.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_660_text: A multitude of Star Guardians have fallen through the ages… and I’ve helped so many along the way. But you… You have a certain… knack for it.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_670_text: An excruciating enmity with your friends? Recurring night terrors? An overwhelming fear of death?! Oh, Akali! You’re perfect!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_690_text: Kai… why did you… let me fall...?
chapter_3_act_1_scene_700_text: You… You should all… fall… with me…
chapter_3_act_1_scene_710_text: Yes! Give in, Akali! Give in to the darkness of your soul! Give in… and destroy the Star Guardians!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_750_text: Wh… what happened?! What did she do to me?!
chapter_3_act_1_scene_760_text: You couldn’t escape me forever, Morgana. Stand against me… and find your bliss in battle.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_770_text: […Ngh! I can’t face an Outer Guardian here! Not when I’m so close...!]
chapter_3_act_1_scene_780_text: Well… it appears you got lucky, girl.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_790_text: The legendary Nilah coming to this worthless blue dot… hmhmhm. That didn’t factor into my plans.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_800_text: We’ll have to put our duel on hold for now, Outer Guardian. Until then, Akali… I’ll be watching you.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_810_text: Ha! And just like that, she’s gone.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_830_text: …No. I’m bound to protect you and your friends. Facing Morgana is… tempting… but it is not what I promised.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_840_text: What? But we’ve never even met you…
chapter_3_act_1_scene_850_text: I’ll explain later. Come. I should return you to the rest of your team.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_860_text: Heh… team. I haven’t been part of a squad in a long, long time.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_870_text: Are they good friends of yours? Capable?
chapter_3_act_1_scene_170a_20_text: Fiddlesticks’ powers took a big toll on her. She’s been resting since that night.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_170a_30_text: I dunno, Captain. Things seem… different. She’s barely talked to any of us.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_170a_40_text: Might want to reach out when you get the chance.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_170b_10_text: [“Give her a little space. She might come around.”]
chapter_3_act_1_scene_170b_30_text: [“It’s not cute when Chiizu does it, and it’s not cute now.”]
chapter_3_act_1_scene_170b_40_text: Yeesh, alright! The captain’s sign language isn’t perfect yet, but I get it.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_170c_10_text: That sounds perfectly reasonable… but she hasn’t been at Noodle Bill’s in a few days. I asked.
chapter_3_act_1_scene_170c_30_text: I-I don’t know what to do. She’s not answering her texts… and she’s really gloomy in class…
chapter_3_act_1_scene_610a_20_text: I doubt you can handle me… but let’s test the waters a bit, shall we?
chapter_3_act_1_scene_610b_20_text: I doubt you can handle me… but let’s test the waters a bit, shall we?
chapter_3_act_1_scene_610c_10_text: Ugh, the state of the Valoran City education system… It almost makes an interstellar threat such as myself weep for the future.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_10_text: Kali! Hey! Stop walking so fast!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_20_text: I can explain! Would you just listen to me for a minute?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_40_text: Please! I didn’t have a choice!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_60_text: It’s bad enough to have Morgana standing in front of the class every day, but you…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_70_text: You want me to work with Zoe? Do you not remember what she did?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_80_text: Of course, I remember! I was there during the invasion! I saw what happened!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_90_text: I don’t know what you saw. Obviously something different from what I saw.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_100_text: I watched a paddle star destroy my old neighborhood. A building collapsed next to me with people still inside. I saw a Star Guardian actually die.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_110_text: You saw… what? Lux saving the day? Being a big hero, getting a statue? They left us, Kai’Sa.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_120_text: The old guardians are all gone. All of them! They left us here to do this ourselves, and now, I…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_130_text: I am being hunted and tortured by that… that thing. I can’t even go home at night by myself. I hear it everywhere. It’s following me!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_140_text: Akali, I can fix this. The guardians aren’t gone! Syndra said—
chapter_2_act_2_scene_150_text: Stop. Don’t even say her name. As a matter of fact, don’t even say my name. Don’t talk to me, period.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_160_text: Your obsession with being a Star Guardian is… I can’t deal with it anymore. Do you even care how I feel? Do you know what I see when I close my eyes?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_170_text: So many people I cared about are dead. And now there’s nothing stopping me from dying, too. And you don’t even care.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_180_text: I took this stupid oath because I believed in you! You promised nothing would change!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_200_text: I need you to tell me we’re going to win this... that everything will be fine.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_210_text: And I need you to mean it.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_210_responseC: I don’t have an answer for you.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_240_text: Oh, really? Did you tell Sona about Zoe? She sure does love loud noises and crowds after being traumatized by explosions!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_250_text: What about Taliyah, who’s so confident at school? Or maybe Ekko? Our friend obsessed with literally changing the past?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_270_text: Wow. Shocker. Kai’Sa the leader didn’t check in beforehand.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_280_text: We’re done here. I’m sure Fiddlesticks will be a delightful walking companion, whenever and wherever it decides to tell me that I’m going to die.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_310_text: I just… I want to protect you all like Lux did…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_330_text: Well, well! If it isn’t Miss Kai’Sa herself! Welcome back to Noodle Bill’s!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_340_text: Can I treat you to the usual, or...?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_360_text: Let me whip something up for you. On the house.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_370_text: Until then, take a load off! Relax a little. You can eat with your friend.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_400_text: Syndra?! But… you’re… you!? And in your uniform?! What about… but… your identity?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_410_text: Heh. I suppose it’s a bit surprising to see me here.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_420_text: But, as the saying goes… “everyone loves Noodle Bill’s.”
chapter_2_act_2_scene_430_text: Don’t worry about him, by the way. The man can keep a secret.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_440_text: Your friends show up here in uniform all the time. Benefit of being open late—lots of Star Guardian regulars, and they show up very hungry.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_460_text: It’s all of them. And you, twice.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_480_text: Don’t be too hard on yourself. Syndra’s friends were even worse.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_490_text: In fact, I seem to remember…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_500_text: Bill, please, not another one of your stories.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_510_text: What was the bird girl’s name... Xayah! Boy, she used to show up at the strangest hours, and always with that Rakan…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_520_text: Ugh. Those two. By the time I met them, they were… different… but still, so much PDA…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_540_text: I’ve been serving Star Guardians a long, long time. Don’t worry. Your identity is safe with me.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_550_text: And for that, we thank you.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_560_text: Huh… I guess I assumed the old Star Guardians were always saving the day from evil… I didn’t really consider they had another side to them.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_580_text: More like saving the day from Jinx’s little temper tantrums. Or Sarah refusing to talk to anyone or show up for anything.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_590_text: We weren’t that different, Kai’Sa. Most of the group was still in high school… like you and your friends.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_600_text: We had fights, there were falling-outs, people made up. Usually crying. Sometimes ugly crying, with snot.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_610_text: Everyone was constantly embroiled in drama, and there was always some new, horrible monster to fight.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_620_text: It was… nice. Reminded me of… well, my first team. Zoe’s team.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_630_text: Oh, yeah… You mentioned that before. Huh, you and Zoe.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_640_text: Now that you’ve brought it up, I have to ask…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_640_responseA: What happened to your old team?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_640_responseB: Why did Zoe attack the city?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_640_responseC: Did you two have a falling-out?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_660_text: Ramen’s ready, Miss Kai’Sa. I gave you extra fish cakes, just the way you like it.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_680_text: That’s the “Star Guardians having a personal problem” special. I came up with it, oh, three teams ago? Four? I’m old... Who can remember?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_690_text: Four teams ago?! How many times have you served this?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_700_responseA: I’m going to eat this with the fury of one thousand feudal warlords.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_700_responseB: Star Guardian noodles, huh? Alright, let's dig in!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_700_responseC: Thanks, Bill. It was nice talking to you again.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_720_text: The point is, Kai’Sa, that every team has problems. Some are just part of life, but others…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_740_text: Zoe and I… We had the chance to save our teammate from Fiddlesticks. But we didn’t. And in the end, that failure destroyed us.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_750_text: So that’s why you’re really here…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_760_text: Correct. In a way… it’s to put our friends to rest. Something we should have done long ago.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_770_text: Don’t make the same mistakes we did. Not if you don’t have to.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_790_text: Ah, but it’s late. I should be going.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_800_text: I will see you when the creature surfaces, little guardian. I hope you are prepared for the fight to come.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_820_text: Star Guardians are meant to fall, huh…?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_830_text: Akali… No. I won’t let you.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220a_20_text: I’ll be there the next time there’s a monster attack. But you and I? Nah.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220a_30_text: I don’t want to hear from you unless it’s a life-or-death situation. “Best friends.” Pfft.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220b_20_text: You know, I tried to follow you. When you went to talk to that creepy-eyed little murderer.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220b_30_text: Guess what happened? I was attacked by Fiddlesticks. Again! And you didn’t even notice.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220b_40_text: It’s happening almost every day. I can hear it in my room at night. But, oh, you have to be a leader. You have to “be a Star Guardian.”
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220c_20_text: Let me make things clear for you right now, since you’re the big leader of the Star Guardians.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220c_30_text: A woman from nowhere is teaching homeroom in our grade, and sometimes, she decides to summon hundreds of monsters to attack people in the streets.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220c_40_text: I am being hunted… like an animal… by… I don’t even know how to describe it. But I’m pretty sure it’s going to kill me.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220c_50_text: And now, you're gonna make us team up with Zoe—the source of all our nightmares, the reason this all happened!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650a_20_text: Gwen, Akshan, Zoe, myself… and Harp. Most are gone now. Fallen. The ultimate fate of all guardians.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650a_40_text: Sadly, yes. They were kind, gentle souls… Even Zoe, if you can imagine it. Even Akshan, who hated putting on his shirt for some reason.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650b_10_text: Hm. It might be difficult to understand, but… she found a loophole in the oath.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650b_20_text: “Star Guardians burn bright, but all are fated to fall.” We’re killed in battle, or lost… or worse. It’s the price of doing good.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650b_30_text: Wait, so she thought she was… helping people?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650b_40_text: By killing and resurrecting guardians, Zoe voided the contract with the First Star. She… believed she was saving them. Though… There were unintended consequences.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650c_20_text: Something… happened… to one of our companions. Something we didn’t know was possible. Though, in hindsight, it should have been obvious.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650c_30_text: They fell. Zoe couldn’t handle it. She vanished… only to return, twisted and deranged. And then… she… our team…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650c_40_text: …I’m sorry. It happened so long ago, but it’s difficult to talk about.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_50_text: Wahhh, it’s a big scary monster! Oh no! What will I doooo?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_80_text: Well, well. The power of chaos… The Twilight Star. I haven’t seen this sort of display in a while.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_90_text: ISN’T IT FUN!? I’M GONNA PAINT THE WALLS WITH THAT THING’S FACE!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_100_text: GO AHEAD, SYNDRA! THIS MONSTER KILLED HARP! TAKE OFF THE EYE PATCH AND REALLY LET LOOSE!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_120_text: Let’s see if our new friends show up, first.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_130_text: OH, BOO! BREAK OUT OF YOUR COMFORT ZONE! MYAHAHA!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_140_text: Only if I have to. You know what will happen when I do.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_150_text: KNOW?! SYNDRA, I’M COUNTING ON IT!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_170_text: I’m here, but I want it on the record that I don’t like this.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_220_text: I don’t know that! Where’s the annoying rat thing that’s always yelling?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_230_text: Sob, sob… tossed aside! Left behind! Traded in like an old piece of cheese!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_240_text: It’s hard to paint such vivid pictures with words...! Oh, my artist’s pride...!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_250_text: Hey! Focus up! This is serious!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_260_text: I know you’re all upset with me, but Fiddlesticks is a huge threat to the city, and a bigger threat to us.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_270_text: This might be our only chance to stop it… even if we have to team up with someone like Zoe.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_300_text: Oh! Good. That’s… I’m glad you’re okay.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_310_responseA: We’re going to save you. I promise.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_310_responseB: Star Guardians stick together. You’re one of us.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_310_responseC: It’s a dumb checkerboard thing, and we’re going to kick its checkerbutt.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_340_text: …Has Akali been getting enough sleep? She looks exhausted.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_350_text: [“Something’s not right. Kai’Sa, what’s been going on?”]
chapter_2_act_3_scene_360_text: …Fiddlesticks has been hunting Akali. I don’t know for how long.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_370_text: But if we don’t stop it here… eventually, it’s going to kill her.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_380_text: I… I didn’t stop it when I could have. And I didn’t tell any of you… I just… I thought I could fix it…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_410_text: Yeah! This is the biggest monster we’ve fought so far! And I’m still pumped up from last time!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_420_text: Round two, baby! I’m gonna punch its head!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_430_text: [“We can talk it out later. For now, we fight.”]
chapter_2_act_3_scene_490_text: We’re on its home turf now. It’s at the height of its power here.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_500_text: Fiddlesticks is more than any one of us can handle alone. We’ll need to attack together, or nobody’s leaving this place alive.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_510_text: SO NICE OF YOU TO JOIN US, WIDDLE STAR GUARDIAN! EVER SEEN A CHAOS DIMENSION BEFORE!?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_520_text: AS FAR AS THEY GO, THIS ONE’S NOT BAD! SHAME I HAVE TO RIP IT APART! MYAHAHA!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_540_text: No way… We have to fight alongside the Twilight Star…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_550_text: I… I’ll do it! I’m not backing down!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_560_text: Don’t worry, guardians. Remember, she’s on our side this time.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_580_text: …I’ll take the rear. I was able to hide from this thing in the shadows. Might help take it off guard.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_590_text: Not being seen suits me anyway.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_600_text: I’ll go with her. Just in case.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_610_text: Alright, Ekko. Be careful. Everyone else, follow Syndra and Zoe! We fight together!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_660_text: The dark, huh? Poor choice of words!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_670_text: YOU’LL PAY FOR WHAT YOU DID TO HARP! FEED THE FLAME OF CHAOS!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_680_text: I don’t have the flame of chaos or whatever, but I’m plenty strong enough to deal with this chess freak!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_690_text: [“You made a big mistake hurting my friend. Now, it’s personal.”]
chapter_2_act_3_scene_700_text: I won’t let you take Akali! I won’t let you hurt anyone ever again!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_730_text: Ugh… It’s too strong! We didn’t even make a dent!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_740_text: Kai’Sa. That cage in the center has a familiar trapped inside. I think that’s the weak point.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_750_text: A familiar…? Right! Once more, everyone! This time, aim for the cage!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_780_text: Always wanted to say that. Not as cool as I hoped.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_790_text: Is it… Is it finally over…?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_800_text: I think so… hey, what’s that? Are you seeing that?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_840_text: Zoe… It’s so good to see you again.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_850_text: And you brought Syndra, too? What a reunion… I wish Gwen and Akshan could be here for this…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_860_text: Seems like I’ve made a real mess of everything… Guess we should have paid more attention to those oaths…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_890_text: Syndra, what’s going on? Is that… your old teammate?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_900_text: The fate of every guardian is to fall, Kai’Sa.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_910_text: Harp was the first, ever. She burned so brightly… brighter than anyone in the universe… but the First Star had tricked us, and soon enough, she burned away.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_920_text: We couldn’t forgive ourselves after we saw what she became. An undying monster, drawn to guardians on the edge of darkness.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_950_text: Harp! I’m sorry! I’m sorry-I’m sorry-I’m sorry!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_960_text: I tried to save all the guardians I could! I had to kill them! I couldn’t let anyone fall again!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_970_text: Harp… P-please! I was helping! You have to believe me...!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_980_text: Zoe… my best friend… I’m the one who’s sorry. I thought I could keep going… but… I miscalculated… What a novice move…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1000_text: No! NO! I WON’T LET YOU GO!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1010_text: I’LL KILL EVERYONE! I’LL DESTROY EVERYTHING! YOU CAN’T LEAVE ME ALL ALONE AGAIN!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1030_text: I will always… be your best friend… no… matter… what…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1070_text: …They’re fine. In your stupid city, probably.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1100_text: Shut up and listen to what I have to say. I’m leaving. For now, anyway.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1110_text: I don’t know when, but I’ll be back. And when that happens… we’re going to be enemies. You, and me, and all of them, too. I’ll kill every last one of you.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1160_text: All those years… Time really does fly, doesn’t it?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1170_text: [Hm. Myself, Zoe, Morgana, and Fiddlesticks, all in the same place… With so many powerful opponents, she won’t be able to resist the challenge.]
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1190_text: Wait, why? You could join us! We could protect the world together!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1200_text: You’ll be fine. A powerful Outer Guardian is already on her way.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1210_text: Putting Harp to rest was… the last thing I needed to do here. I am done now. My time as a hero has ended.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1220_text: Hey… What are you talking about...? You protected the city from Zoe! There are plushies of you! I own, like, three!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1230_text: I understand your confusion, but I am part of a darker story. A… star in another sky. And it is well past time that I returned.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1240_text: We will also meet again, young guardians. Pray it is not soon.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1250_text: What’s that supposed to mean? What aren’t you telling us?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1280_text: The stars are finally out, guardians… Don’t worry, my old friend will treat you well.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1290_text: Train them to be strong, Nilah. They will need it for the trials to come.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_320a_10_text: Yeah. Whatever. Let’s just kill this thing and get out of here.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_320b_10_text: Yeah. Whatever. Let’s just kill this thing and get out of here.
rell_2_scene_10_text: Hmm. So you want to find Rell when she doesn’t want to be found…
rell_2_scene_30_text: How do you do, young lady! I’m a real-life Star Guardian! Nice to meet ya!
rell_2_scene_60_text: Oh no… I didn't mean to hurt you! You can’t sneak up on me like that…
rell_2_scene_90_text: Uh sir, are you… rolling around in the fetal position?
rell_2_scene_100_text: Yeah…no big deal… completely my fault…
rell_2_scene_110_text: Yeah I’m sure she had her reasons…
rell_2_scene_120_text: But I wonder if Rell being here has anything to do with that book I found…
rell_2_scene_150_text: That’s it! The manga! She must be here to visit the comic shop.
rell_2_scene_160_text: But I thought only the crazy hardcore fans wait in line for preorders. Like, crazy crazy. Taliyah crazy.
rell_2_scene_170_text: If that’s true, then that can only mean…
rell_2_scene_180_text: It’s finally mine! Derelict Emperor volume two hundred and eighty-six, fully colorized and translated! Plus, it comes with a trading card.
rell_2_scene_190_text: In this volume, Derelict Emperor uses the Heart of Camavor as a catalyst, unlocking his ultimate special attack right before the fated showdown with Dread Sentinel Gwenlodias…
rell_2_scene_200_text: And he, uh… you know… he…
rell_2_scene_210_responseC: I don’t wanna spoil anything, but I heard Gwenlodias is the sister of Sir Skarner.
rell_2_scene_220_text: C-c-can I speak with you privately?!
rell_2_scene_240_text: This collection is ridiculous. And these are just the ones you could fit in your backpack? How many manga volumes do you own?!
rell_2_scene_250_text: Whatever I could have shipped to VC. These are some of the rarer editions… plus any I’ve picked up since I moved.
rell_2_scene_260_text: Battle Academia…Steel Valkyries…the Pentakill comics?! I thought these sold out the minute they were listed!
rell_2_scene_270_text: They did. I ordered in the first three seconds.
rell_2_scene_280_text: Can I borrow it? I promise I’ll give it back.
rell_2_scene_300_text: You know… I used to have a lot more manga… some really good ones. But…
rell_2_scene_310_text: …my parents found them last year, and, uh, threw them away. What you’re seeing is what I was able to hide.
rell_2_scene_320_text: Wait, why would they throw your stuff away?
rell_2_scene_330_text: I dunno. Mom and dad had big expectations for me, I guess. Our town is small, but a lot of powerful political families have roots there.
rell_2_scene_340_text: I had to do exactly what they told me so they could get well connected, you know? Horseback riding, student government, being quiet at boring benefit dinners…
rell_2_scene_350_text: And if I did anything they didn’t like… well…
rell_2_scene_360_text: …they’d chase off my friends. Give away my stuff. Send me away for entire summers. I could never get close to anyone…
rell_2_scene_370_text: That’s so awful. I assume your parents don’t keep in touch.
rell_2_scene_390_text: After a while, I couldn’t take the pressure. I just wanted to be able to be myself…my true self.
rell_2_scene_400_text: Turns out being my true self wasn’t good enough for them. I was a “huge embarrassment” that “wasted her unlimited potential.”
rell_2_scene_410_text: I’m actually grateful they shipped me off to VC. I needed a fresh start, away from Kiiso.
rell_2_scene_420_text: But here… I figure it’s best not to make new friends. That way, it’s harder to disappoint anyone.
rell_2_scene_430_text: Quinn knows where I come from. She understands… that I’m always just trying to do what’s right. And that if I push people away, it’s only to protect them.
rell_2_scene_440_responseB: You’re part of a squad now, and we’ll all look out for you.
rell_2_scene_440_responseC: What’s this comic..? “That Time I Was Transported to the Spirit World”?
rell_2_scene_460_text: Rell… you don’t need to be so hard on yourself. You’re cool. We WANT to be your friend.
rell_2_scene_470_text: How about we make a deal?
rell_2_scene_480_text: A deal? What kind of deal?
rell_2_scene_490_text: You be the most authentic Rell you can be. Defend first years, talk to statues, defend babies from evil space deers… No matter what, I’ll stand by your side.
rell_2_scene_500_text: I like where this is going.
rell_2_scene_510_text: But in exchange… you open up to us. Let us be a part of your life.
rell_2_scene_520_text: Okay… maybe I like this a little less…
rell_2_scene_530_text: … Even the part of your life that includes secretly reading manga.
rell_2_scene_540_text: MANGA?! I have no clue what you’re talking about!
rell_2_scene_550_text: Rell! You literally just showed me your collection.
rell_2_scene_570_text: Hmm…I dunno if I can keep my part of the deal. There’s a reason I don’t have too many friends, K.
rell_2_scene_580_text: My family has resources to reach me anywhere. Who’s to say I won’t lose all of you…that I’ll lose Quinn…
rell_2_scene_590_text: Let them try to scare us off! We aren’t going anywhere.
rell_2_scene_600_text: You mean it? Even with all my baggage? You’re really sure you want me around?
rell_2_scene_610_text: No one is perfect. And I’m sure.
rell_2_scene_620_text: Heh. Okay. Let me think about it, alright?
rell_2_scene_630_text: In the meantime, wanna read Derelict Emperor? His only weakness is scorpions, but so far, nobody knows that… except for the Crystal Knight, Sir Skarner.
rell_2_scene_640_text: I ship them for completely normal reasons. You can’t tell anybody, and that doesn’t count as part of our deal.
rell_2_scene_660_text: K, get ready to reach a state of pure enlightenment.
rell_2_scene_450a_20_text: Normally, I’d get really defensive right now. Just an FYI. I’m not great with new… uh… friends.
rell_2_scene_450a_30_text: I don’t know you too well yet… so just… give me time, alright?
rell_2_scene_450b_20_text: I just hope Tali and E feel the same way…
rell_2_scene_450b_30_text: figured if I kept you at a distance, it would make things easier. Rookie mistake.
rell_2_scene_450c_10_text: Are you… unfamiliar with this masterwork of modern literature?
rell_2_scene_450c_20_text: I usually only read assigned textbooks…
rell_2_scene_450c_30_text: So, the story takes place in this fantasy world where a mild-mannered festivalgoer falls into the realm of the spirits…
rell_2_scene_450c_40_text: And then… Er, we can talk about this later. In one volume, this snake lady crushes the protagonist, and it is explicit, if you know what I mean.
quinn_3_scene_10_text: And that… that would be for me to decide.
quinn_3_scene_50_text: You can stop applauding now. I totally bombed up there.
quinn_3_scene_60_text: Just showing my support for the mad bomber.
quinn_3_scene_70_text: Heh. That’s good. I’m keeping that one.
quinn_3_scene_90_text: Oh, yeah. How’d prep go with your new study buddy?
quinn_3_scene_100_text: Not great, actually. We weren’t very productive.
quinn_3_scene_110_text: Oh, noooo. Did her bird eat her homework?
quinn_3_scene_130_text: And she’s one of us now, so be cool.
quinn_3_scene_140_text: I’m being serious. Did her bird—?
quinn_3_scene_150_text: Akali! Your presentation is over. Please, be quiet.
quinn_3_scene_190_text: I know I’m still pretty new here, and many of you don’t know me…
quinn_3_scene_200_text: But I hope that you will soon.
quinn_3_scene_210_text: I spent my whole life in one small town surrounded by huge, sprawling mountains…
quinn_3_scene_230_text: It’s the kind of place where everyone knows each other… No matter where you go, there’s always a familiar face.
quinn_3_scene_240_text: To me, it’s a place where promises are never broken and friendships last a lifetime.
quinn_3_scene_250_text: It was… a fairytale. But fairytales always end.
quinn_3_scene_260_text: My academics were strong enough that I was moved to an accelerated learning program. So… I ended up coming to VC, and leaving Kiiso behind.
quinn_3_scene_270_text: My family, most of my friends, and all the memories I’d made there with them… I thought I’d left them all behind. It… it really scared me.
quinn_3_scene_280_text: I… I thought that my life was over. It was tough to adjust, and in a lot of ways, it still is.
quinn_3_scene_290_text: But I found a new life here, in Valoran City. New friends, new adventures…
quinn_3_scene_330_text: Really?! You didn’t seem nervous at all!
quinn_3_scene_340_text: Oh, yeah. I got some good public-speaking advice from a friend.
quinn_3_scene_360_text: No, from Rell. She said to picture the entire class as a “pack of evil deer” and myself as a brave warrior defending the Valoran City Park…
quinn_3_scene_380_text: It does, haha! That type of thing would only work for her.
quinn_3_scene_390_text: I just pictured everyone as the scary, non-deer monsters we’ve been facing.
quinn_3_scene_400_text: And I pretended I had the team at my side. Rell, of course, featured heavily. When she’s riding Sebastien, she’s, like, eight feet tall.
quinn_3_scene_410_text: I understand. Sometimes, being a Star Guardian can be easier than being…
quinn_3_scene_440_text: This oath we took… it bonds us for life. Shine bright, only to burn out.
quinn_3_scene_450_text: It’s scary… but it’s good, you know?
quinn_3_scene_460_text: Friendship can be so fleeting. One day you wake up… and it’s gone.
quinn_3_scene_470_text: You’ll always remember the friends you left behind in Kiiso.
quinn_3_scene_480_text: Every day. Not because of all the good times we had…
quinn_3_scene_490_text: But because of all the good times we didn’t get to have. You know?
quinn_3_scene_510_text: I mean—I still see her every day. But it’s different.
quinn_3_scene_520_text: What do you miss the most?
quinn_3_scene_520_responseA: We used to sing together at karaoke.
quinn_3_scene_520_responseB: Reading the new chapters of this webtoon she loves.
quinn_3_scene_520_responseC: I just liked laughing with her. It was so easy before.
quinn_3_scene_530_text: You don’t think that can happen again?
quinn_3_scene_540_text: I don’t know. I just know that growing up is a drag.
quinn_3_scene_550_text: Put that quote in the next Star Guardian Daily Planner.
quinn_3_scene_560_text: Ooh. Being quoted in there would be awesome.
quinn_3_scene_570_text: Too bad they don’t take open submissions.
quinn_3_scene_580_text: I have a whole list of quotes, though they probably need some work.
quinn_3_scene_590_text: Aww… I never thought I’d turn down an opportunity to proofread, but I think we have bigger problems to worry about.
quinn_3_scene_600_text: I suppose my dreams of becoming a published author can wait until AFTER we face Morgana.
quinn_3_scene_610_text: … There’s no going back to the way things were, is there?
quinn_3_scene_630_text: We’re the only people that will ever understand what it’s like…
quinn_3_scene_640_text: …to hold the fate of the universe in our hands.
quinn_3_scene_650_text: Yeah. I try to talk to Valor about this stuff, but he’s not a great conversationalist.
quinn_3_scene_650_responseA: You can always talk to me.
quinn_3_scene_650_responseB: Sometimes, it’s best to deal with it alone.
quinn_3_scene_650_responseC: You might say he’s a little… bird-brained? Eh? Ehhhh?
quinn_3_scene_670_text: …You seem like you always have things under control.
quinn_3_scene_680_text: Guess you’re not the only one who wears a mask.
quinn_3_scene_700_text: I mean… I did too. Not as much. You have to work on your delivery.
quinn_3_scene_710_text: Could I… feed Valor? I’ve always been curious… and he seems so hard to approach…
quinn_3_scene_730_text: I like to take him out here and let him fly around.
quinn_3_scene_740_text: It’s as close to Kiiso as we can get.
quinn_3_scene_750_text: I like it here, too. It calms me down when I’m feeling overwhelmed.
quinn_3_scene_760_text: You can see all of Valoran City… the winding streets, the giant skyscrapers…
quinn_3_scene_770_text: It’s beautiful in its own way.
quinn_3_scene_660a_10_text: Thanks. You’re easy to talk to.
quinn_3_scene_660a_20_text: I try really hard to be.
quinn_3_scene_660a_30_text: You don’t need to try. You’re a pro.
quinn_3_scene_660b_10_text: Yeah, I guess I need time to process my thoughts.
quinn_3_scene_660b_20_text: Otherwise, my words come out all “bleh.”
quinn_3_scene_660c_10_text: Hey! He’s really sensitive about those kinds of jokes.
quinn_3_scene_660c_30_text: Sometimes, I don’t think before I speak. It’s… gotten me into trouble before.
quinn_3_scene_660c_40_text: Really? Me, too! I’ll just talk, and it comes out all “bleh.” But you…
kaisa_3_scene_30_text: I know! I can’t believe I slept in so late!
kaisa_3_scene_40_text: But I’m actually feeling more refreshed than I have in… months.
kaisa_3_scene_60_text: There’s no need to say “I told you so…”
kaisa_3_scene_70_text: But you were right. And Noodle Bill was right.
kaisa_3_scene_80_text: It’s important to find a work/life/school/Star Guardian balance.
kaisa_3_scene_90_text: I almost forgot what it was like to sleep in after staying up late watching documentaries… eating an acceptable number of healthy snacks… staying hydrated…
kaisa_3_scene_100_text: You know, typical high schooler stuff!
kaisa_3_scene_120_text: Wh-what!? I can be a typical high schooler! I didn’t even make plans today!
kaisa_3_scene_130_text: I’m chill Kai’Sa. I just go with the flow.
kaisa_3_scene_160_text: What do you want to do, Waku?
kaisa_3_scene_190_text: Does anyone have any suggestions that don’t involve time travel?
kaisa_3_scene_220_text: Rock surfing sounds pretty… cool… I guess…
kaisa_3_scene_240_text: No! I’m not just saying that! I’m sure it’s a lot of fun.
kaisa_3_scene_260_text: I just don’t know where the nearest quarry is… or how to surf… Also, rocks are very hard…
kaisa_3_scene_270_text: I know something we all could do!
kaisa_3_scene_300_text: Wait… Did you stay up all night? You look… unwell.
kaisa_3_scene_310_text: I had to finish the show we started…
kaisa_3_scene_330_text: Do you know how many shows there are? THERE ARE SO MANY!!!
kaisa_3_scene_330_responseA: Maybe you should get some sleep, little guy.
kaisa_3_scene_330_responseB: You’ll never be able to watch them all.
kaisa_3_scene_330_responseC: I know! There are so many… and we didn’t even get to the ones on the internet…
kaisa_3_scene_350_text: Uh… Don’t worry, guys. I’m… sure… Chiizu will be okay.
kaisa_3_scene_360_text: Umi! …We never really talked about what happened.
kaisa_3_scene_380_text: You know exactly what I’m talking about.
kaisa_3_scene_410_text: Of course I’d notice if you were gone!
kaisa_3_scene_420_text: You’re my best friend… ’s familiar. My best friend’s familiar.
kaisa_3_scene_440_text: Do you want to do something today?
kaisa_3_scene_440_responseA: Maybe go to Arcade World? I think they fixed that broken fighting game!
kaisa_3_scene_440_responseB: How about getting a pastry at the cafe? …Or maybe two pastries?
kaisa_3_scene_440_responseC: I mean, rock surfing sounds kind of fun, right? We could try it!
kaisa_3_scene_450_text: Forget that! We could watch more TV!
kaisa_3_scene_470_text: I’m not addicted! I CAN STOP ANYTIME!
kaisa_3_scene_480_text: It’s only one thousand episodes. How long can it take? [shivers]
kaisa_3_scene_500_text: A trip to the park sounds perfect, Umi.
kaisa_3_scene_510_text: I know at least one of us could use some outdoor time.
kaisa_3_scene_520_text: Hey, what are you doing? DON’T TOUCH THE REMOTE!
kaisa_3_scene_560_text: Only thing that would make it better would be…
kaisa_3_scene_590_text: Ever since we became Star Guardians, we haven’t really had a chance to relax.
kaisa_3_scene_600_text: Even though she begs for breaks all the time. Ugh, what am I doing? Why can’t I just be normal sometimes?
kaisa_3_scene_610_text: I guess somewhere along the line, I forgot how to be… me. The me before I took the oath.
kaisa_3_scene_630_text: Yeah. You’re right. I can’t lose sight of what’s important—friends to rely on when the fighting ends.
kaisa_3_scene_640_text: …I’m sure it’ll end. One day. It has to.
kaisa_3_scene_660_text: Haha! And good ramen is important, too. How could I forget?
kaisa_3_scene_670_text: Yeah… a nice, big meal… to share with a friend…
kaisa_3_scene_340a_10_text: SLEEP?! I don’t need sleep! If I sleep, I can’t watch the screen!
kaisa_3_scene_340b_10_text: I can do it! I just need to watch several at the same time.
kaisa_3_scene_340b_20_text: …But then they won’t make any sense to you.
kaisa_3_scene_340b_30_text: It’s not about them making sense. It’s about sEEing aLL tHe piCTurES on tHe scrEEn!
kaisa_3_scene_340c_10_text: Oh, no… How many shows are on there?
kaisa_3_scene_340c_20_text: Unlimited. And a lot of them are free.
kaisa_3_scene_340c_30_text: This is too much! I-I CAN’T PROCESS THIS INFORMATION!!!!
nilah_1_scene_10_text: And you’re sure he’s here? Valoran City?
nilah_1_scene_20_text: Positive. We’d recognize that smiling moron anywhere.
nilah_1_scene_30_text: Luxanna Crownguard didn’t say anything about a chaos-tainted Star Guardian. I should track him down and destroy him before he causes any further damage.
nilah_1_scene_50_text: And if I recall correctly, you made a promise to train these powder monkeys into real fighters. I thought the Outer Guardians didn’t break promises.
nilah_1_scene_70_text: But know that if you fail, I will find and slay Rakan. And there is no force in this universe that will stop me.
nilah_1_scene_90_text: …he’ll come looking for those kids next.
nilah_1_scene_120_text: Hmm? Yes, Captain Kai’Sa of the Star Guardians?
nilah_1_scene_140_text: There’s power in a true name, Captain Kai’Sa of the Star Guardians. You would do well to remember that.
nilah_1_scene_150_text: I… uh… I will do that! I will remember this lesson!
nilah_1_scene_170_text: Let your hair down a little, Kai’Sa. I’m teasing you.
nilah_1_scene_180_text: Haha! I knew that! I totally understood that!
nilah_1_scene_190_text: [Idiot! Your first talk with a real guardian, and you’re blowing it!]
nilah_1_scene_200_text: So… what are you doing? I thought we could get to know each other… you know, if that’s alright with you…
nilah_1_scene_220_text: Maybe you could… show me the ropes? Teach me some Star Guardian wisdom or something?
nilah_1_scene_230_text: “Wisdom?” I’m a warrior, Kai’Sa. I can teach you how to fight, and how to survive.
nilah_1_scene_240_text: But if you insist… I’ll share what I know. I warn you, I may not have your answers. Few Guardians live as long as I have. Of those who have, none recorded their learnings.
nilah_1_scene_260_text: Ask me any question you wish. This first one is a courtesy. The rest you’ll have to earn. Preferably through combat.
nilah_1_scene_270_responseA: What can you tell me about the oath?
nilah_1_scene_270_responseB: Where do all those monsters come from?
nilah_1_scene_270_responseC: I had a dream where you were my dad.
nilah_1_scene_290_text: There. From now on, you will earn your answers through rigor or guile.
nilah_1_scene_310_text: What was that thing you did just now?
nilah_1_scene_320_text: You mean this? It’s a special gesture paired with a recitation. It prevents my power from consuming me, and I must perform it often.
nilah_1_scene_330_text: The recitation isn’t anything special. Usually, I quote literature or an old Star Guardian text. The passage must, however, bring me joy.
nilah_1_scene_340_text: Are you saying you’re constantly on the verge of falling?
nilah_1_scene_350_text: …Not as you understand it, no. Guardians who live long enough may chance upon powers beyond even the First Star’s capabilities.
nilah_1_scene_360_text: As the centuries passed, I encountered one myself. And in our own ways, we both emerged victorious.
nilah_1_scene_380_text: Is that strange? Many Outer Guardians are hundreds or even thousands of years old.
nilah_1_scene_390_text: Thousands of years? What about your families, your friends?
nilah_1_scene_410_text: The oath magically halts aging. All Star Guardians are destined to die in battle or in darkness. There is no third option.
nilah_1_scene_420_text: You will see all that you care for live, grow old, and fade away. Cities will rise and fall, great threats will menace the universe and be destroyed…
nilah_1_scene_430_text: …and you will see your closest friends, those who knew you best… fall in turn. Until, if you are unlucky enough, you are the last one left.
nilah_1_scene_450_text: A prayer, offered for the departed.
nilah_1_scene_460_text: So, everyone you knew is gone? There’s no one left who remembers you?
nilah_1_scene_490_text: Well spoken, old friend. You are wise beyond your many, many years.
nilah_1_scene_490_responseA: I know it’s rude, but how old are you, exactly?
nilah_1_scene_490_responseB: Where’s the rest of your squad? Are they still around?
nilah_1_scene_490_responseC: Is that a hyena ball? A ball that’s also a hyena?
nilah_1_scene_510_text: Ah, I wasn’t supposed to answer another question! Well played, Kai’Sa.
nilah_1_scene_520_text: Th-thanks. You make me really nervous.
nilah_1_scene_530_text: Ha! Luxanna Crownguard mentioned I might intimidate you. I was hoping she’d be right!
nilah_1_scene_540_text: Luxanna… Do you mean Lux? You know Lux?!
nilah_1_scene_550_text: Who do you think asked me to train you?
nilah_1_scene_560_text: I… I… What’s she like?! Did she say anything else?! What did—?
nilah_1_scene_570_text: Another time, Kai’Sa. It is my job to prepare you for the many threats you will face.
nilah_1_scene_580_text: Remember: Do well and win knowledge. Hahaha!
nilah_1_scene_600_text: Alright, time to nail some training.
nilah_1_scene_280a_10_text: A very good question! The oath is a bond between the First Star, the First Light, and a prospective guardian. Think of the First Star as… a broker in a transaction.
nilah_1_scene_280a_30_text: Both Light and Star are very similar—perhaps even one and the same, if the truly ancient guardians are to be believed.
nilah_1_scene_280a_40_text: The First Star is born of the First Light and is its physical manifestation in this universe. The oath we take connects us to that avatar, and through it, we gain power.
nilah_1_scene_280b_10_text: Monsters?! The manifestation of dark forces in the universe, the great hounds of anti-light!
nilah_1_scene_280b_30_text: These beasts are tied to chaos and entropy, spawned from their well of darkness. It is a great cycle that gives us the gift of these colossal foes, so we might test our strength against them!
nilah_1_scene_280b_40_text: …Ahem. My apologies. The idea of facing another titanic beast… Whew, it’s very exciting.
nilah_1_scene_280c_30_text: It’s also not a question, but I’m counting it as one. You have lost your question privileges.
nilah_1_scene_280c_40_text: If this is what I have to work with, I swear…
nilah_1_scene_500a_10_text: My team was the seventh to be inducted. In our day, we were quite the heroes.
nilah_1_scene_500a_30_text: Far too old for high school! Hahaha!
nilah_1_scene_500b_10_text: Sadly, most are gone. The Twilight Star claimed one. Two were lost in a legendary battle for the fate of the universe… though that’s a tale for another day.
nilah_1_scene_500b_20_text: One remains. Though I haven’t seen him in almost a thousand years… I assume he’s still out there somewhere, slaying monsters to prove his strength.
nilah_1_scene_500b_30_text: He was always a proud one.
nilah_1_scene_500c_10_text: She’s more hyena than ball, but it’s an apt description.
nilah_1_scene_500c_30_text: Of course you’re a great warrior. We’re all very impressed.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_40_text: That thing is gigantic! It’s way bigger than the monsters from before!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_70_text: See? Look at that. The darkness isn’t so bad.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_80_text: I think it’s rather beautiful… and the operatic singing voice was a nice touch. Don’t you agree, Herald?
chapter_3_act_3_scene_100_text: Whatever. I don’t care if you kill anyone, I just don’t want to see them die.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_110_text: No? Well, you’ll develop a taste for it eventually. This promises to be quite the show.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_120_text: Do your best, Herald. I await as much death and destruction as you’re able to handle.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_140_text: Be safe, Kai… Just hold on a little longer…
chapter_3_act_3_scene_160_text: Okay, now we’re fighting evil space kaiju? What is going on, Kai?!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_170_text: [“If we don’t stop it soon, that creature will reach downtown! All those people...!”]
chapter_3_act_3_scene_180_text: I’m trying to think of something… It’s so big… If only we had someone who loves fighting giant monsters…
chapter_3_act_3_scene_190_text: Aha! A Dark Herald! I haven’t seen one of these in a hundred years!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_200_text: Worthy enemy, face me in storied battle! Find your joy in the heart of combat, and our legend will dance through time immemorial!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_210_text: Okay, I like her a lot.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_220_text: [“She’s fun and strong! Feels like she’d fit right in!”]
chapter_3_act_3_scene_230_text: Kai’Sa. Do you have a plan? As my acting captain, I defer to you.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_240_text: Me?! Aren’t you an Outer Guardian?
chapter_3_act_3_scene_250_text: I am. But I’m supposed to be teaching you, not doing your job.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_260_text: If I slay this beast for you, what will you learn? Morgana is far more powerful and represents a much greater threat.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_270_text: The deaths of any inexperienced guardians will be firmly on my hands. It would take me twenty… thirty… maybe fifty years to get over the guilt.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_320_responseA: Ekko, take Sona and Tali. Sweep the streets of any smaller creatures.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_320_responseB: Nilah, you’re with me. Rell and Quinn are backing us up.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_340_text: H-hey! Ekko, Sona, wait up! I wanna punch some stuff, too!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_350_text: You’ve been spending way too much time with Taliyah.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_360_text: So now team bonding is a bad thing?
chapter_3_act_3_scene_370_text: I thought I was making good progress, thank you very much!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_380_text: Thanks for coming, you two. The more guardians we have on our side, the more people we can save.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_390_text: And we’d better save ‘em fast. Look at the size of that thing! Sebastien and I are ready to charge that monster like Don Quixote.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_400_text: Ah, a fellow enjoyer of the classics!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_410_text: Mecha Don Quixote uses a lance of meteor metal stolen from the Zalbaxian Empire...!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_430_text: Focus up, team. This is the biggest monster we’ve ever faced, and the safety of the city is in our hands.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_440_text: Nilah, can you cut us a path through the Herald’s attacks? If we can reach that lady on its head, we can win this, but those claws are massive, and there are a lot of them.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_450_text: Without question. They will sing of my skill for all of time.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_470_text: Rell… when we’re through, charge into the Herald’s center of mass. Hit it as hard as you can, as many times as you can.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_490_text: Oh, that’s… erm… okay. Happy about the enthusiasm.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_500_text: Uh… this isn’t your favorite part of the job?
chapter_3_act_3_scene_510_text: Charging in headfirst isn’t everyone’s style, y’know…
chapter_3_act_3_scene_530_text: Quinn, you and Valor stick to me. Once Rell stuns the Herald, you and I are going in for the kill.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_550_text: Get ready, team. It’s just us this time… so let's prove those other victories weren’t flukes!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_570_text: I don’t think we were here for those.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_600_text: Seize the bliss in your heart, and face me!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_610_text: Now it’s my turn, loser. Bad luck!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_620_text: The head is exposed! Valor, to me!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_630_text: I don’t know where you came from, but this is our city! The Star Guardians will never back down!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_660_text: Hmph. Your stupid little friends are stronger than I anticipated.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_670_text: It doesn’t matter. The darkness unleashed by the Herald is more than enough…
chapter_3_act_3_scene_680_text: Yes… Such power… This is what it must have felt like when Zoe became the Twilight Star!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_690_text: Mhmhmhahaha! Justice will die! Entropy will reign forever! And you, girl… You… will bear witness to the birth of a dark new age...!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_700_text: And age without light, without darkness… and without Star Guardians!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_330a_10_text: Got it, Captain. Can we pick a cool team name?
chapter_3_act_3_scene_330a_20_text: [“Later! More of those little monsters are swarming all around the giant one!”]
chapter_3_act_3_scene_330a_30_text: I love fighting those little guys. Put me in, Coach! Chu chu!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_330a_40_text: Right, right, next time! Sona. Tali. Let’s roll.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_330b_20_text: Oh! Oh, no! Is that your game face?!
chapter_3_act_3_scene_330b_30_text: What? I’m trying something new. Go fight those smaller monsters, and I’ll practice my “game face” later.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_330c_10_text: Curious. I do not feel her presence anywhere.
chapter_3_act_3_scene_330c_20_text: I have a really bad feeling about this, Captain…
chapter_3_act_3_scene_330c_30_text: [“We can figure it out later! Right now, there are people to save!”]
chapter_4_act_1_scene_20_text: The final battle is approaching anyway. Enjoy this delicious tension.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_30_text: Besides, what are you going to do? Expose your identities to the public? Endanger your friends and classmates?
chapter_4_act_1_scene_50_text: Tell me what you’ve done with Akali… or… or I’ll…
chapter_4_act_1_scene_70_text: Mhmhmhm. You’re such a funny little girl. So intent on leading, and yet… you can’t be older than sixteen? Seventeen?
chapter_4_act_1_scene_80_text: I’m older than the planet you walk on. Know when to hold your tongue.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_90_text: I-It’s not like you can fight us here, either! Out in the open like this, you wouldn’t stand a chance...!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_100_text: Is that a stutter I hear? How cute. It just makes me want to pinch your cheeks, mhmhm.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_110_text: Ah, but I need to prepare for class. I think the students are coming along quite nicely, don’t you? They have a certain… darkness within them. It’s quite fun.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_120_text: They’re so wrapped up in themselves, they’re not even paying attention to this argument! Mhmhmhahaha!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_120_responseB: The Star Guardians will make you pay for what you’ve done.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_120_responseC: If you’re as old as the planet, how does your skin stay so vibrant?
chapter_4_act_1_scene_150_text: Still no word from Akali, Captain. She hasn’t been to class in weeks.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_160_text: Weeks?! A-are we sure she’s okay?
chapter_4_act_1_scene_170_text: Valor and I have scouted the entire city, and even some neighboring towns…
chapter_4_act_1_scene_180_text: We’ve got nothing to report. She’s gone, Captain. I’m sorry we failed you.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_200_text: You all tried your best. Keep searching, but don’t push yourselves too much.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_210_text: Part of me thinks… this is all my fault…
chapter_4_act_1_scene_220_text: I didn’t listen to her concerns… I didn’t help her when Fiddlesticks attacked… I was just so focused on being a leader, you know?
chapter_4_act_1_scene_250_text: It’s okay. I should get back to the search.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_260_text: During the day, Captain?! You’re going to skip school?!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_280_text: Kai’Sa hasn’t broken a single rule all year… This is big.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_290_text: Don’t worry about me. I’ll let you know if I find anything.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_300_text: Good luck, Kai. Bring her back for us.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_320_text: …I think I know where to find her.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_330_text: We're wide awake now, our eyes are wide open…
chapter_4_act_1_scene_340_text: We're running this world, we keep it turning…
chapter_4_act_1_scene_360_text: You’re here...! Huff, huff...! I’m...! So glad!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_380_text: …I knew you’d be here. I knew exactly where to find you...!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_390_text: Heh. Well, can’t say I’m not impressed.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_400_text: This is where we first met. Right after I got in a fight with those bullies… you found me right over there in the alley.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_410_text: You were all scratched up… and soaking wet… and you looked so angry. Like you wanted to murder everyone in the world.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_420_text: I was just pissed off. Home life wasn’t great, didn’t have a lot of friends…
chapter_4_act_1_scene_430_text: Reminds me of Rell, in a way.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_440_text: She’s a lot like how you used to be, except she has a horse.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_450_text: I am so, so jealous of that stupid horse.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_480_text: So… now that I’ve found you…
chapter_4_act_1_scene_480_responseA: Please come back to the team. I’m sorry for everything.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_480_responseB: If you rejoin, I’ll buy you as much ramen as you can fit in your mouth.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_480_responseC: The guardians need you, Akali. I need you.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_510_text: Don’t “Kali, please” me. How many times have you ignored everything I was saying? Everything I was feeling?
chapter_4_act_1_scene_520_text: I’m just another guardian to you! Just some dumb fighter you can throw at monsters!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_530_text: That’s not true! I care about you!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_540_text: Yeah? We almost never talk about my fears, Kai! You just brush them away!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_550_text: These Star Guardians you love so much—they’re all going to die!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_570_text: Taliyah. Ekko. Sona. Quinn. Rell. You. Me. Hell, even Nilah will bite it sooner or later.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_580_text: This oath is a curse. When I joined the guardians with you, I signed my own death warrant. I just didn’t know it yet.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_590_text: That’s not true! We can save each other from falling! I know there’s a way!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_610_text: Huh. Look at that. It’s starting to rain.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_620_text: When Nilah stopped me from turning… How lucky do you think that was? An Outer Guardian coming to VC? That’s a one-in-a-million chance.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_630_text: The next monster that attacks us… I’m dead. I’m going to die. And there’s nothing you or I can do about it.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_640_text: N-no! Stop saying stuff like that!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_650_text: You know the part that really sucks?
chapter_4_act_1_scene_660_text: You’re so stubborn that you can’t see what’s right in front of you. You can’t see that… I…
chapter_4_act_1_scene_670_text: I’m going with Morgana. I… I’m sorry, Kai…
chapter_4_act_1_scene_710_text: It doesn’t have to end like this! I’m ready now! I can finally save you!
chapter_4_act_1_scene_130a_20_text: That’s all you have to say?
chapter_4_act_1_scene_130a_30_text: I think it gets my point across.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_130b_10_text: My, my. How many times have I heard that?
chapter_4_act_1_scene_130b_30_text: And how many times have I heard that?! It’s never my last, dear! You’ll all die, or fall, or turn on one another… And I’ll just keep on going.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_130c_10_text: Oh, that’s funny. Fishing for beauty secrets? You may be Star Guardians, but at least you respect your elders.
chapter_4_act_1_scene_130c_20_text: I use a little of this and a little of that. Perks of killing guardians, you know… They always have fantastic makeup kits.
sona_2_scene_20_text: [Why would Sona possibly want to meet at the mall now?]
sona_2_scene_50_text: Oh! Hi, Sona! Good to see you at the… crack of dawn?
sona_2_scene_90_text: Thank you for meeting us here so early.
sona_2_scene_100_text: I know it may seem strange to you, but there’s a good reason we chose this place!
sona_2_scene_120_text: W..what?! There is a good reason! I was just adding that part for clarity!
sona_2_scene_130_text: It’s fine, really! I guess we aren’t here to shop, though…
sona_2_scene_150_text: "Maybe later! I was actually hoping to find some books for school."
sona_2_scene_170_text: [Sona forms two L shapes with her hands, tracing along the form of her smile.]
sona_2_scene_180_text: Like I said before, I’m simply translating for Miss Sona. I have no use for academic books! They’re heavy, and very painful when thrown!
sona_2_scene_190_text: Right, I always forget you’re basically a magic butler.
sona_2_scene_210_text: It’s not funny! I’m a powerful magical being from beyond the stars, squeak!
sona_2_scene_220_text: Ahem… We chose this time because the mall is much less crowded.
sona_2_scene_230_text: And less people means less noise. Too much noise drowns out my thoughts.
sona_2_scene_240_text: Drowns out your… What do you mean by that?
sona_2_scene_250_text: It all started one year ago, almost to the day…
sona_2_scene_260_text: When Zoe attacked the city… Miss Sona was there. In one of the residential districts that got hit the hardest.
sona_2_scene_270_text: Right in the center of everything.
sona_2_scene_280_text: [Run! Get out of the way! The stars are falling!]
sona_2_scene_290_text: [Take shelter! Take shelter before… Oh, no!]
sona_2_scene_310_text: She couldn’t move. She couldn’t breathe.
sona_2_scene_320_text: Miss Sona could only watch as her neighborhood was blasted to rubble.
sona_2_scene_340_text: “Screams merged with the sounds of the city. The sirens. The blaring horns.”
sona_2_scene_350_text: “I heard terrible things. It still rings in my ears like a dissonant chorus.”
sona_2_scene_360_text: That’s why Miss Sona is always late for class.
sona_2_scene_370_text: She waits for the rush of people to stop. Businessmen at the train station, students at the school. And of course, for the bell to stop ringing.
sona_2_scene_380_text: Sona… I had no idea. I’m so sorry.
sona_2_scene_410_text: Miss Sona says, “I’m a Star Guardian now.”
sona_2_scene_420_text: When she puts on the uniform… everything is easier.
sona_2_scene_430_text: That’s really nice to hear. I’m glad she has you by her side, Chiizu.
sona_2_scene_440_text: Don’t worry, Miss Kai’Sa, I’m not going anywhere! I’m brave and strong, just like Miss Sona!
sona_2_scene_510_text: Right. All the noise must have scared her off.
sona_2_scene_520_text: Uh, well… Nice costume, I guess.
sona_2_scene_530_responseA: You’re clearly wearing a Star Guardian familiar costume.
sona_2_scene_530_responseB: Oh! I mean: looking good, very real familiar.
sona_2_scene_530_responseC: Not as good as my costume, though… You should see it! Real sparkly.
sona_2_scene_560_text: Don’t forget! It’s Skeeball Sunday! Unlimited rounds all day, only at Arcade World!
sona_2_scene_590_text: Well that was exciting. Looks like the mall is starting to get crowded.
sona_2_scene_600_text: [Sona once more forms two Ls, tracing her smile.]
sona_2_scene_610_text: Ha. You can trust me, Sona. If you’re ever feeling… you know, overwhelmed, I’ll do my best to help.
sona_2_scene_660_text: Sona, it’ll be alright. Just take deep breaths.
sona_2_scene_700_text: Uh… Sona! Do you hear that?
sona_2_scene_720_text: Try focusing on just one sound...
sona_2_scene_720_responseA: The clang of tokens in the change machine?
sona_2_scene_720_responseB: The clunk of skee balls into the pocket?
sona_2_scene_720_responseC: The clattering of feet on the hard tile floor?
sona_2_scene_750_text: New high score! Take THAT, Omega Cypher!
sona_2_scene_800_text: [Sona winces, lowering her hands from her ears to sign.]
sona_2_scene_810_text: Where is Chiizu?! Ugh, that stupid mall mascot ruined everything!
sona_2_scene_540a_10_text: No… I’m real! As real as the Star Guardians themselves!
sona_2_scene_540a_20_text: Come on, man! You’re ruining it for the kids!
sona_2_scene_540b_20_text: You’re much bigger than I remember.
sona_2_scene_540b_30_text: Yeah, I had a growth spurt. A normal familiar thing.
sona_2_scene_540c_10_text: You have a Star Guardian costume?! I’m so jealous.
sona_2_scene_540c_20_text: Yeah, it’s no big deal… kinda tight around the haunches.
sona_2_scene_540c_30_text: Bet it’s not as sweaty as this one. Plus, I can’t even take it home!
sona_2_scene_540c_40_text: Why would you… take it… home? Actually, I don’t want to know.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_30_text: …Ugh, It feels like I’ve been in school for a thousand years.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_40_text: How did we get Instructor Puboe for homeroom? It’s like I’m in prison.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_50_text: I dunno. I think I could take him.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_60_text: Transform into a Star Guardian. Throw, like, a hundred knives. And then I’d say something cool, like, um...
chapter_1_act_2_scene_70_text: “Take that, Puboe! You’ll never assign six-page essays on a Friday again!”
chapter_1_act_2_scene_80_text: I dunno, what do you think?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_80_responseA: Don’t joke about using your powers like that.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_80_responseB: We can’t transform to hurt civilians. Even a villain like Puboe.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_110_text: By the way, are you training with us this weekend? You haven’t been around the past few weeks… I’ve been worried.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_120_text: Oh, yeah… Maybe next time. I’m trying to catch up on some stuff…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_130_text: Akali, come on. What if monsters attack? What if the city is in danger?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_150_text: Everyone remembers Lux and Ahri and their squads. There are statues of them. We have a responsibility to protect people.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_160_text: Are you just going to skip your training and let everyone down?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_180_text: Let everyone down?! What are you talking about?!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_190_text: I train with you all the time. All you care about anymore is being a Star Guardian! I thought you said nothing was going to change between us!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_200_text: W-what?! Hey, we’re both leaders here!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_210_text: Leaders?! Who cares! When was the last time we hung out outside of stupid training!?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_230_text: We’re walking home from school, and you’re still making it about being a guardian! You won’t even let me crack a joke!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_250_text: You know what? You’re right. You are right.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_280_text: Kali… Have you been seeing things recently? Visions of the invasion?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_300_text: I haven’t been sleeping well since school started. If I focus on the team, it’s… easier to deal with.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_320_text: Kai, I’ve been seeing things too. Hearing things.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_330_text: I keep thinking about that night last year… all those people…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_340_text: This entire neighborhood was pummeled by falling stars. How many people died here? The city rebuilt so fast… I…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_350_text: I can’t get them out of my head. It’s like I’m being haunted by their ghosts.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_360_text: I keep wondering if this is what being a guardian will always feel like. I really hope it isn’t.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_370_text: And now I think… I think something’s been following me.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_370_responseA: Following you? What does that mean?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_370_responseB: Is it a monster? You’re pretty strong… Can’t you fight it?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_370_responseC: …Have you ever met a guy named Tedric?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_450_text: Sure, let’s… Hey… What’s happening to the streets?!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_480_text: What… What the hell is that…? Where are we?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_490_text: I… I don’t know..! Is that what’s been following me?!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_500_text: This fear...! Kai, I can’t transform…! I can’t focus!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_540_text: I’ll protect you. I’ll protect you from everything.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_560_text: Hear that?! You’re not going near her! I won’t let you!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_570_text: Erh… urp... all… Star... Guardians… must…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_590_text: Huh? Is that it? Where’s it going?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_600_text: You running away? Afraid of the new guardians, huh?!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_610_text: Oh, I don’t think that’s the case at all, my sweet. You’re very lucky.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_620_text: Ah, much better. Your kind tends to prefer the shackles of an… ordered world, I believe? Can’t have all this bright purple mucking everything up.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_630_text: Regardless. My friend is far more powerful than you realize. You and that blubbering sick pile wouldn’t have stood a chance.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_660_text: You were able to transform despite the aura of fear? Very impressive.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_670_text: I’ll have to keep an eye on you, won’t I? Hmhmhm.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_680_text: Tell me who you are before I blow you to pieces.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_690_text: You? Oh, please. I was half expecting that monster to eat you both alive.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_700_text: It’s an odd one, though. Seems to act almost randomly… and it certainly doesn't listen to anything I have to say.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_710_text: But that makes the game more entertaining, doesn’t it? You guardians are slaves to a kind and just universe. Fiddlesticks is… free.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_730_text: You’re making some very bold demands, my darling. But you can call me… Morgana.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_740_text: Your instructor is a man named Puboe, correct? What say I pay him a visit? Relieve him of that pesky teaching position? I could use the pocket money, hmhmhm.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_750_text: Leave him alone! I won’t let you hurt him!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_760_text: Ah, my darling girl. You think you can stop me?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_770_text: Hmhmhm. You were right about needing that training. Would have helped you a year ago with Zoe’s little invasion.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_780_text: How do you know about that?! If you were involved somehow...!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_790_text: Chin up, dearie. Your co-leader seems quite traumatized by this experience… You should focus on the present.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_800_text: Especially when my terrifying friend is visiting each of your teammates right now!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_800_responseB: You better not touch my friends.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_800_responseC: That’s a smart outfit, but it won’t stop me from destroying you.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_810_text: Oh, hush. Your friends are… well, mostly fine. Though they may be reevaluating their membership in the Star Guardians, hmhmhm.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_820_text: And with that, toodaloo, little girl. I have places to go, and plans to further. We’ll meet again soon.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_830_text: I’m sure your team will handle this wrinkle just fine! Hmhmhmhahahahaha!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_860_text: …I’m sorry, Kai… I think I need to go home…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_880_text: Yeah, me too. I hope everyone’s okay.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90a_20_text: When did you get so serious? You never want to joke around anymore.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90a_30_text: I can joke. Just not about abusing our powers. The guardians would never do that.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90b_20_text: When did you get so serious? You never want to joke around anymore.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90b_30_text: I can joke. Just not about abusing our powers. The guardians would never do that.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90c_20_text: No, I’m sure they would. And a little parade would march in front of the school, and you’d get to meet the mayor.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90c_30_text: But seriously, don’t joke about using your powers like that. We’re supposed to be the good guys.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380a_10_text: At first, it was just bad dreams.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380a_20_text: I kept seeing the mall collapse… that guardian vanishing into the light… Zoe, destroying everything…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380a_30_text: But then… then there was a voice…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380b_10_text: I don’t even know what it is.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380b_20_text: I thought I would stop having dreams of the invasion… but they never went away.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380b_30_text: And now… I think the memories drew something to me. Something really, really bad.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380c_20_text: Yeah, that guy who worked at the bakery. He’s been missing for a couple of weeks.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380c_30_text: Really? That can’t be connected… right?
epilogue_act_2_scene_20_text: I will always… be your best friend… no… matter… what…
epilogue_act_2_scene_30_text: Hmph. It’s late. Looks like everyone’s gone home.
epilogue_act_2_scene_40_text: I could destroy this city. I could kill everyone on the planet… and they’d never be able to stop me.
epilogue_act_2_scene_50_text: Sure, they stopped me once… but that didn’t count! They totally cheated! Using my own power against me is against the rules!
epilogue_act_2_scene_60_text: It’s not fair! None of this is fair! Harp… I...!
epilogue_act_2_scene_80_text: Is it your parents, or your responsibilities? How everyone sees you? Come on, what’s your deal?
epilogue_act_2_scene_90_text: Everyone in this city has a deal! Some like wearing the same sweatshirt every day, some have secret non-nerdy obsessions, and some zealously research ways to time travel. It’s typical city stuff!
epilogue_act_2_scene_100_text: Excuse me?! Do you know who I am?!
epilogue_act_2_scene_120_text: EXACTLY, I’M THE TWI— Sorry, what was that?
epilogue_act_2_scene_130_text: I don’t know who you are. Some sort of… unaccompanied child? Out in the middle of the night in a knockoff Star Guardian outfit?
epilogue_act_2_scene_140_text: You got some of the colors right, but that star design is WAY off.
epilogue_act_2_scene_150_text: And I should know. Mine are some real winners.
epilogue_act_2_scene_160_text: I don’t think you understand the severity of what you’re saying, or who you’re saying it to. Maybe I should SHOW you...!
epilogue_act_2_scene_170_text: Aww, you’re so cute! I remember back in elementary school when I wanted to fight the middle schoolers! Course, I was still taller than you back then…
epilogue_act_2_scene_190_text: I mean I THINK I was taller than you. I blocked out most of the time before I met Quinn.
epilogue_act_2_scene_200_text: …Ugh. What am I saying? It’s the holidays! I’m not supposed to bring up sad things.
epilogue_act_2_scene_210_text: But it’s hard not to think about family this time of year…
epilogue_act_2_scene_220_text: Sorry, you were talking about fighting me or something?
epilogue_act_2_scene_220_responseA: I’m going to tear off your skin and wear it as a human cloak.
epilogue_act_2_scene_220_responseB: Every world will hear your screams as I boil the blood inside your body.
epilogue_act_2_scene_240_text: So… Do you want me to find your parents or something?
epilogue_act_2_scene_250_text: You do have parents… don’t you?
epilogue_act_2_scene_260_text: Or maybe your family is a different kind, like mine! Made up of people all the same age as you, fighting for truth and justice!
epilogue_act_2_scene_270_text: Pfffhahaha! Is this what’s happened to the Star Guardians?! Where’s the generation that fought so hard to save their world?!
epilogue_act_2_scene_290_text: Never met ‘em. I guess they left.
epilogue_act_2_scene_310_text: Yep. Well, most of ‘em. Some came back. We met a couple earlier.
epilogue_act_2_scene_320_text: Ahri… Sarah… Xayah… and some bird guy. What’s-his-name.
epilogue_act_2_scene_340_text: Yeah, that guy! He is REALLY into himself. Didn’t think people carried around pocket mirrors anymore.
epilogue_act_2_scene_350_text: Oh, I probably shouldn’t have told you all that stuff. Secrets and all.
epilogue_act_2_scene_360_text: Myehehehe. I’ll pretend I didn’t hear it.
epilogue_act_2_scene_370_text: I just wanted to see the city one more time. When I think of how close I came to destroying it… I get a little sentimental.
epilogue_act_2_scene_380_text: Thank you for speaking with me! When I decide to come back, I’ll make sure to kill you last.
epilogue_act_2_scene_390_text: Good luck with that! Safe travels!
epilogue_act_2_scene_410_text: So that’s Zoe, huh? The big scary villain who gave everyone so much trouble?
epilogue_act_2_scene_420_text: She doesn’t seem too bad. Needs to open up more though. Let people in!
epilogue_act_2_scene_430_text: Hey, Rell! You coming with us for noodles or what? We got yours with extra wasabi, just how you like it!
epilogue_act_2_scene_440_text: Rell, it’s gonna be a great year.
epilogue_act_2_scene_230a_10_text: That’s so metal! A skin cloak!
epilogue_act_2_scene_230a_20_text: You really don’t know who I am, do you?
epilogue_act_2_scene_230a_30_text: Some freaky little clown kid? I dunno. You seem fine to me.
epilogue_act_2_scene_230b_10_text: Oh, hey! That’s the power the Devil Knights use in Derelict Emperor’s Demon Ascension arc.
epilogue_act_2_scene_230b_20_text: I’m going to enjoy killing you.
epilogue_act_2_scene_230b_30_text: That’s the thing they say! You’re not so bad, weird little monster kid!
epilogue_act_2_scene_230c_10_text: Hey I’m just trying to be friendly!
epilogue_act_2_scene_230c_30_text: Ya know, I used to think the same thing, tiny circus girl.
akali_2_scene_30_text: [She’s ten minutes late. I’m starting to think she isn’t going to show.]
akali_2_scene_40_text: [What did she want to talk about anyways?]
akali_2_scene_50_text: [Something so important that she’d call an “Emergency Star Guardian Meeting...”]
akali_2_scene_60_text: [And then not even bother to come?]
akali_2_scene_80_text: [Maybe I’m being too hard on her. Maybe she just forgot. Maybe…]
akali_2_scene_120_text: Oh, hello, Miss Kai’Sa! One bowl of miso coming up—
akali_2_scene_130_text: I’m not here to eat, Noodle Bill. I’m looking for Akali.
akali_2_scene_140_text: Hhrm. That’s odd. She was right here.
akali_2_scene_160_text: Suppose so. Not sure what to do with this half-eaten bowl though...
akali_2_scene_170_text: Bill! Could I get a take-away thingy? I could chow down on this food all day.
akali_2_scene_200_text: …Eating noodles? It’s Noodle Bill’s. Noodle is right there in the name.
akali_2_scene_210_text: You asked me to meet you in the park. You said it was an emergency.
akali_2_scene_220_text: Did I? That doesn’t sound like me.
akali_2_scene_230_text: Yeah, I guess you’re right. You’re more the “hide from your problems” type.
akali_2_scene_240_text: Hey, I have a particular set of skills. And, like, fifty different kinds of star knives.
akali_2_scene_270_text: —Oh look, my chicken feet are running away. Better go catch them.
akali_2_scene_280_text: Not much to get. I sleep, I study, I eat ramen…
akali_2_scene_290_text: I fight the forces of darkness…
akali_2_scene_300_text: And you do it all without a care in the world.
akali_2_scene_310_text: Oh, I care. I care a lot.
akali_2_scene_320_text: You constantly miss training, you fall asleep in class, you spend all your free time here—
akali_2_scene_330_text: So what is it that you care about?
akali_2_scene_350_text: Sorry I don’t care enough. Should I act more like you?
