akali_2_scene_360_text: Should I follow my friends around like a little bunny, desperate for them to like me?
akali_2_scene_370_text: I’m trying to lead a team. These exercises are important.
akali_2_scene_380_text: I don’t think that’s it. I think you’re trying to lead Lux’s team. I think you’re trying to lead Ahri’s team.
akali_2_scene_390_text: But we can’t be them. I’m not Janna, or Poppy, or Soraka, or Sarah Fortune. I’m me. And you’re you. Our squad doesn't even have matching gem shapes!
akali_2_scene_400_text: You’re chasing someone else’s standards. And those guys aren’t here to pat you on the head and tell you what a good little Star Guardian you are.
akali_2_scene_410_text: We’re in high school. And there are things out there that want to kill us, whether you like it or not. We’re gonna lose someone, someday, and no amount of rules following can stop it.
akali_2_scene_430_text: Sorry, was that too real? I know how much you like never talking about this.
akali_2_scene_430_responseA: Yeah. You really don’t pull your punches.
akali_2_scene_430_responseB: No. I mean—yes, but it was the good kind of real.
akali_2_scene_430_responseC: Is anything really real? …That’s what you sound like.
akali_2_scene_450_text: My jokes are smart, though. College-graduate-level smart.
akali_2_scene_460_text: They go to medical school. Call me Nurse Akali, because I—
akali_2_scene_470_text: So what is it you wanted to talk about? How we’re all going to die?
akali_2_scene_490_text: You don’t acknowledge how scary this is. What we do every day.
akali_2_scene_510_text: It’s not the fighting. I signed up for the fighting.
akali_2_scene_530_text: I have this dream. Different than all the other ones.
akali_2_scene_540_text: I’m back at the Battle of the Twilight Star.
akali_2_scene_550_text: People are screaming out for help.
akali_2_scene_560_text: I reach for my weapon… but it’s not there.
akali_2_scene_570_text: I look down and realize I’m in my school uniform.
akali_2_scene_590_text: Suddenly, the screams fade away. I know they’re still there… but I can’t hear them.
akali_2_scene_600_text: I should feel bad. Horrible, even. But I don’t.
akali_2_scene_630_text: No, I hit the snooze button a couple more times.
akali_2_scene_650_text: Have you ever thought about what it’s like to fall?
akali_2_scene_670_text: It must be horrible. Right? That’s why we keep having those bad dreams, that’s why I keep hearing things…
akali_2_scene_680_text: To burn out… to become… something else. Or fade away entirely. Is that what Zoe was? A Star Guardian who fell? She seemed pretty happy about it.
akali_2_scene_690_text: I want to be a team player, Kai. But you never want to talk about that night. Or what the old guardians actually went through.
akali_2_scene_700_text: So… sometimes it’s easier for me to imagine what it’s like to fall…
akali_2_scene_710_text: …than it is for me to imagine doing… that… forever.
akali_2_scene_720_text: We’re still new at it. Even Lux struggled—
akali_2_scene_730_text: And Ahri made plenty of mistakes. We met two of them. Actually… did I see Xayah the other day? No, that can’t be right…
akali_2_scene_740_text: Exactly! We’re just like the old guardians!
akali_2_scene_750_text: …No, we’re not like the old guardians! Listen to what I’m saying!
akali_2_scene_760_text: I am listening! You don’t have to be like them!
akali_2_scene_800_text: Ah… hey, I’m being a total bummer. I should go home. Let’s forget we had this conversation, okay? No harm, no foul.
akali_2_scene_440a_20_text: What’s the point of hitting if it doesn’t hurt?
akali_2_scene_440a_30_text: Oh, I don’t know… You can spare your friend’s feelings?
akali_2_scene_440a_40_text: Though I do prefer honesty over constantly deflecting with stupid jokes.
akali_2_scene_440b_20_text: Definitely not a defense mechanism triggered by my best friend attacking me.
akali_2_scene_440b_30_text: Ah… and now you’re back to deflecting with sarcasm and stupid jokes.
akali_2_scene_440c_10_text: I do not sound like that.
akali_2_scene_440c_20_text: Yeah, I guess your nihilism usually falls on the more depressing, less philosophical side of the spectrum.
akali_2_scene_440c_30_text: Sorry, what? My doesn’t-care-slacker brain is too small for your big, giant words.
akali_2_scene_440c_40_text: Ah… and now you’re back to deflecting with sarcasm and stupid jokes.
ekko_3_scene_10_text: [So, our first test didn’t work. The machine puttered out, generating some weird, blue gas.]
ekko_3_scene_20_text: [Second test failed, too. And the third.]
ekko_3_scene_30_text: Inventor’s Log: This is ChronoDisplacer Test 143.
ekko_3_scene_40_text: [Yeah, we’ve been at it for a while.]
ekko_3_scene_50_text: After numerous failed attempts with an operator in the present…
ekko_3_scene_60_text: We will now proceed with two travelers, one to monitor an active connection with…
ekko_3_scene_70_text: [It’s hard for me to pay attention when he starts rambling on about all this time stuff.]
ekko_3_scene_80_text: [But… I’m going with him! He gave me a device to pull us back if anything goes wrong.]
ekko_3_scene_90_text: …and, this time, nothing will go wrong.
ekko_3_scene_100_responseB: Not in the slightest. But what choice do we have?
ekko_3_scene_100_responseC: Could you tell me what I have to do again? I… wasn’t listening.
ekko_3_scene_170_text: …Ahem. Turning on the Stopwatch of Perfect Timing…
ekko_3_scene_190_text: Synchronized! If you’re gonna do something, do it now!
ekko_3_scene_220_text: Checking the stopwatch to confirm accurate arrival time…
ekko_3_scene_230_text: No need. Look at the skyline.
ekko_3_scene_240_text: That’s… Zoe… the Twilight Star… We’re back to that night…
ekko_3_scene_270_text: Wh… What is that?! Run! Run for your lives!
ekko_3_scene_280_text: Quick, transform. Even if this is the past, that’s still Zoe. The old guardians are fighting her right now, and it is not pretty.
ekko_3_scene_300_text: You really weren’t listening to me at all, were you?
ekko_3_scene_310_text: We have to track down past me. Ignore everything else. I maaaay have neglected to mention the effects of messing with history too much.
ekko_3_scene_320_text: Those are lies of omission! I… ugh! Just lead the way…
ekko_3_scene_340_text: Just a second! My friend needs help!
ekko_3_scene_350_text: Claggor, hurry! The entire city is falling apart!
ekko_3_scene_360_text: Wow, you look pretty much the same.
ekko_3_scene_370_text: It was last year, Kai. Not last century.
ekko_3_scene_380_text: True. And that other boy… That’s your friend?
ekko_3_scene_440_text: She hasn’t met us yet. Wouldn’t talking to her mess with—I don’t know—the fabric of reality?!
ekko_3_scene_470_text: …Well, I don’t think she noticed us.
ekko_3_scene_490_text: Hey, Sona! Don’t go running off on your own! …Wait, Ekko?
ekko_3_scene_510_text: Didn’t I just see you leave? In the opposite direction? …And why are you dressed in cosplay?
ekko_3_scene_530_text: Sorry, his little computer brain is malfunctioning.
ekko_3_scene_540_text: What he’s trying to say is that he… came back. Wanted to make sure you’re okay.
ekko_3_scene_550_text: Yeah, well, nobody is okay right now. Something bad is happening outside… Wait, you’re also dressed in cosplay? This is weird.
ekko_3_scene_570_text: …You-you need to get out of here!
ekko_3_scene_580_text: Ah. You aren’t my Ekko, are you? Or you are, but… Well, you know.
ekko_3_scene_600_text: I always knew you’d figure out a way to time travel! We’ve been talking about it for years!
ekko_3_scene_610_text: Did you use a wormhole? Did you figure out a way to alter the geometry of space-time?!
ekko_3_scene_630_text: I’m sure you’ll tell future me all about it, right? Right? Ekko… Am I right..?
ekko_3_scene_650_text: …I’m not going to let it happen. Not again.
ekko_3_scene_680_text: You get hurt. Saving someone else.
ekko_3_scene_690_text: Do I look cool while doing it?
ekko_3_scene_710_text: I’m-I’m a Star Guardian now. It’s my job to keep you safe.
ekko_3_scene_720_text: Huh? What’s a Star Guardian? Are they, like… superheroes?
ekko_3_scene_730_text: That’s right… The invasion made the guardians public knowledge! Nobody knows they even exist until tomorrow morning!
ekko_3_scene_740_text: Yeah, they’re like superheroes. I took an oath and everything…
ekko_3_scene_750_text: An oath, huh? Like, protect the innocent, defeat evil? All that?
ekko_3_scene_760_text: Which means your job is to protect people. Not keep me from making my own decisions.
ekko_3_scene_780_text: And what about the person I save? What happens to them if you stop me?
ekko_3_scene_830_text: But we traveled all this way!
ekko_3_scene_830_responseA: You’ve done all you can, Ekko.
ekko_3_scene_830_responseB: Just let him go. It’s over.
ekko_3_scene_830_responseC: Maybe we should just be glad we made it here in one piece.
ekko_3_scene_850_text: You’ve read all the same sci-fi mangas as me… You know you can’t change the past.
ekko_3_scene_870_text: Why do you think we get along so well?
ekko_3_scene_890_text: Yeah… Always. Until the end of time.
ekko_3_scene_920_text: No. But I think I will be.
ekko_3_scene_960_text: Yeah, no problem. I just had to push a button.
ekko_3_scene_840b_20_text: Oh! I didn’t mean it like that! Don’t worry. You survive… mostly.
ekko_3_scene_840b_30_text: But you don’t have to get hurt at all…
ekko_3_scene_840c_30_text: We were still working out the kinks.
ekko_3_scene_840c_40_text: And it was all for this moment. So, I won’t give up.
akali_3_scene_10_text: [Akali hasn’t talked to me since that last time we hung out…]
akali_3_scene_20_text: [I… didn’t handle that conversation well. If only Lux…]
akali_3_scene_30_text: [No. No! If only I knew the right thing to say to her.]
akali_3_scene_40_text: [But every time I try to get close… I only push her further away.]
akali_3_scene_50_text: Sorry, we don’t open for a—
akali_3_scene_60_text: Oh! Kai’Sa! I haven’t seen you in a while! I was starting to get a little worried!
akali_3_scene_80_text: Don’t worry, I’m not here to eat. I thought maybe Akali would be here.
akali_3_scene_90_text: Ah, my most frequent customer. I’m gonna be able to renovate my house thanks to that girl’s appetite, gyah hah!
akali_3_scene_100_text: She’s already on her 32nd punch card for a free bowl every eight bowls.
akali_3_scene_140_text: You know, she always finds a way to make me laugh. Your friend is very funny.
akali_3_scene_160_text: Oh, sometimes. Other times, she just eats in silence. Tends to be the case with all my customers.
akali_3_scene_170_text: But she’ll make this funny face when she’s slurping noodles. Always cracks me up.
akali_3_scene_180_text: I know the one. So focused. Like if she lets a single noodle slip from her mouth…
akali_3_scene_190_text: The world will end. Gyah hah!
akali_3_scene_200_text: What... what does she say? When you talk?
akali_3_scene_210_text: Don’t worry. She doesn’t spill any of your exciting teenager secrets, whatever they are. Plays a lot of Hyper Crystal Something-or-Other on her phone.
akali_3_scene_220_text: She talks a lot about the future. Or… hm… the lack of it. Not as uncommon as you’d think for someone her age. When you’re young, you don’t have much for reference.
akali_3_scene_230_text: One bad thing becomes… the only thing, because there’s nothing else to compare it to. She’s real vague about whatever it is. Not that it’s any of my business.
akali_3_scene_250_text: When did I become a person she couldn’t talk to…?
akali_3_scene_260_text: A traveler carrying five stones shares their weight with the empty-handed man.
akali_3_scene_270_text: Bill, you can’t keep doing this to me. I have no idea what you’re saying.
akali_3_scene_280_text: Gyah hah hah! Teenagers! Your problems are so small, but you think the future of the universe is at stake!
akali_3_scene_300_text: Of course! Akali mentioned you’re the leader of your—what was it—ah! Tennis team.
akali_3_scene_310_text: Balancing that with school… can’t be easy. I never played tennis, but, you know. I assume.
akali_3_scene_320_text: On the other hand, I am an old cook with an abundance of time.
akali_3_scene_330_text: I am the empty-handed man. Her problems are the—
akali_3_scene_340_text: The stones. I get it. And I have my own stones?
akali_3_scene_360_text: You just travel with her down that road. Carry your stones together, and I’m sure she’ll come around.
akali_3_scene_370_text: …Thanks for the weird-but-helpful metaphor. I will.
akali_3_scene_400_responseA: Actually, I was just at Noodle Bill’s and…
akali_3_scene_400_responseB: Uh… No, I just happened to be walking by…
akali_3_scene_400_responseC: This is sort of where I hang out, so technically, you’re stalking me…
akali_3_scene_430_text: Seriously though, how’d you find me?
akali_3_scene_450_text: Also the guys at the arcade said you threw a skeeball so hard it broke the machine, then stormed off to “that stupid statue.”
akali_3_scene_460_text: Threw it overhand. Like in the major leagues.
akali_3_scene_480_text: So… what? Am I late for training or something?
akali_3_scene_490_text: Sorry, no, nothing like that. We… we don’t have to talk about Star Guardian stuff. If you don’t want to.
akali_3_scene_520_text: Though… Do you think they’ll make statues of us one day? You know… if we don’t all, uh, die horribly?
akali_3_scene_520_responseA: After all the world saving we’re gonna do? Definitely.
akali_3_scene_520_responseB: I don’t know. You have to be a pretty big hero to get a statue.
akali_3_scene_520_responseC: If they do, I hope it’s one where we shoot water out of our mouths.
akali_3_scene_560_text: You know, I’m scared of falling, too.
akali_3_scene_580_text: Of course. I think about the invasion all the time… Rakan died right in front of us… thousands of people lost their lives… and everyone just… moved on.
akali_3_scene_590_text: I wonder… is that what it’ll always be? Losing people we care about forever… until we lose each other? Ourselves? It doesn’t seem right. It doesn’t seem… fair.
akali_3_scene_600_text: And part of me wishes I could just go back to before. Before all that happened, before Zoe attacked, before we ever knew there was such a thing as Star Guardians.
akali_3_scene_610_text: When you and I would hang out at the arcade. Or listen to music in my bedroom.
akali_3_scene_630_text: Yeah… Man, they’re so janky. So embarrassing. If anyone tries to take mine, I’ll kill them.
akali_3_scene_640_text: Ha! Well… no matter what we do, that old life is gone now.
akali_3_scene_650_text: But the Kai’Sa from before? Your friend Kai’Sa? She’s not gone.
akali_3_scene_660_text: You’ve been talking to old Bill too much. Did he tell you about the five rocks made of problems or whatever?
akali_3_scene_670_text: The problem rocks! I still don’t know what he was talking about. Maybe I never will.
akali_3_scene_680_text: Yeah… You know, it’s kinda funny.
akali_3_scene_690_text: The danger we face every day. Our oath. The darkness.
akali_3_scene_700_text: You’re right, that is very funny.
akali_3_scene_710_text: Heh, shut up. It’s all so… overwhelming. And when I’m overwhelmed…
akali_3_scene_730_text: Yeah! A really stupid one. Like, I call a pigeon a sky goblin.
akali_3_scene_750_text: A sky goblin! Because they gobble treasure and tell riddles!
akali_3_scene_760_text: Ak.. ahaha.. Akali… what do you think a goblin is?
akali_3_scene_770_text: I know what a goblin is! Hey, stop laughing! You’re gonna make me… ahaha!
akali_3_scene_790_text: Ahhh, whew. Hey… whatever happens… let’s just try to be there for each other, okay? You did promise, after all.
akali_3_scene_810_text: Friends ‘til the end? Even if that end super turbo sucks?
akali_3_scene_820_text: You and me, Kali. Until the sucky, turbo end.
akali_3_scene_530a_10_text: How can you be so sure?
akali_3_scene_530a_30_text: But I know you wouldn’t be doing this if all you cared about was a statue.
akali_3_scene_530a_40_text: Yeah, I’m more of a billboard person. Captures my image better.
akali_3_scene_530b_20_text: It’s easier if we don’t try to live up to Lux’s standards.
akali_3_scene_530b_30_text: Yeah, you were right. We can forge our own path.
akali_3_scene_530b_40_text: I want to be the first Star Guardian with an instant noodle brand. So much sodium your heart explodes right there at the table.
akali_3_scene_530c_10_text: Ooh, and at night, there’s a water show set to music.
akali_3_scene_530c_20_text: They can play our theme song! You know, the… burning one? Oh, no… I don’t know the theme song!
akali_3_scene_530c_30_text: You?! You, little miss leader, don’t know Burning Bright?
akali_3_scene_530c_40_text: This is an incredible day. Wow. I’m telling the entire squad. Nonnegotiable.
rell_3_scene_10_text: I - I didn’t do anything wrong. I swear!
rell_3_scene_20_text: Don’t hurt me! I’m just a small cat with big responsibilities!!!
rell_3_scene_30_text: You think THAT’S what Battle Principal Yuumi would say to a God-Weapon? Have you even watched her spin-off series?! She fears nothing!
rell_3_scene_40_text: Battle Principal Yuumi has the highest God-Weapon affinity of anyone at Durandal Academy. She even fought back the Praetorian invasion in Chapter 112: Danger! Parallel Future Robot Uprising!
rell_3_scene_50_text: It may be partially retconned, but I think Battle Instructor Graves is hiding a way higher affinity level! Also, I’m more of a dog person!
rell_3_scene_60_text: I got here as fast as I could! Point me to the—
rell_3_scene_80_text: It’s going… fine. Were you talking about manga? In public?!
rell_3_scene_90_text: Yeah, we’ve been debating Battle Academia. Are you… a fan, perchance?
rell_3_scene_100_text: Oh, uh… I don’t know that one. But hey, I got caught up on Derelict Emperor!
rell_3_scene_110_text: Yes! What did you think of the Hecarabius fight?
rell_3_scene_110_responseA: I was not expecting them to destroy Helia with the Prevailing Mist Beam.
rell_3_scene_110_responseB: Kinda surprised by that crossover with Café Cuties.
rell_3_scene_110_responseC: Hecarabius will be my 2D husband. I will be his 3D wife.
rell_3_scene_120_text: Right?! We gotta talk about it later. Plus, I just picked up this new manga about a guy who’s sad because he kills everything he touches. It’s awesome.
rell_3_scene_140_text: Later, Kai’Sa! Okay. One choice, ultimate deathmatch. Gun Goddess or Bullet Angel?
rell_3_scene_150_text: Come on, this is troll. Gun Goddess’ AI is so much more advanced! It surpasses the Battle Angel chassis’ superior firepower in every way. Get real. Next question.
rell_3_scene_160_text: … And then Sebastien charged forward with the power of a thousand stars!
rell_3_scene_180_text: I honestly didn’t think it’s something you’d keep up with.
rell_3_scene_190_text: I can do anything I put my mind to!
rell_3_scene_200_text: Even if that involves talking to a statue, loudly recounting Star Guardian stories in broad daylight.
rell_3_scene_210_text: Keep going! I need to hear what happens next in your totally fictional story!
rell_3_scene_230_text: Don’t mind me, sorry to interrupt!
rell_3_scene_240_text: … The monster looked down at Sebastien. “THIS?! This is the best you Star Guardians could muster?! A tiny horse?!” But Sebastien was no ordinary horse…
rell_3_scene_260_text: Sebastien! … Uh! Nothing to see here folks, just my cat in high-quality cosplay.
rell_3_scene_270_text: So you’re saying the Cuties protect their tea shop from giant monsters… who just want to come in and have some tea?!
rell_3_scene_280_text: Yes! Ohmygosh, have you gotten the Berry Swirl Cake? It comes with an exclusive crossover card for Monster Tamers!
rell_3_scene_290_text: I must have it! Order three of them!
rell_3_scene_300_text: [Wow, those two are really getting along...]
rell_3_scene_350_text: SMOKED THEM! OH! DID YOU SEE THAT?! DO YOU SEE WHAT YOU GET WHEN THE TIME LORD IS UPON YOU?!
rell_3_scene_360_text: YEAH, OTHER TEAM, GO CRY TO YOUR MOM! I DON’T CARE IF YOU’RE TWELVE! THERE’S NO MERCY IN VIDEO GAMES!
rell_3_scene_370_text: [First Tali, now Ekko… She’s opening up to everyone!]
rell_3_scene_380_text: I don’t know… I don’t see it.
rell_3_scene_390_text: Their eyes are totally glowing a dark, evil purple. Those aren’t normal deer eyes. And that one just stole that woman’s purse!
rell_3_scene_400_text: C’mon, you promised I could be my authentic self. And that means defending this park from a bunch of semi-wild animals.
rell_3_scene_410_text: … wait, that deer really IS running away with some woman’s purse…
rell_3_scene_420_text: HEY, MR. PARK RANGER! YOU’RE JUST IN TIME! THIS DEER HAS A REALLY STRONG GRIP, BUT IF WE TUG TOGETHER, I BET WE CAN PRY THE PURSE FREE!
rell_3_scene_430_text: Guess we won’t get kicked out this time… no more miscommunication about “fighting wildlife unprompted.”
rell_3_scene_440_text: That man just made me an honorary Park Ranger. Said he’d never seen a kid tackle a deer before.
rell_3_scene_460_text: So? How was hanging out with the authentic me? Still interested in keeping me around?
rell_3_scene_460_responseA: Yes! It was an experience I’ll never forget.
rell_3_scene_460_responseB: Are you kidding? We should be hanging out all the time.
rell_3_scene_460_responseC: Authentic Rell confuses and inspires me. I like her a lot.
rell_3_scene_480_text: Anyway, thanks for not judging me too harshly. I still have a lot to work through, but it’s nice to know I can count on you.
rell_3_scene_490_text: Don’t worry about it, Rell. I’m just glad you’re on our side.
rell_3_scene_520_text: I wonder… If it was so easy for you to like me, why didn’t my parents? I tried to be the person they wanted me to be…
rell_3_scene_530_text: I just don’t get it. Did I do something wrong?
rell_3_scene_540_text: You didn’t do anything wrong. Parents can be… complicated. They don’t always know what they want.
rell_3_scene_560_text: Maybe it’s more important that I like me, and that I surround myself with people who accept me for who I am: an awesome person.
rell_3_scene_570_text: It’s just… hard, you know? I don’t know if my parents and I will ever get along. Or if I even want that.
rell_3_scene_580_text: Guess you’ll all have to be my family… for now. U-until I can figure out my situation, you know?
rell_3_scene_590_text: I know. And you can be part of our squad as long as you need to.
rell_3_scene_610_text: AHEM! That's a problem for another day. Now, the last step of our agreement is upon us.
rell_3_scene_620_text: Time to hit the manga shop!
rell_3_scene_630_text: This week, they’re releasing the first volume of “My Life as an Imprisoned Star Dragon”. It’s about this star dragon who…
rell_3_scene_640_text: …is imprisoned in a giant mountain, and before he can get out, he has to teach a class of middle schoolers how to kill God?
rell_3_scene_650_text: YES! It’s by the same author as Super Galaxy, so you know the quality is there.
rell_3_scene_660_text: Hopefully that mascot doesn’t sneak up on me again. I wasn’t scared, he just caught me off guard. But this time -
rell_3_scene_670_text: Hey there, friends! I’m a real-life Star Guardian!
rell_3_scene_690_text: Gyahhh! I was just cleared to return to work!
rell_3_scene_700_text: Remind me to warn Nilah that this thing is a person. No reason.
rell_3_scene_710_text: But also… a mascot phobia? Rell, you’re full of surprises.
rell_3_scene_720_text: Hope you don’t get sick of surprising Rell facts, because I have a lot of sharing to catch up on. Now let's score that manga!
rell_3_scene_730_text: Thank you… Thank you all for being my friends. It feels like, after all this time, my heart… is finally full.
rell_3_scene_470a_10_text: In a good way or a bad way?
rell_3_scene_470a_20_text: Definitely a good way. Though I’m not sure your Star Guardian uniform has any room for a Park Ranger badge.
rell_3_scene_470a_30_text: Who said anything about putting it on my Star Guardian uniform? I’m wearing this thing to school!
rell_3_scene_470b_10_text: Really? All the time, every day?
rell_3_scene_470b_30_text: K, I’m kidding. Hanging out with you would cut into my Q time. But… maybe I’ll text you more. When I’m feeling it.
rell_3_scene_470c_10_text: Ha! See, once you get to know me, I’m charming and sweet!
rell_3_scene_470c_30_text: Don’t tell anyone. I kinda like being known as the mysterious loner. With friends in my corner, I can own it. I feel powerful.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_10_text: My, my. What a quaint little street.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_20_text: They must have worked quickly to repair the damage after that brat botched her invasion last year. Hmph, what a waste.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_30_text: And what did they replace all those buildings with, hm? Rows and rows of shops?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_40_text: Hmhmhm! As ever, these humans bend themselves toward such casual cruelties. Wealth extraction! It seems so antithetical to the entire Star Guardian ideal.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_50_text: But what do I know? I'm a soon-to-be lowly homeroom teacher at a… public school. [Shiver!]
chapter_1_act_3_scene_60_text: Well, enough idling. I suppose it’s time to make a mess of things.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_90_text: N... no way! It’s a bunch of monsters!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_100_text: Stay back! S… stop! Someone help!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_110_text: Here’s your first test, guardians. Let’s hope you pass.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_120_text: Akali! Keep your head in the game! This is what guardians do!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_130_text: Those are actual monsters! I don’t… I can’t focus… because of that stupid Fiddlesticks thing, ugh!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_150_text: Where are the Star Guardians?! Where is Lux?! Help us!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_160_text: Ugh. Lux isn’t here anymore. Wish she was, but…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_170_text: Shoot. There are way too many of those things. People are going to get hurt.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_180_text: You ready to put it all on the line, ‘Kali? We might not come back alive.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_190_text: A…alive?! What do you mean? You think we might die out there?!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_200_text: Hey, maybe! But we’re Star Guardians!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_210_text: Or at least we’re supposed to be.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_220_text: Why is everyone obsessed about what a Star Guardian is supposed to be? Are Star Guardians supposed to be killed by monsters?!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_230_text: I just didn’t think… Ugh, this reminds me of last year… I don’t…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_260_responseB: I’m taking point. Everyone, follow my lead.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_260_responseC: Loving the checkerboard nightmare aesthetic. We should come here more often.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_280_text: I’m not feeling that overwhelming sense of dread… It must not be here.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_300_text: I sense that woman, though… She was here. Morgana.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_310_text: Kali? Are you good? We need you for this, okay?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_330_text: Hm! Yeah, I’ll be fine. The mission comes first.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_340_text: Glad you’re with us, then. And don’t worry… I’ll keep you safe.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_350_text: Pfft… Yeah… I know you will. You’re a Star Guardian. It’s what you do!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_360_text: Oh, my God. Fight now! Talk later!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_370_text: Whatever, boy genius. Let’s see what you’ve got out there.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_380_text: I have Sona and Taliyah covering both ends of the street, so nothing is getting in or out.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_390_text: Check your angles, and prioritize saving anyone in danger. We’re going in!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_400_text: It’s the big show, everyone! Get ready to make a statement!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_430_text: We’re not just guardians in training anymore! Let’s show this city we’re real heroes!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_440_text: Welcome to VC! Now, get out!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_450_text: Cut through everything! Don’t let these chumps touch you!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_460_text: Ha… ha… Okay, maybe that wasn’t as bad as I...
chapter_1_act_3_scene_480_text: I think so? I don’t see any more monsters.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_490_text: And all that stuff that was warping the street is gone. I hesitate to say it, but…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_490_responseA: I think we might have won?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_490_responseB: We saved the city! WE SAVED THE CITY!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_510_text: OUR FIRST REAL VICTORY! …Is what Miss Sona said. Right, Miss Sona?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_520_text: That was crazy! I was over there, like, fwoom! And then Sona was, like, bwong! And you guys were, like, boooom! It was awesome!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_530_text: Semi-related, but there is a huge magical wall blocking the end of the street that I may have put there and cannot remove. We should go.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_540_text: You’re never this amped at school, Tali.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_550_text: Because I don’t have star powers or a cool outfit there, duh. Also, I smashed this monster with a huge rock, and it was like, “Bleeeurgh”.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_560_text: …Thanks, everyone. Let’s get out of here before people start to notice what we look like.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_570_text: Aw, come on. I wanna be a bootleg action figure like Rakan or that blonde dude… Ezmorp? You know, the blue one.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_600_text: We can save it for a victory meal tomorrow, alright?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_610_text: Boooooo! We want a speech, or to be bootleg Star Guardian action figures with weird names!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_620_text: If we leave now, I’ll do the speech tomorrow at Noodle Bill’s.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_630_text: Noodle Bill’s?! Everyone go home! We’re done here!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_660_text: One thing I need to ask, though… Did it feel like this was a test? Those things went down… almost too easily.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_690_text: Let’s just bask in our very first victory!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_710_text: WHAT DID I SAY WRONG?! WAS IT BASK?! I HAVE A VERY LARGE VOCABULARY!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_720_text: Heh. But, yeah… makes you wonder…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_730_text: Who else might be watching us?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_10_text: Monsters, tons of them. They’re kinda puny by themselves, but there are at least a few dozen out there.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_20_text: We don’t know where they came from. And everything’s all… messed up… like when that creepy monster attacked us.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_30_text: I was wondering about that. The pattern looks familiar… What was that creature’s name? Fiddlesticks?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_40_text: Ugh, I don’t wanna think about that thing. It showed up in my dreams… I’ll never forget that voice…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_10_text: Copy that, Cap’n Kai. What’s the big plan?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_20_text: Hm. Looks like a few dozen of them, and they’re coming out of that checkerboard goop.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_30_text: Sweep the street. We hit fast and hard, and close that breach.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_40_text: Got it. What do we do if that Fiddlesticks thing shows up?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_50_text: Ugh… Do you think it will?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270c_40_text: Yeah, yeah, very funny. That pattern on the street looks a lot like Fiddlesticks, so if we run into it, maybe it’ll share your sense of humor.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_20_text: Oh, who cares about pretense anymore! These non-guardians are trapped in an illusion of my own design anyway.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_30_text: Our ultimate showdown is fast approaching, children. If I were you, I’d make my final preparations.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_40_text: Because after I kill each and every one of you, I’m going to destroy this horrible little city and put an end to your horrible little world.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_50_text: Clock’s ticking, guardians. Can’t you hear it? Tick… tock…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_70_text: Dang! They planted the spike again!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_80_text: Maybe my light gun is broken… or something’s wrong with the game cabinet…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_100_text: Really?! You’re really gonna do me like that?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_110_text: [“Don’t hate the game, Ekko. Hate the player.”]
chapter_4_act_2_scene_120_text: Psh. I never should have learned sign language.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_130_text: Hey! I figured I’d find you two here.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_140_text: Captain Kai! I was just showing Sona the ropes in VALORANT.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_170_responseA: Have you tried using a different Agent?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_170_responseC: How can you love this game so much and never get any better?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_190_text: That’s right… You two met here, didn’t you?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_220_text: N-no, don’t worry about it! We did technically meet here, but that was a long time ago.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_230_text: Weird to think it’s been so long since Zoe invaded… almost two years now…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_260_text: Well, almost nothing. We still go to school, we still do homework and hang out in the arcade. There are still monsters.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_270_text: But now, we can fight, y’know? We can do something about it. Change our fate.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_280_text: [“We’re not helpless kids. We’re something more than that.”]
chapter_4_act_2_scene_290_text: Exactly. We keep the torch lit, so everyone else can follow. You know what I mean?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_300_text: Hope the rest of your rounds go well, Captain. We’ll see you for the big battle.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_310_text: Thanks, you two. Be safe until then.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_330_text: Too many… Lovely Lass… Matcha Balls…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_340_text: You’re both out of control! Eating doesn’t have to be a competition!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_350_text: It does! And I’ll never give up!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_360_text: I’m gonna eat so much dessert pastry that it’ll ooze outta my tear ducts. You’re going down, sweatshirt!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_370_text: You’ve got two croissants left in you, tops. I’m ready to eat my way into Hell, and—I’m wearing my stretchy pants!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_380_text: These are our friends, Valor. This is who we choose to hang out with.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_400_text: Not causing too much trouble, I… Oh, what happened here? This looks like a pastry massacre.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_410_text: There’s some exclusive manga you can win if you eat enough food items here.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_430_text: And they only give out one per day…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_470_text: They’ve been at it all day. It’s… Well, it’s been a nice distraction.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_470_responseA: So, now the three of you are hanging out all the time?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_470_responseC: Quinn… I know your pain… the pain of being friends with an otaku…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_490_text: So… Captain… you making the final rounds?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_500_text: I don’t like to call them final…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_510_text: Eh, why run from it? We gotta make the most of every moment. Our job isn’t easy.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_520_text: It’s alright, Captain. We’ve faced many great threats this year. I’m sure that, whatever comes next, we’ll get through it.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_530_text: It’s just like when Tiger Gauntlet took down the Snake Witch in Zodiac Relic Issue #5! Sure, he destroyed pretty much all of downtown in the process, but he saved the day in the end!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_550_text: I haven't even HEARD of that one…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_560_text: I… should be on my way. It was good to talk with you all.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_570_text: Seriously?! Did no one get that reference?! It’s not like my taste is obscure!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_580_text: If you just read my list of the Top 100 Manga I sent you, you’d get it! You’d ALL get it!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_600_text: Nilah. I’m glad I ran into you…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_610_text: And I, you. How go the preparations for our final battle with darkness?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_620_text: I guess… they’re as good as we’re gonna make them. It’s not like I’m slowly improving a spaceship for some sort of suicide mission.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_630_text: I don’t mean your combat skills, Kai’Sa. I mean your bonds with your team. Are they as strong as they could be? Will you walk into fire for each other?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_640_text: Oh… I guess I’m not sure…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_660_text: You know this isn’t the end, right?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_690_text: There are many, many things beyond this world drawn toward its light, looking to feed on it and snuff it out.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_700_text: Ha. I look forward to such things! But you… you have friends, family…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_710_text: Prepare yourself well, Kai’Sa. We are not promised tomorrow… and in the end, only our legends live on.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_710_responseA: Thank you for helping us, Nilah. I’ll always be grateful.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_710_responseB: Will you stay with us after this is all over?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_730_text: Kai’Sa. I have one last gift before you go.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_750_text: Step out from the shadows, if you would. We have something to discuss.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_780_text: Alright. What exactly is going on...?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180a_10_text: Phoenix is my main, and I refuse to abandon him for some… in-meta character.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180a_30_text: I’m not playing Jett! I main Phoenix… in good times and bad.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180a_40_text: And these are some trying times to main Phoenix… Balance gods… please, have mercy…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180b_10_text: Please. I have time powers. I switch my loadout constantly.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180b_20_text: I just… you know… can’t seem to win.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180b_30_text: You can’t win with infinite tries? That’s so… bleak.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180b_40_text: See, this is bullying behavior, and I don’t have to stand for it.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180c_10_text: Gamers have a rich tradition of loving things they never improve at, okay?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180c_30_text: O-okay, listen, I really did leave my wallet in my desk! I’ll pay you back for lunch! It was Morgana! I’m being set up!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_180c_40_text: Shoot… Can’t even talk about gaming without it becoming a whole allegory about “that time I didn’t pay for lunch.”
chapter_4_act_2_scene_480a_10_text: Not all the time, but we’re getting used to the city as best we can. Taliyah here has been a big help.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_480a_20_text: Her family made us dinner one night! It was awesome!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_480a_30_text: My parents always say that a home-cooked meal is a good way to bring people together.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_480a_40_text: And a restaurant-cooked meal! And meals from vending machines! Meals are the great connector!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_480b_20_text: You did tell the barista you would incinerate him with your laser eyes.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_480b_40_text: He had a bad manga opinion. You can’t have those. It’s against the law.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_480c_30_text: You’re new. You’re a tourist. Do you know how many day-one releases I’ve had to wait for? Can you even comprehend the smell of those lines?!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_480c_40_text: I feel like maybe I’ve struck a nerve…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_480c_50_text: You are nothing, Kai’Sa. I am the ultimate friend. You are some sort of… weak baby friend.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_720a_10_text: It is no worry at all. I am simply keeping a promise to a friend.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_720a_20_text: Though… you are a rather charming bunch. I could be convinced to stick around… if that’s something you’d be interested in.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_720a_30_text: Y-yes! Of course I would! Please stay!
chapter_4_act_2_scene_720a_40_text: Ha! Very well. I won’t be an Outer Guardian anymore… Shame. It’s such an intimidating title…
chapter_4_act_2_scene_720b_20_text: You’re all so colorful and strange. I have a feeling my little exoplanet will be safe from destruction for another, oh, hundred years.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_720b_30_text: A hundred years?! You want to stay with us that long?
chapter_4_act_2_scene_720b_40_text: It will be a fine challenge to keep you all alive for the next century.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_720c_30_text: Hmm. Doesn’t it project displeasure? I’ve been working on it ever since the Dark Herald.
chapter_4_act_2_scene_720c_40_text: Ah, well. It’s hard when you can only feel joy… except in the specific instance of you calling me your father, which I find off-putting and strange.
nilah_2_scene_10_text: Kai’Sa! Why are you letting your guard down?
nilah_2_scene_20_text: I’m not letting you through again! I can… huff… I can still fight!
nilah_2_scene_30_text: Good! Let our battle sing across time and space! Let this day mark the awakening of your inner power!
nilah_2_scene_40_text: Ugh! How are you… so strong… I’ve never felt anything like this...!
nilah_2_scene_50_text: N-no! I won’t stay down! You won’t stop me, no matter how powerful you are!
nilah_2_scene_60_text: Yes! I am Nilah of the Seventh Layer! My joy is endless, my bliss eternal! And you, worthy enemy, are done!
nilah_2_scene_80_text: Kai’Sa? Kai’Sa? If you’re dead, Lux will be very angry with me.
nilah_2_scene_90_text: Ow… What happened? Did I win?
nilah_2_scene_110_text: You did, in fact, get “smoked, bro.”
nilah_2_scene_130_text: Your father asked some awkward questions about the uniform. I told him I work at Café Cuties… and it seemed to convince him. I think.
nilah_2_scene_140_text: I did have to sing a fairly horrible theme song. Taliyah and Sona helped. It was… not my proudest victory, but a victory nonetheless.
nilah_2_scene_140_responseB: Nobody saw us battling it out, did they? We can’t risk our identities being exposed.
nilah_2_scene_140_responseC: How did you talk to my dad… if you’re my dad?
nilah_2_scene_160_text: Yeah, yeah, Kassadad, whatever. Nilah, what was that magic?! It looked like you could cut a mountain in half!
nilah_2_scene_170_text: That, Akali, is the power of joy.
nilah_2_scene_180_text: The power of… joy? I thought you were a Star Guardian?
nilah_2_scene_190_text: I am indeed a Star Guardian, now an Outer Guardian. But the light is not my only strength.
nilah_2_scene_200_text: Long ago, I faced a creature not unlike your Fiddlesticks… a fallen guardian, or perhaps something more. By then, it was impossible to tell.
nilah_2_scene_210_text: So great was its hunger that it threatened to devour the cosmos itself. A dark being of twisted, unnatural bliss… the Star of Joy, Ashlesh.
nilah_2_scene_220_text: The Star of… Joy? I thought there were only two stars… First and Twilight.
nilah_2_scene_230_text: Many stars shine in the skies above. The First Star is a part of the universe itself… a natural and benevolent light that touches all things.
nilah_2_scene_240_text: Then there are the pretender stars. Stars born from the hearts of guardians and other powerful entities… Twilight is one. Joy was another. I know for certain there are more.
nilah_2_scene_250_text: Ashlesh… That’s the monster that your squad faced, right? But… I thought you killed it?
nilah_2_scene_260_text: In a sense. Before it was slain, I was tainted by its cosmic joy. I succumbed to it at first, but successfully fought my way back. Now, the power is mine… as is the threat it poses.
nilah_2_scene_270_text: Whoa… So you're, like, a monster? You could turn evil and kill us all?
nilah_2_scene_290_text: What? She kind of is a monster… right?
nilah_2_scene_300_text: Ha! Not quite a monster, I’m afraid. There are others like me. The guardian Xayah, I believe, has a similar power after her brush with Zoe.
nilah_2_scene_310_text: Just as there are many powerful threats across the universe, there are powerful forces of good. Each balances the other. From this conflict, my joy endures.
nilah_2_scene_330_text: And there we are. Sated again, for now.
nilah_2_scene_350_text: Spar with me next! I want to face the power of a star monster!
nilah_2_scene_360_text: Kali! That’s an Outer Guardian! You can’t say stuff like that!
nilah_2_scene_380_responseA: It’s rude! What if she called you a star monster?
nilah_2_scene_380_responseB: Star Guardians should always respect their elders!
nilah_2_scene_380_responseC: That’s my dad you’re talking to!
nilah_2_scene_410_text: It’s funny. I’ve fought alone for a long, long time. And with each victory over a great opponent, my reputation among the guardians has grown.
nilah_2_scene_420_text: Yet precious few know the true me. Most who did are gone… a fact I’ve learned to accept. Embrace, even.
nilah_2_scene_430_text: You two have a special bond of friendship. Whether you realize it or not, you are each other’s lights, and reason to fight on against all odds.
nilah_2_scene_460_text: Ha! Let your feud go on a little longer. Time and shared trials will do you wonders.
nilah_2_scene_470_text: Tell me, have you ever faced a monster so titanic it blots out the sky? Or an enemy so insidious that you cannot escape it no matter where you turn?
nilah_2_scene_500_text: Two powerful opponents, but I mean physically large. Gigantic. Epic in scale and ferocity.
nilah_2_scene_510_text: Uh… not yet… I don’t think...?
nilah_2_scene_530_text: Oh, I don’t like that look.
nilah_2_scene_540_text: Nilah, what are you planning on doing?! Isn’t that your “excited about giant monsters” face?
nilah_2_scene_550_text: Is it? I only have the one expression. Nuance sometimes escapes me.
nilah_2_scene_560_text: I have devised another lesson for your squad—one that will engage me as much as it does you.
nilah_2_scene_570_text: Wait, no! You can’t lure any giant monsters into the city!
nilah_2_scene_580_text: Y-yeah! There are some lines even I won’t cross! Hot monsters? Sure. Scary? Definitely. But giant? People could get hurt!
nilah_2_scene_590_text: Ah, look at the time. I must be off.
nilah_2_scene_600_text: Nilah! H-hey! This isn’t how we’re supposed to train!
nilah_2_scene_610_text: We're gonna have to fight a huge monster, aren’t we?
nilah_2_scene_150a_10_text: I did. Kassadin is a good man. You are very lucky to have him.
nilah_2_scene_150b_10_text: Don’t worry. Your training area is impressively remote, considering the view of the city. Your secrets are safe.
nilah_2_scene_150c_10_text: I’m sorry, what did you say?
nilah_2_scene_150c_20_text: If I was physically capable of frowning, I would frown at you. Consider this my smile-frown.
nilah_2_scene_390a_10_text: Am I a hot star monster, or a scary star monster?
nilah_2_scene_390a_20_text: Whichever one is more fun for you.
nilah_2_scene_390b_10_text: Always? That’s funny. You’re very funny.
nilah_2_scene_390b_20_text: What? Is that not how we’re supposed to operate?
nilah_2_scene_390b_30_text: Not even a little. Star Guardian recruits are almost always teenagers. Insubordination… Drama… It all comes with the territory.
nilah_2_scene_390c_10_text: I don’t understand. Do you need another father figure? You have an actual father.
nilah_2_scene_390c_20_text: She’s desperate for Lux’s approval, and you’ve talked to Lux at least once. It’s this weird mentor-student thing.
nilah_2_scene_390c_40_text: That explains all this… Star Guardian merchandise?! I have some uncomfortable questions about the state of this planet.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_10_text: Look at this quiet little city… everyone going about their day… living their lives, chasing their dreams…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_30_text: Flood the land with darkness… Drown everything in sorrow…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_60_text: W-wait… There’s… so many of them...! They’re filling the streets!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_70_text: What do we do?! They’re moving too fast...! A… aaghhh!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_80_text: Justice is a lie… Order is the chain of the wicked master…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_90_text: Be free from your bed of chaos, writhing beasts of shadow!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_110_text: That’s not possible! The Star Guardians destroyed that thing!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_130_text: Is this…? Is this the end of the world?! Everybody, run!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_150_text: Yes! YES! Destroy them all! End love, devour mercy!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_160_text: And above all… bring me the Star Guardians!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_170_text: Y’know, I somehow wasn’t expecting it to get this bad.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_190_text: Beasts of ancient darkness, let us claim our joy! Face me!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_200_text: Glad Nilah’s having fun, at least. Good for her.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_220_text: I’m as excited as everyone else to get out there and fight, but Captain… there are thousands of monsters. They’re everywhere!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_230_text: I’ve seen at least twenty Dark Heralds so far. We needed half the team and an Outer Guardian to take down even one…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_240_text: What do we do? Unless we can locate Morgana, we’re…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_290_text: Okay, is this about the “me teaming up with Morgana” thing? Because that was just a smart and deeply cool strategy.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_310_text: Yeah… sorry to say, Captain… but I don’t think we can trust her.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_320_text: What?! This is Akali we’re talking about! She’s fought side by side with us from day one!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_330_text: I was your cool on-again off-again co-captain. Y’know, until Kai’Sa started being a jerk and I quit.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_350_text: Okay, ask me anything. How do I prove I won’t betray you immediately?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_360_responseB: How do we stop this before the city is destroyed?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_360_responseC: Is this a complicated double-cross that I will regret falling for?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_400_text: Captain… figure this out first. We’ll save everyone we can until then.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_410_text: Dang. I was hoping they’d stick around.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_420_text: Akali, I’m sorry… They didn’t mean what they said…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_430_text: Nilah brought you to me for a reason… and I know that once we stop this invasion, we’ll finally be the heroes we’ve always dreamt of being…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_440_text: And then… maybe… you and I can finally patch things up.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_450_text: Or… at least I’d like to try.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_460_text: That’s real sweet of you, Kai. I’m glad Nilah brought me to you, too.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_470_text: It saved me a lot of trouble trying to hunt you down myself.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_500_text: Gosh, you really did believe that love and friendship were gonna save the day.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_510_text: A… kali… Ow! I don’t… I don’t want to fight you...!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_540_text: Man, this is so easy! Everyone’s distracted… You’re refusing to fight back… This could not have gone better.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_550_text: It bears repeating that Morgana said I could break my contract with the First Star. That I’ll never die… unless I want to. But who would want to, bahaha?!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_570_text: I wanna show you a cool knife trick.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_590_text: What do you want?! I’m doing what you told me to do! That’s our deal!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_600_text: No… I want to watch you kill her in front of me. I want to see the hope drain from her heart. In some ways… it’s all I’ve ever wanted, hmhmhmhmh.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_610_text: Star Guardians! I summon you… to me!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_620_text: This place again? Boo. Get a better house.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_630_text: I’ll let that slide, considering all you’ve done for me. Now… show me the girl.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_650_text: Your little friends aren’t here to help you this time, little guardian. With their leader slain… I doubt I’ll have much trouble picking them off one by one.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_660_text: First Quinn, of course… which will send that Rell into a tailspin. She might even take Taliyah down with her.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_670_text: Sona’s connection to Ekko… Is it friendship? Romance? Trauma bonding? Who cares! Strike at one, and the other falls with them.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_680_text: Nilah presents a problem on her own… but without any guardians to protect, she might simply… leave. Or she might not, and I’ll just end her myself.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_700_text: Absolutely stellar choice of last words, my dear. Poetry… really.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_710_text: Dear Akali, would you do the honors...?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_750_text: You… you tricked me?! After everything I’ve done?!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_760_text: I mean, I thought it would fall apart during the whole boo hoo crying thing. “Tell everyone I’m sorry!” Heh.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_770_text: But your ego is so massive you bought it completely. You even let me talk juuuust long enough for reinforcements to get here.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_780_text: A well-planned betrayal, Akali. You have a knack for subterfuge.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_790_text: There y’all are. Finally, we can end this… Rewinding time is so tiring.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_810_text: Miss Sona says, “Kick her…” Oh, Miss Sona, do I really have to say that? M-Miss Sona? Why do you look so mad?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_820_text: Finally, I can finally test my new “super samurai fist punch” out on someone! Chu chu!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_830_text: Honestly, we can drop the name. A good, old-fashioned armored charge works just as well.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_840_text: Valor and I have eyes on the enemy. She’s not going anywhere this time.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_870_text: Hey, Kai. Ready to end this once and for all?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_880_text: Kali… I thought you’d never ask.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_890_text: A real fight then? One last battle to decide the fate of the world?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_900_text: What a disgusting little band of cretins you are. Such utter foolishness. I’ll make you all suffer!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_920_text: We might not get another chance like this!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_940_text: Say the word, and I’ll dive in!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_950_text: Please, children… I taught you all year long… I looked you in the eyes every day and watched you squirm.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_960_text: So, go ahead. I encourage you to try me.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_970_text: Then let it be done! Joy will carry you unto oblivion!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1000_text: And now I, what? Disintegrate while screaming, “Noooo!”?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1010_text: You have no idea the kind of power I wield!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1020_text: Look, children! Look what you’ve made me do!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1030_text: Ugh! She’s got me! Sona, are you okay?!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1050_text: This power?! This is what I felt before… The power of entropy...!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1090_text: I’ll always be there for you…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1110_text: That… will never change...! I promise!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1120_text: Oh, this woman is so dead.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1130_text: Is this the power of the First Star...?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1140_text: Not bad, to be honest. I kinda like it.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1150_text: Everyone, focus your attacks! We’re not letting some third-rate homeroom teacher take us down!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1160_text: Sona, let’s show her how we take care of business.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1180_text: Ultimate Star Surf Power: Crushing Wave!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1200_text: It’s over, Morgana! No one hurts my friends! No one!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1210_text: At long last… a battle of mythical proportions! They will sing of our victory until the end of time!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1220_text: What?! What is this?! Am I to die as some cliche?! Disintegrated by the power of… friendship?!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1230_text: No! I had so much more to conquer...!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1240_text: I’m in, Kai! I’ve got your back!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1250_text: One last push! Kali, let’s do it!
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1280_text: The cycle of the First Light… and the Dark Star…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1300_text: We did it, Kai’Sa. We saved the city. We’re the heroes they’ll believe in, now.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1320_text: I’m just glad we came through this… together…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1340_text: Hey, Kai! You want one of these dango-shaped dango, or can I have all three?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1350_text: Go for it. I filled up on Noodle Bill’s special winter holiday ramen. Three bowls… because Tali and Rell got distracted by a snowball fight…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1360_text: I think I might explode. But that’s probably okay...? He gave me this as a prize. Maybe to puke in. I’m not sure yet.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1370_text: Ha! You’ll get used to it. A meal is something you defeat. Like a monster. Or that math test I failed.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1380_text: Heh heh. I guess you’re right.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1400_text: H-hey… Akali… I… I just wanted to apologize. You know. For… well, everything.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1430_text: You were being a single-minded jerk, true. But we’re all jerks sometimes. And in the end… I guess… that’s okay.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1440_text: Plus, I got these cool new powers! I can turn empty on command! Isn’t that awesome?! I look cool as hell.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1460_text: So… what do we do now that the city is safe once more? Help rebuild? It’s still pretty messed up. Or we could get part-time jobs at the mall.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1470_text: I don’t know! I guess we… keep protecting the universe? Nobody saw us save the world this time. With our third year coming up, there should be plenty of drama.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1490_text: How are there so many monsters?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1500_text: Who knows? I guess it’ll always be a mystery.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1530_text: Hello. I’m told you’re the captain of the new squad.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1560_text: You need to talk to Xayah. She’s over there licking Rakan’s ear.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1580_text: …Hey. Thanks for believing in me, Kai.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1590_text: Best friends forever? And I really mean it. Nothing will ever come between us again.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1600_text: Sure thing. Just get comfy, because forever might be a long, long time.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1620_text: Ugh… My head… I must have had too much punch…
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1660_text: [You are the one who stands against me.]
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1700_text: [Daughter of Light. Cast adrift, unmoored from time.]
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1720_text: [My cycle cannot be broken. The unending ring of sound, then light, then nothing. The spokes of an eternal wheel, spinning for untold ages.]
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1740_text: [You are not the first to rise in challenge. You will not be the last.]
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1750_text: [Just as the light has her children, I have mine. They will descend upon your universe as locusts, consuming everything.]
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1760_text: [You will not survive the coming dark. Destroying my servant has only delayed the sweet embrace of oblivion.]
chapter_4_act_3_scene_1770_text: [You shall stand before me again, Daughter of Light. And only then, as you gaze upon the broken bodies of a trillion souls, will you understand the weight of your failure.]
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370a_10_text: Hmm. Long answer? She wants to get rid of the Star Guardians. Permanently.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370a_20_text: What? How’s she going to do that? Even if all of us fall… the First Star will just choose a new squad.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370a_30_text: I’m not sure… She keeps talking about darkness and entropy… how nothing should exist at all.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370a_40_text: All I know is we have to stop her fast. She’s feeding on the misery of this invasion, and it’s making her absurdly powerful.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370b_10_text: Morgana’s the key. Don’t worry about the small fry, or the medium fry, or those giant singing crab things...
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370b_20_text: Stop Morgana, and all this ends.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370b_30_text: Okay, great plan. But how do we even get to her?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370b_40_text: It’s not going to be easy… but it’s not impossible.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370c_10_text: I mean… it could be. You have no way of knowing.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370c_20_text: Morgana offered me something you can’t give me, Kai. Freedom from my oath… freedom from death.
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370c_30_text: No way… She can do that...?
chapter_4_act_3_scene_370c_40_text: I’m… I’m not sure yet. But she made the offer. The fact that I’m here instead—that should be all the proof you need.
ekko_1_scene_10_text: Alright, there’s no way you’ll be able to compute this equation at such a speed.
ekko_1_scene_40_text: [Hm. Professor Ikari’s been testing Ekko to see if he can answer different math problems… before she can type them into a calculator.]
ekko_1_scene_50_text: [He’s using his Star Guardian powers right out in the open. Idiot!]
ekko_1_scene_90_text: What can I say? This man’s got all the answers.
ekko_1_scene_110_text: If I could rewind time, I definitely wouldn’t use it to impress my math class.
ekko_1_scene_120_text: You’d probably go back to last week, when you fell on your face in front of the entire class.
ekko_1_scene_130_text: Akali, you fool! Why didn’t you double knot your laces?!
ekko_1_scene_140_text: …Do you think we should talk to him?
ekko_1_scene_150_text: Ekko? What, for the answers to the big test on Friday?
ekko_1_scene_160_text: No! Talk to him about misusing his Star Guardian abilities.
ekko_1_scene_170_text: This again? You worry too much. I mean, it’s not like he’s gonna get caught.
ekko_1_scene_180_text: And even if he does, he can just rewind time to before he gets caught. Problem solved.
ekko_1_scene_200_text: Being a Star Guardian is about responsibility. Honor. Loyal—
ekko_1_scene_210_text: I took the oath the same day as you. We’re co-leaders. Not that anyone seems to remember…
ekko_1_scene_220_text: If it’s bugging you so much, go talk to the kid. Use your powers of being a giant buzzkill.
ekko_1_scene_240_text: [There he is… It's like he’s avoiding me…]
ekko_1_scene_270_text: Been asking around for you. Feel like I keep showing up right after you leave.
ekko_1_scene_300_text: How strange. I sort of have that problem, too…
ekko_1_scene_310_text: I can’t hang out this weekend.
ekko_1_scene_320_text: I have a… project I’m working on.
ekko_1_scene_330_text: I didn’t ask you to hang out.
ekko_1_scene_340_text: Oh. Well, you were going to.
ekko_1_scene_350_text: You’ve already had this conversation before, haven’t you?
ekko_1_scene_370_text: There were a couple repeats where I managed to sneak away. Those were my favorites.
ekko_1_scene_370_responseA: So you were avoiding me? I knew it!
ekko_1_scene_370_responseB: Well, this version of me managed to track you down.
ekko_1_scene_370_responseC: That’s it, hand over the time egg before you summon a planet-eating lava parasite.
ekko_1_scene_390_text: You can’t keep doing this, Ekko. Rewinding conversations so you say the right thing. Rewinding math class so you have the right answer…
ekko_1_scene_400_text: I’m not cheating at math! Why do you always say that?
ekko_1_scene_420_text: No. I’m just good at solving advanced equations in my head.
ekko_1_scene_430_text: [Huh. Guess that makes sense. The kid is a brainiac, after all.]
ekko_1_scene_460_text: And what point was that… captain?
ekko_1_scene_470_text: My point was that, as your cap… Ugh, I’m telling you to only use your abilities to…
ekko_1_scene_500_text: Wasn’t a guess. And… you don’t have to worry. I can never change the past anyways. Not when it really matters.
ekko_1_scene_520_responseA: What exactly is the project you’re working on?
ekko_1_scene_520_responseB: Do you have the math homework?
ekko_1_scene_520_responseC: What am I going to say next?
ekko_1_scene_550_text: [I’m not giving up on you that easy, kid.]
ekko_1_scene_570_text: [Okay, so following Ekko home might not have been a high point for me as a Star Guardian…]
ekko_1_scene_580_text: [...but I have to figure out what he’s up to.]
ekko_1_scene_610_text: Huh. You’re earlier than last time… captain.
ekko_1_scene_530a_10_text: It’s a surprise. Or a… secret.
ekko_1_scene_530b_10_text: You seriously want to cheat off me?
ekko_1_scene_530b_20_text: After making me feel bad for cheating?
ekko_1_scene_530b_40_text: I-I wasn’t going to cheat. I just wanted to… compare answers.
ekko_1_scene_530c_10_text: “That wasn’t what I was gonna say. “
ekko_1_scene_530c_20_text: That wasn’t what I was gonna s—
quinn_2_scene_20_text: [Which means it’s just Quinn and me…]
quinn_2_scene_40_responseB: They have the best matcha ever!
quinn_2_scene_40_responseC: Anything with peach in it. There are like, six peach things.
quinn_2_scene_60_text: Rell generally prefers places that have ranges of peppers on their menu.
quinn_2_scene_70_text: Anything under three peppers is coward food.
quinn_2_scene_90_text: So you guys are partners on some school thing?
quinn_2_scene_110_text: We each have to give a presentation about our life. We’re just working together.
quinn_2_scene_120_text: And you’re gonna tell them how we punch monsters so hard they explode, right?
quinn_2_scene_130_text: We can’t talk about being Star Guardians.
quinn_2_scene_140_text: Why not? In Kiiso, we did it all the time.
quinn_2_scene_190_text: Valoran City isn’t like Kiiso though. We can’t reveal our identities. We—
quinn_2_scene_210_text: The students at the corner table appear to be in a heated argument about “Beastman Chronicles: the Pitmaster Saga!” I better make sure this doesn’t turn violent!
quinn_2_scene_220_text: It sort of just seems like a friendly disagreement -
quinn_2_scene_230_text: I’ll keep an eye on them K! For Star Guardian reasons! Not because their conversation is interesting to me in any way!
quinn_2_scene_240_text: … So your hometown. It’s called Kiiso?
quinn_2_scene_250_text: Yeah. We both grew up there, but didn’t speak too much before she took the oath.
quinn_2_scene_270_text: We… came from different social circles. You’ll have to ask her about it.
quinn_2_scene_310_text: Oh, I didn’t mean anything by it!
quinn_2_scene_330_text: It’s hard for her to open up to people. But once you get to know her, she’ll always be there for you.
quinn_2_scene_350_text: Back in Kiiso, we’d take on HUGE monsters, dozens of them, just the two of us. There was no one I’d rather have in my corner.
quinn_2_scene_360_text: I’m surprised you even get monsters all the way out there.
quinn_2_scene_370_text: Valoran City isn’t the only place that needs defending.
quinn_2_scene_390_text: I had to train her. Alone. And Rell has… issues… with authority figures.
quinn_2_scene_400_text: All I had to go on were Lux’s quotes in the Official Star Guardian Daily Planner. And I don’t think most of them are authentic.
quinn_2_scene_410_text: Oh! I have one of those. Mine is… more full than I would like.
quinn_2_scene_420_text: Do you have the Ahri Erasable Pen too?
quinn_2_scene_450_text: Yeah… and it matches the Daily Planner so well…
quinn_2_scene_460_text: Sorry, Quinn. I know fighting alone for so long wasn’t easy for you.
quinn_2_scene_480_text: Kiiso was our home. It had our friends, our family… I was happy to protect it.
quinn_2_scene_490_text: You really miss it, don’t you?
quinn_2_scene_510_text: Before I was a Star Guardian… things were simpler. I remember when a day at the mall was an adventure.
quinn_2_scene_520_text: I remember when the scariest monster I’d ever seen was just in a movie at the cineplex.
quinn_2_scene_530_text: Ha! One year my dad took me to see Night of the Xer’Sai, and I couldn’t sleep for a month.
quinn_2_scene_540_text: I used to get pretty scared.
quinn_2_scene_550_responseA: Of course! It’s not weak to be afraid.
quinn_2_scene_550_responseB: I mean, I would never cover my eyes or anything. At least not all the way…
quinn_2_scene_550_responseC: Yeah, I hated the old High Noon Gothic movies. Those demons are freaky.
quinn_2_scene_570_text: You know, Quinn… it’s okay to let us know you’re scared. Otherwise, they’ll never feel safe… not even around you.
quinn_2_scene_580_text: Did you read that one in the Daily Planner?
quinn_2_scene_610_text: I don’t know how you do it… School and a full team of guardians. Plus, I heard you were all at the Battle of the Twilight Star… We only saw it on the news.
quinn_2_scene_620_text: I struggled with just one guardian! And zero giant invasions!
quinn_2_scene_630_text: Sometimes, I’m not so sure I am doing it. Things fall through the cracks… People get hurt.
quinn_2_scene_640_text: You saw what happened with Akali. That’s been going on since the school year started.
quinn_2_scene_650_text: Hhrm. Well, I’m sure you’ll handle it.
quinn_2_scene_660_text: It seems like you always do.
quinn_2_scene_670_text: I miss home a lot, of course… and everyone there. But talking to you… I feel a little better, I think. Just seeing you rise above the situation.
quinn_2_scene_690_text: Q. K. The situation has been handled. Did you finish your homework?
quinn_2_scene_710_text: You said you’d go to the mall with me today.
quinn_2_scene_740_text: Rell, calm down! Haha! A promise is a promise.
quinn_2_scene_750_text: I knew I could count on you, Q! We better head over now! You know how long those lines get!
quinn_2_scene_780_text: Yeah, I get it. The things we do for our squads.
quinn_2_scene_790_text: Rell will tell you about her secret hobby eventually. But I want to let her do it on her own terms, ya know?
quinn_2_scene_800_text: Of course. Have fun, you two!
quinn_2_scene_810_text: Thanks! It was nice talking about, you know, everything!
quinn_2_scene_830_text: Minor grammar error here. And this should be an ellipsis… Move this image over to here…
quinn_2_scene_840_text: Not that I would ever… want to do… double the homework…
quinn_2_scene_560a_10_text: I guess… sometimes you have to be strong for other people. Even when everything changes.
quinn_2_scene_560a_20_text: I just wish I didn’t always have to, you know? It would make things a lot easier…
quinn_2_scene_560b_10_text: Yeah… you have to learn to keep the fear inside. People here are counting on us to be brave… and everyone back home, too.
quinn_2_scene_560b_20_text: Is that why you wear a mask?
quinn_2_scene_560b_30_text: Oh, uh… no. I just think it looks really cool. And it hides my identity.
quinn_2_scene_560b_40_text: Not sure why you still don’t wear one. Eventually somebody will catch on.
quinn_2_scene_560c_10_text: Oh! The one where the cow-skull devil fights the half-demon cowboy?
quinn_2_scene_560c_20_text: Yeah, and in the sequel, there’s a mechanical angel. Pretty sure they just released a new one about a train heist, but it looks really scary…
quinn_2_scene_560c_30_text: High Noon Gothic 4: Devil of the Sulfur Rail! Rell’s already seen it six times. Apparently, this one guy explodes… so it might not be the movie for me.
quinn_2_scene_560c_40_text: Or me. I’m fine with my regular Star Guardian night terrors, thanks.
sona_1_scene_10_text: [RING RONG RING RONG. DING DONG DING DONG.]
sona_1_scene_50_text: [...but Sona’s already shown up late to most of her classes.]
sona_1_scene_100_text: She’s so quiet… How does she manage to move without making any noise?
sona_1_scene_110_text: This is ridiculous! I trained for so long, and Sona’s naturally that stealthy? UGH!
sona_1_scene_130_text: I could sneak past any teacher if I wanted.
sona_1_scene_140_text: I just prefer to arrive on time.
sona_1_scene_160_text: Maybe you’d be better at sneaking if you learned to be quiet every once in a while.
sona_1_scene_180_text: Yesterday, we left off talking about the different types of chemical bonds.
sona_1_scene_190_text: Can anyone tell me what a covalent bond is?
sona_1_scene_210_text: [Ulp! You have got to be kidding me!]
sona_1_scene_210_responseB: I think Akali knows this one.
sona_1_scene_230_text: …A covalent bond is when two atoms share electrons.
sona_1_scene_240_text: It’s my personal favorite bond. Aside from my bond with Mrs. Chuba!
sona_1_scene_260_text: A little teacher humor there. Anybody? No? Well, moving on…
sona_1_scene_270_text: Okay, I mean, sure, his speech was cheesy, but the professor did sort of make me realize something.
sona_1_scene_280_text: Inertia is a property of matter?
sona_1_scene_290_text: Inertia is the… Were we at the same lecture?
sona_1_scene_300_text: Nope. I was on my phone. They added new levels in Hyper Crystal Dungeon Mobile.
sona_1_scene_310_text: I need to get to know Sona better.
sona_1_scene_320_text: How did you get that from a science class?
sona_1_scene_330_text: Working together, combining the best parts of a thing to make an even more powerful whole.
sona_1_scene_340_text: It’s just like being Star Guardians.
sona_1_scene_350_text: This again. So now you’re using chemistry as an excuse to hang out with your team?
sona_1_scene_370_text: Okay, but why Sona and not, for instance, me?
sona_1_scene_380_text: I already know you too well.
sona_1_scene_400_text: Oh! Here she comes! I’ll, uh… talk to you later!
sona_1_scene_440_responseB: What did you think of the lecture?
sona_1_scene_450_text: [Sona rotates her wrist rapidly back and forth.]
sona_1_scene_480_text: Nice! We are in agreement… I think!
sona_1_scene_490_text: By the way… Akali and I noticed that you’ve been late to class a couple times.
sona_1_scene_500_text: It’s not a huge deal. As long as you aren’t late to our battles against the forces of darkness.
sona_1_scene_530_text: Well, if you want to, erm… tell me about it—what’s going on—I’m here.
sona_1_scene_550_text: [Oh, shoot. I don’t know sign language!]
sona_1_scene_560_text: It’s the people, Miss Kai’Sa. They’re running around like mice in a maze!
sona_1_scene_570_text: Chiizu?! You shouldn’t be here! You’ll give us away!
sona_1_scene_580_text: I’ve been here every day! To most non-guardians, I’m invisible unless they know what they’re looking for. Nobody can see me!
sona_1_scene_590_text: Not even you, Miss Kai’Sa! …Except for right now. When you can. Because we’re talking.
sona_1_scene_600_text: Interesting. Must be why nobody ever mentions the other familiars…
sona_1_scene_610_text: But you’re right. It’s too dangerous for me to be talking here… If anyone notices, they might focus on me. And that would blow our cover!
sona_1_scene_620_text: Meet Miss Sona and I at the mall. We’ll explain everything.
sona_1_scene_640_text: And by we, I of course mean… she! She will explain everything! I’m just a humble translator!
sona_1_scene_650_text: I gotta get outta here! Squeak!
sona_1_scene_660_text: Oh. Well, I guess I’ll meet you two… later, then? Please don’t kill each other?
sona_1_scene_670_text: [Sona waves goodbye, then turns angrily toward Chiizu.]
sona_1_scene_680_text: RUN AWAY! SHE’S BRIMMING WITH RAGE!
sona_1_scene_700_text: Professor, one of the lab rats escaped!
sona_1_scene_710_text: Sona was chasing it through the hall! And I think it was wearing… glasses?!
sona_1_scene_220a_10_text: I mean… yes. That’s technically correct.
sona_1_scene_220a_30_text: But not the answer I was looking for.
sona_1_scene_220c_10_text: Are you saying you don’t know the answer?
sona_1_scene_220c_30_text: No, you don’t know the answer? Or no, you know the answer?
sona_1_scene_220c_40_text: I invoke my right to an attorney.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_10_text: …I hope your weekend was exciting, everyone.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_20_text: I’m sure it went better for some of you than others.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_40_text: Maybe even just one of you. Not naming names… Akali.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_50_text: Don't listen to her, Kali. She’s just mad that her plan got disrupted.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_60_text: My lesson plan, that is. And when I find out who did it, there will be consequences.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_70_responseB: Where’d you say you got your teaching credentials again?
chapter_3_act_2_scene_70_responseC: Hey, Nilah. What do you think about that?
chapter_3_act_2_scene_90_text: So remember, class… I’ll be watching you. Waiting.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_100_text: And just when you think you’ve lost… when you think you’re on the verge of defeat… when you feel like you can’t bear any more…
chapter_3_act_2_scene_120_text: I’ll spring my trap. And then the true suffering will begin.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_130_text: Why isn’t the class reacting?! It’s like they can’t hear what she’s saying!
chapter_3_act_2_scene_140_text: Her aura is too strong… They’re trapped in an illusion.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_150_text: No way! Is the entire city like this?!
chapter_3_act_2_scene_160_text: In time, my dear. In time.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_170_text: Now, who’s ready for a pop quiz?
chapter_3_act_2_scene_180_text: Kali, try not to let Morgana get to you. We’ll find a way to stop her.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_200_text: With Quinn and Rell joining us… not to mention Nilah… we’ve got enough heavy hitters on our team to take her down. You don’t have to be afraid.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_210_text: I just… wish I could believe you.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_230_text: It’s not going to end with Morgana. After she’s gone, then who are we fighting? Syndra? Zoe?
chapter_3_act_2_scene_240_text: They said they’d come back. What happens when they do?
chapter_3_act_2_scene_250_text: Then we’ll fight them, and we’ll win.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_260_text: Will we? What if it’s something even stronger than they are? Are we supposed to keep throwing ourselves at monsters until we die?
chapter_3_act_2_scene_270_text: I… I don’t know. We just have to keep fighting… and hope one day that we’ll be safe.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_290_text: They call this tree “the wishing tree.” Apparently, if you wish for something hard enough, it will grant your deepest desire…
chapter_3_act_2_scene_300_text: I’ve been thinking a lot, Kai. I keep having these dreams… dreams where I die, or worse… where I turn into a monster…
chapter_3_act_2_scene_310_text: I… I wish I had never joined the Star Guardians…
chapter_3_act_2_scene_330_text: Why? Is thinking that so wrong?
chapter_3_act_2_scene_330_responseA: The guardians need you, Akali. I need you.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_330_responseB: We’re in this together. Best friends forever, remember?
chapter_3_act_2_scene_330_responseC: I never think, and it’s been working out for me.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_360_text: How about this: we spend some time together, just you and me? Hit all the spots around town, just like we used to.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_370_text: Just like we used to, huh...?
chapter_3_act_2_scene_400_text: Alright. Yeah, we can do that.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_420_text: I’m totally serious. No Star Guardian talk though. I don’t want to hear about fighting monsters or saving the world.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_430_text: It’ll be hard for me, but it’s a deal.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_440_text: And just you and me, okay? I want this to be a day for us.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_450_text: I love everybody… You know I do. But since school started, we’ve barely been able to get some alone time.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_460_text: You were my best friend, Kai… I just want to get back to that…
chapter_3_act_2_scene_470_text: I promise we will, Kali. I promise.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_480_text: Text me tomorrow, and I’ll meet you bright and early, alright? No excuses!
chapter_3_act_2_scene_490_text: While I personally think it’s disgusting, I know how much you like Noodle Bill’s Breakfast Ramen.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_500_text: It comes with unlimited seasoned eggs! You cannot beat that deal!
chapter_3_act_2_scene_510_text: …I’m really glad we’re doing this, Akali. Really.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_540_text: How emotional of you. Friendship! Love! Working things out!
chapter_3_act_2_scene_550_text: It’s enough to make me vomit.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_560_text: I just… couldn’t leave things the way they were.
chapter_3_act_2_scene_570_text: Of course not, my dear. You humans have always been so sentimental.
